loans.name: Mahjabeen

texts.en:
Mahjabeen is a 41-year-old married woman who lives with her spouse and 5 children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a hawker and sells fresh vegetables door-to-door in the streets. He is very famous in town due to the freshness of his vegetables. Her husband is a very hard worker. He has to go to the vegetable market to purchase fresh vegetables early in the morning every day. A few days ago, her husband's cart collided with a car and the cart was damaged. Some vegetables were also smashed because of this accident. Now, her husband wants to repair the cart and align the wheels of the cart. He also wants to purchase vegetables such as lady fingers, lemons, tomatoes, potatoes, cauliflower and green chillies. Mahjabeen does not have her kith and kin in Lahore from whom to borrow some money. Mahjabeen has requested a loan of 28,000 PKR from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband will spend a portion of this amount to repair the cart and the rest to buy fresh vegetables to sell.

Mahjabeen wants a proper vegetable shop for her husband, instead of a cart. Her dream to pass her life with peace and calm with her family. Mahjabeen is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as lady fingers, lemons, tomatoes, potatoes, cauliflower and green chillies.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a retail rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 22 years. Analiza earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of NWTF loans. She dreams of saving enough money to be able to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Vaipanoa

texts.en:
Vaipanoa is 51 years old, married, and has five children. She would like to start a small sewing business. In order to do so, Vaipanoa needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, materials, needles, thread, and cleaning oil. 

She hopes to use her profit to assist her family financially and save money for her children's education. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, materials, needles, thread, and cleaning oil

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento SANTA MARIA Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas mujeres, la  presidenta del banco es la Sra. Juana tiene 54 años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la localidad de El Torno,  es cliente nueva de la institución ya que es su primera secuencia, la Sra. Juana va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, manteca y levadura por mayor para la elaboración de pan, la Sra. Juana es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, también se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a su compañeras  de grupo.
texts.en: The entrepreneurial bank Santa Maria consists of eight members, all women. The president of the bank is Señora Juana, who is 54 years old. She makes and sells bread. Her bakery is located in the El Torno district. She is a new client of this institution, since this is her first loan cycle. Señora Juana is going to use this loan to buy ingredients for making bread, such as flour, lard, and leavening, wholesale. Señora Juana is a person with the will to achieve. She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support offered her, since this is the only activity [she has] that allows her to support herself and her family. She also feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support offered to her fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, lard, and leavening wholesale

loans.name: Tasneem

texts.en:
Tasneem is a  49 years-old lady. She has been running her business of hand embroidery for many years to contribute in the family's income. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her community and she makes enough to lead a decent life. 

Due to the increase in demand for her embroidery designs she is employing other women in her business to work for her. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and health care. To cope with the increasing demands of her customers, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy stocks of threads, sequins and pearls in different colors. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy thread, sequins and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites operates her general store in the village of Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur where she lives with her family. Her husband is a rice farmer and she helps to earn an income by selling goods in the community. She has been running this business since she got married. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase oil, spices, canned goods and milk. She planned to expand her store in order to gain more profit for the bright future of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase oil, spices, canned goods and milk

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen is a 34-year-old married woman. For the past many years, she has been successfully running a business of animal sales with the support of her husband. She has one cow and five goats. She looks after the cattle and her husband sells them to the people of their town and in the local market. She makes enough money to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her 5th loan cycle and applied for a loan of Rs. 35,000. This will help her to purchase two more goats. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Mamao

texts.en:
Mamao is a 37 years-old married woman with no children. She would like to start growing peanuts to earn a living. Mamao has requested a loan to buy sacks of unripe peanuts, a rake, pickaxe, wheelbarrow and fertilizer. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Mamao will spend her profits to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy sacks of unripe peanuts, a rake, pickaxe, wheelbarrow and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nos

texts.en:
Nos lives in a small village in Reussey Keo district of Phnom Penh with her husband and children. Nos works to care for her family and keep her house well-prepared. The main source of income is generated by her husband who is involved in selling natural medicines in the surrounding areas and the nearby provinces. Her husband, Chea, strives hard in trading the medicine and uses a selling method he knows to achieve the maximum amount of profit as possible.

Her husband currently needs to buy more medicines to sustain his business. That’s why she has requested a loan amount of 1,200 US dollars to invest in the purchase of natural medicines, and thereby increase their sales. She is grateful for the support HKL and Kiva funds have provided her.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of natural medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open another cafe.

loans.name: Rubidia

texts.es:
Rubidia, vive con su esposo de 49 años de edad y su suegra de 82 años de edad, todos trabajan y luchan cada día por su bienestar. Ella, posee una tienda y comedor, dicha actividad la realiza todos los días de 6:00am a 10:00pm, lo desempeña desde  hace 15 años.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar granos básicos tales como: frijol, maíz, arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, golosinas, entre otros productos; esta inversión le ayudara a mantenerse en el negocio y obtener ganancias para su familia.
Su sueño es tener una casa propia donde vivir.
texts.en:
Rubidia lives with her 49-year-old spouse and her 82-year-old mother-in-law. They all work and struggle each day for their well-being. Rubidia owns a store and restaurant, an activity which she does from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm. She has had it for 15 years.

The loan she is requesting would allow her to buy basic foods such as: beans, corn, rice, sugar, oil, salt, and sweets, among other products. This will help her to maintain her business and earn profits for her family. 

Her dream is to have their own house to live in.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, rice, sugar, oil, salt, and candies.

loans.name: María Eloisa

texts.es: María Eloisa es una mujer casada y madre de 2 hijos. Actualmente se dedica a confeccionar y hacer reparaciones de ropa, labor que realiza en compañía de su esposo durante largas jornadas diarias para cumplir con las solicitudes de sus clientes y, de esta manera obtiene los ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Conoció la actividad porque es una tradición familiar que ha tenido trascendencia en el tiempo. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea realizar el mantenimiento de las máquinas de coser y comprar un lote de telas, con el fin de tener más variedad para ofrecerle a sus clientes y entregar un producto bien terminado; de esta forma espera incrementar sus ingresos. Su principal sueño es continuar con su negocio, mejorar el servicio y las ventas para poder seguir aportando al sostenimiento de su hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Eloisa is a married woman and the mother of 2 children. Now she works in making and doing repairs on clothing, work that she does along with her husband during long work days to fill the orders of her customers. In this way she obtains the income to satisfy the basic needs of her household. She is familiar with this business because it is a family tradition that has had significance over time. With the loan that she is applying for with the corporation, she wants to do maintenance on the sewing machines and buy a batch of fabrics, with the goal of having more variety to offer her customers and delivering a well-finished product. In this way she hopes to increase her income. Her principal dream is to continue with her business and improve her service and sales to be able to continue contributing to the sustenance of her household and having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to do maintenance on the sewing machinges and buy a batch of fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy DVDs

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, necesita más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio de tortillas, por lo que requiere de un nuevo préstamo, este le permitirá comprar la materia prima necesaria tales como: maíz, leña y gas.
Las condiciones económicas han mejorado, gracias al crédito anterior, ya que le ayudo a fortalecer su negocio y con las ganancias logro aportar a su familia con los gastos de la alimentación.
texts.en:
Juana is requesting another loan because she needs more money to continue investing in her tortilla business. This will allow her to buy necessary ingredients, such as corn, firewood, and gas. 

Juana's economic condition has improved, thanks to her previous loan, since it helped her to strengthen her business. With the earnings, she was able to support her family and take care of their nutritional needs.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and gas.

loans.name: Vaoiva

texts.en:
Vaoiva is 47 years old and married with two children. She plans to start a business selling general products for everyday use. She has requested a loan to buy a bag of sugar, flour, rice, a box of herring, a box of corned beef, and a box of chicken. 

Vaoiva will use her profits to buy more stock for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, flour, rice, a box of herring, a box of corned beef, and a box of chicken.

loans.name: Erlina

texts.en:
Erlina is 34 years old and lives in Camanga, Tukuran. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer, and she helps operate their farm. She's been doing this business for more than eight years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 6,200 to cover the costs of weeding maintenance and buying manure for fertilizer.  

In the future, Erlina hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to cover the costs of weeding maintenance and manure for fertilizer.

loans.name: Seipula

texts.en:
Seipula, 47, is a very kind and hard-working man. He lives with his wife and daughter. 

Seipula works very hard to grow cucumbers and tomatoes in his greenhouse during spring and summer seasons. His products are of very good quality and he sells them at different markets near his house. Besides growing vegetables himself, Seipula helps other farmers with various agricultural tasks. He works hard from the early morning until the late evening but his income is still not enough to support his family. 

In order to tackle his financial difficulties, Seipula is requesting credit from Credo to start a new business. Seipula will use the loan to purchase a big truck to start a transportation business. During his free time he will transport firewood from the forest and sell it to the locals.  

His loan request was approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides a business with start-up or re-start-up credit at reasonable conditions. The loans are given to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” due to their low income. 

Seipula is very grateful to Kiva lenders because the support will provide his family with more financial stability and allow him to save for home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to start a transportation service

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He operates a fish-selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase three sacks of fish, and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for his business growth.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks fish, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Hamidan

texts.en:
Hamidan is a 47-year-old married lady. She is a motivated mother of five children and trying hard to provide them with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and an education. 

She does hand embroidery with her daughters, and her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue her operations, she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors with some packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. This would allow her to cater to more customers consistently. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle, and has shown a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan, and is very thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors with some packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Kakiya, Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de condiments et de céréales.                                                 .                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe  Benkadi, sont à leurs dix huitième prêts solidaires.                                                                         
La cliente SADIO  qui est assise en troisième position à partir de la gauche, compte acheter des  colis de diverses sortes de condiments chez les grossistes dans les villages et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement à Konobougou au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer un mouton, la gestion des problèmes familiaux et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkadi are all married, and they average 37 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional families in the village of Kakiya, Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in tubers, condiments, and grains. The women of the group Benkadi are on their 18th solidarity loan.

This client, SADIO, who is sitting third from the left in the photo, intends to purchase packages of various condiments from wholesalers in and around villages. She makes her sales, cash or credit, each day to men and women customers in Konobougou.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay for a sheep and to manage family problems. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es:
Carlos, es una persona soltera y no vive con nadie. El, posee una tienda y molino, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años, lo desempeña de 5:00am a 3:00pm y lo aprendió de su padre.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar un motor  eléctrico para su molino; esta inversión le ayudara a aumentar la demanda de los clientes, ya que lo hará de una forma mas rápida y mejor el servicio.
Su sueño es adquirir un molino de tres tolvas y eléctrico.
texts.en:
Carlos is a single person and does not live with anyone. He has a store and a mill. He has had this business for three years. He works there from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm. He learned the business from his father.

The loan that he is applying for will allow him to buy an electric motor for his mill. This investment will help him to increase customer demand, since it will do it faster and improve service.

His dream is to acquire an electric mill with three hoppers.

loans.use: to buy an electric motor for his mill

loans.name: Rozeena

texts.en:
Rozeena, 41, has a milk-selling business. She has been running her business with the support of her husband for the past fifteen years.  She is pictured with her husband.  

Rozeena and her husband have five cows. They sell milk to many of their neighbors. She looks after the cattle and milks the cows while her husband sells the milk at different markets. To generate extra revenue, Rozeena also uses the milk to make butter and cheese. The couple enjoy their business and are hoping to provide their five children with a secure future. 

Rozeena and her husband need to earn much more to meet their family's everyday expenditures, which include food, clothing, and education. In order to make more profit, Rozeena is requesting a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy another cow to increase milk production. She expects boost a boost in her earnings from increased sales.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of milk sales for many years.  She has four buffaloes in milk, and she sells their milk, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk, to many of her neighbors. 

Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is a mother of four and is motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.  

It’s Zarina’s fifth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through its support.  Currently she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. In this way, she will be able to inflate her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Furaha Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine fait partie du groupe  Furaha  et habite à  Bujumbura. Elle  a 23 ans et est mariée à  Eric, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant de 3 mois.
  
Elle fait le commerce de  matériels de plomberie (coudes, vannes, robinets,…) depuis  1 année et 6 mois. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de  tuyaux  à revendre  pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Jeanine is part of the group Furaha and lives in Bujumbura. She is 23 years old and married to Eric, a merchant. Together they have one 3-year-old child.

Jeanine has been doing commerce in hardware (elbow joints, valves, faucets,… ) for a year and six months. 

She is on her third Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many pipes or conduit to resell in order to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to purchase a parcel of land and see her children go to school.

loans.use: to purchase many hardware items to sell in order to  earn more

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar canastas, guacales de aluminio y una cocina de horno.
Las condiciones económicas han mejorado con el crédito anterior, ya que le ayudo a  aumentar los ingresos, asimismo las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Maribel is faced with the need to ask for a new loan because she requires more working capital to continue investing in her business. This will allow her to buy baskets, aluminium crates and an oven stove. 

Her economic conditions have improved with the previous loan, as it allowed her to increase her income, and her family's circumstances are also much better.

loans.use: to buy baskets, aluminium crates and an oven stove.

loans.name: Elmer Alirio

texts.es:
Elmer,  se le presenta la necesidad de más capital de trabajo porque requiere seguir trabajando en su  actividad, por lo cual solicita un nuevo préstamo; este le servirá para comprar llaves y otras herramientas que le permitan surtir su  negocio.
El crédito anterior le ayudo  a mejorar las condiciones económicas, ya que aumentaron sus ingresos, las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Elmer needs more working capital because he needs to continue working in his business, and that is why he is applying for a new loan. This will serve him to buy keys and other hardware that will allow him to stock his business. 

The previous loan helped him improve his economic condition, since his income increased. The family circumstances remain the same.

loans.use: to buy keys and other tools

loans.name: Rositas De Hospital Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS DE HOSPITAL”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lindaura es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de CD’s, carpintería, venta de queso, venta de ganado, venta de lanas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lindaura es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre quien le enseño a la elaboración de estos productos, posteriormente decide llevar sus productos a las ferias donde los vende.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el alimento de sus animales (compra de cebada) que adquirirá de las ferias aledañas y posteriormente lo dará a sus animales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el ahorro.

En la fotografía no se encuentran dos señoras porque fueron a recoger su ganado de los campos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Rositas de Hospital” will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal de Copacabana. The group has ten members, and its board president is Lindaura. The communal bank members have various businesses: selling milk, selling CDs, carpentry, selling cheese, selling livestock, and selling wool.

This loan will benefit a micro business, of which Lindaura is a partner. She says this is the first time she has been a member of Pro Mujer, which she joined when an associate of the institution came to her house. Lindaura sells milk products. Her mother taught her how to make the products, and later she decided to sell her merchandise at fairs. She will use this loan to buy barley at local fairs to feed her livestock. Her work generates income to support her household; she is single and has a son. 

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she answered that she liked the training and saving. Two of the group members do not appear in the photo because they were bringing their livestock back from the fields.

loans.use: to buy barley.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La Sra. Bertha tiene 50 años, casada, ella sigue con la misma actividad de  venta de ropa de segunda mano,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la zona de villa Copacabana,  este préstamo es su  segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Bertha va a usar este préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa de segunda mano para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la  Sra. Bertha  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay muchas personas que se dedican a esta actividad por la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la  Sra. Bertha es una persona trabajadora, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Señora Bertha is 50 years old. She is married, and she continues with the same business of selling secondhand clothing from her sales stall, which is located in the Villa Copacaband zone. This loan is her second one within this institution. Señora Bertha is going to use this loan to purchase bundles of secondhand clothing for her business. Her reason for applying for this loan is the lack of capital. Señora Bertha faces challenges in her business, such as competition, since there are many people who work in this business in her zone. She is going to use the profits to continue improving her sales stall. Her wish for her business is to have it stocked with merchandise to offer a variety of products to her customers. Señora Bertha is a hard-working person. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support offered, since this is the only activity [she has] that allows her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing

loans.name: Sabari Kadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme MARCELINE représente le groupe SABARI KADI. Elle se porte bien. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 01 va à l’école.
Elle vend des habits depuis 02ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes et les hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 02douzaines d’habits, 04pièces de pagnes et 03douzaines de tenues pour bébé.
Mme veut épargner ses économies. Elle ambitionne étendre la limite de son activité, mieuxs’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. MARCELINE represents the group SABARI KADI. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of two children. The oldest is 7 years old, and the youngest is 3. One goes to school.

Ms. MARCELINE has been selling clothing for two years. She gets her supplies from the Sector 10 market. Her customers include both women and men.

She wants to purchase 2 dozen pieces of clothing, 4 lengths of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), and 3 dozen baby outfits. She wants to save money. Her ambition is to expand her business and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, 'pagne' cloth, and baby outfits to sell

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo tiene 46 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace siete años trabaja en el comercio especialmente en la venta de carros, fue su hermano mayor quien le enseño el negocio. Antes era jornalero. Él se desplaza por toda la zona oriental en  busca de comercio o autos que de alguna manera le generen una ganancia.
 
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para tener capital de trabajo para una oportunidad de negocio; ya que en el día a día se encuentra en un mercado de oportunidades; pero en esta ocasión el cliente lo invertirá en la compra de recipientes de cocina para venderlos y ja encontrado un proveedor que se los facilita a un buen precio y él asegura le genera ganancias.

Así mismo; podrá tener un nuevo negocio del cual espera sacar muchas ganancias y así cuando la venta de los carros este mal, él compensara con los ingresos de la venta de los recipientes de cocina. Por lo que, tendrá una fuente de ingreso extra que le generen ingresos para mantener a su familia y los gastos de la casa.

Los planes a futuro que tiene, es que sus hijos estudien y puedan ser profesionales ya que él no lo pudo ser quiere dejarles esa herencia.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 46 years old. He is in a relationship and has three children. For the last 7 years he has been a businessman, particularly in car sales. It was his older brother who taught him the business. Before, he was a labourer. He travels all over the eastern area of the country looking for business or cars that will make a profit.
 
The loan he is asking for through Fundación Campo, will give him working capital for a business opportunity, as day-to-day there is a market of opportunities. But on this occasion Ricardo will invest in buying kitchen pans to sell and he has already found a provider who is offering them at a good price and a profit is assured.

Just like that, he will have a new business which Ricardo hopes will generate a large profit and so when car sales are down, he will compensate with the income from selling kitchen pans. As such, he will have an extra source of income which will help to look after his family and the household expenses. 

Ricardo's future plans include his children studying so that they can become professionals. As he couldn't do that himself, he wants to leave them this inheritance.

loans.use: to use working capital

loans.name: Tuloto

texts.en: Tuloto is a 43 year old married woman with no children. She would like to start growing peanuts to earn a living. Tuloto has requested a loan to buy sacks of unripe peanuts, fertilizer, rakes, pickaxe, chemicals and a wheelbarrow.She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. Tuloto will spend her profits to support her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of unripe peanuts, fertilizer, rakes, a pickaxe, chemical and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge, está soltero, vive con su familia, sus padres y un hermano, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: maíz y frijol, el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres  desde la edad de 13 años y cuenta con una experiencia de 17 años, dicha actividad la realiza de 6:00am a 2:30pm, por el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas; esta inversión le ayudara a darle un buen mantenimiento al cultivo y obtener una mejor cosecha, uno de los riesgos seria la falta de lluvia.
Su sueño es crecer más en la agricultura y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, asimismo su objetivo es adquirir una pareja de terneros, al obtener la cosecha.
texts.en:
Jorge is single and lives with his family: his parents and a brother. He does not have relatives living abroad. He grows basic crops like corn and beans, a trade he learned from his parents at age 13. He has 17 of experience and works from 6:00 am until 2:30.pm without any problems. 

He will use the loan to buy needed farming supplies such as manure, herbicide, and insecticide. The investment will help him better maintain his crops and produce a good harvest. Lack of rain is one of the risks he faces. He dreams of being a better farmer and offering his family a higher standard of living. He also wants to buy a pair of calves after the harvest.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide, and insecticide.

loans.name: Las Faboritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS FAVORITAS”  iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Romualda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de chompas, transporte de movilidades, tejido de mantas, venta de salchipapa, venta de botones, venta de ropa, compra de material de construcción, venta de estuco.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Romualda es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió hace diez años atrás de una familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las empresas de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones, el crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “LAS FAVORITAS” communal bank are starting their Eighth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Cascada. The group is made up of 6 members and is led by an executive board of which Señora Romualda is President. The businesses developed by the members are diverse and include: selling food, jumpers, weaving blankets, selling salchipapas (a kind of kebab), selling buttons, clothes, buying construction materials, selling plaster.

The loan they receive will benefit these small micro-businesses where Señora Romulada is a member. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for 8 years, at the invitation of her friend who is part of the institution. Currently she has an artesanal business.  She says that she learnt her business 10 years ago from a relative.
 
The loan which they will now receive will increase the capital (buying wool) that the businesses in Cuidad de El Alto will acquire in bulk and later to produce what she will sell in her shop area. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as best she can, as she is married and has a daughter.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the training, the loans and the healthcare facilities.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Hamdan

texts.en:
Hamdan is a 45 years-old married man. He is a father of six children; three sons and three daughters. All of them are under 18 years old. 

Hamdan works as an employee with a low wage and works in the car pieces trade. It is a profitable job but does not give Hamdan a stable income. Hamdan would like to improve his family's living conditions so he would like to work as a taxi drivers after his morning job. He would like to buy a new car  but he does not have enough capital. 

Hamdan took a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the costs of the new taxi he would like to purchase. This will increase the family's income and improve their living conditions. Hamdan appears in the photo besides his taxi.

loans.use: to pay the costs of the new taxi he would like to purchase.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Analyn is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell for her coconut wine selling business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is an 18-year-old single young man from Tulkarm. He lives with his family in a small house.

Malek started his business one year ago and opened a barber shop in the neighborhood where he lives. It is a very profitable job and earns a good income, and he is well known in his village. 

Malek took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to improve his barber shop by applying new decorations. This will make his shop more attractive to the customers and earn more income.

Malek appears in the photo in front of his barber shop.

loans.use: to improve his barber shop by applying new decorations

loans.name: Paulino Antonio

texts.es:
Paulino, se le presenta la necesidad  de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que él es electricista y necesita material de instalación de energía eléctrica; este le permitirá comprar cables, conexiones, cajas térmicas, suitt, entre otros. 
El crédito anterior le ayudo a fortalecer el servicio y aumentar su clientela, también los ingresos y esto los invierte en remodelar su vivienda; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y por el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
texts.en: Paulino needs another loan. He is an electrician and needs installation materials. This loan will allow him to buy cables, connectors, thermal boxes, and more. With the previous loan, he was able to offer better service, get new customers, increase his earnings, and remodel his house. The economy has improved and, right now, he faces no problems.

loans.use: to buy cables, connectors, thermal boxes, and more.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La socia Dora pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” y este banco está situado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de calca y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia Dora continua con su negocio de compra y venta de oro, la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

 La socia Dora solicita el préstamo para la compra de oro. 

La socia Dora agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the communal bank Clorinda Matto de Turner and this bank is located in the district of Calca in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

Dora continues with her business of buying and selling gold. She has been in business for years which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in each day. She wants to be able to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family.

Dora is asking for a loan to buy gold. Dora appreciates and values the loan granted by this means and she likewise agrees to complete her payments according to the established plan.

loans.use: to buy gold to sell in her business

loans.name: Vilma Juana

texts.es:
La socia Vilma se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de juguetes como carritos,muñecas entre otro9s juguetes,la socia tiene un pequeño puesto donde vende los juguetes desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de juguetes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar juguetes como carritos y muñecas.

La socia esta contenta con elcredito ys e compromete a cumplir los pagos de sus cuota.
texts.en: Vilma continues to sell toys such as miniature cars and dolls. She has a small stand where she sells toys from 8:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m. She has run this business for five years, and it is successful. Her dream is to grow her business, and she has applied for a loan to buy toys such as miniature cars and dolls. She is pleased to have funding and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy toys such as miniature cars and dolls.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 40 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Cristina is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy feeds and additional livestock for her business.

Cristina has been in this business for 4 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

Cristina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Having no other source of income, Jeffrey decided to put up a small shoe repair shop in their village to generate income. He is 27 years old and still single. He aims to earn and save more income to help his parents in satisfying their necessities. He aims to improve the business and make it profitable in order to increase his income.

Due to insufficient capital, he is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy thread, needles and paint needed in repairing shoes and sandals. He believes that this loan will enable him to improve the business and is hoping that someday he will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles and paint needed in repairing shoes and sandals

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anecita is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for pigs and groceries for her general store.

Anecita has been raising pigs for 14 years and also earns additional income from the general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for pigs and groceries for her general store

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling foodstuff like maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel,  vive con su compañera de vida, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica a la venta de huevos y queso, dicha actividad la realiza de 6:00am a 7:30pm, cuenta con la experiencia de 3 años sobre el oficio y por el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad. 
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar un queso  valorado en $100, asimismo huevos; esta inversión le ayudara a brindarle una mejor atención a los clientes, por lo tanto crece mas en el mercado.
Su sueño es crear un buen record crediticio, crecer su inventario. Ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y asimismo adquirir un vehículo.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his life partner. They do not have relatives living abroad. He works selling eggs and cheese from 6:00am until 7:30PM. He has 3 years experience in this work and so far has had no problems.

He is asking for a loan to buy cheese valued at $100, and also eggs. This investment will help him provide better service to his customers so that he will expand in the marketplace.

His dream is to create a good credit history and to increase his inventory, to offer a better quality of life to his family and to buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy cheese valued at $100 and also eggs.

loans.name: Carlos Alexander

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a su compañera de vida y su mamá. Él es un joven visionario que posee muchas ganas y entusiasmo en ser mejor cada día, hace cinco años trabaja como albañil, trabajo que aprendió de un amigo que es albañil y lo había contratado de ayudante antes el se dedicaba a  estudiar.

Él compra los materiales en la ciudad a una distancia de 15 kilómetros de su casa; para trasladar los materiales tiene que pagar el transporte para el traslado del equipo que necesita para las construcciones.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación campo, es para comprar arena, cemento, ladrillo, pago de mano de obra, para construir una habitación ya que recientemente se ha acompañado y dese tener privacidad en casa de su mamá.  Contar con un espacio más agradable para él y su compañera de vida  y brindar comodidad al pequeño que viene en camino.

Su puposito es, seguir trabajando fuerte y ahora al doble ya que tiene el compromiso de su esposa y de un hijo que esta por nacer y no quiere que les falte nada.
texts.en:
Carlos is 22 and lives with his life partner and his mother. He is a visionary young man, with the desire and enthusiasm to improve each day. For five years, he has worked as a bricklayer, a trade he learned from a friend who had employed him as as assistant before he began studying. 

He will buy supplies in a city about 15 kilometers from his house and will have to pay to have the necessary construction equipment delivered. He has a applied to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy sand, cement, and brick and to pay workers to build a room where he and his partner can have privacy within his mother's house. He and his partner will then have a nicer, more comfortable space for themselves and the child they are expecting.  

His goal is to keep working, and now doubly hard, since he has made a commitment to his wife and the child they are expecting and doesn't want them to lack for anything.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, and brick and to pay workers to build a room where he and his partner can have privacy within his mother's house.

loans.name: Grimaneza

texts.es:
La socia Grimaneza pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia continua con su negocio de venta de jugos, la socia vende diferentes tipos de preparados de jugos para sus distintos clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de fruta como platanos, papayas entre otros.

La socia Grimaneza en esta oportunidad accede al crédito para comprar insumos como por ejemplo naranjas, plátanos, papayas y otras más.
texts.en:
Grimaneza belongs to the communal bank Clorinda Matto de Turner which is a part of the Asociación Araiwa.

She continues working selling juices, selling selling different types of juices prepared by request for various customers. Her business is doing well thanks to her daily efforts. She wants to be able to continue working like this in order to continue supporting her family. She is asking for a loan to buy fruit such as bananas, papaya and others.

Grimaneza is taking this opportunity to access a loan in order to buy supplies such as oranges, bananas, papayas and more.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as bananas, papayas, and other fruit.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luegos los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha continues with her business of raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She fattens them and enables them to grow.  Then, she sells them at the different fairs.  She has had the business for seven years, and it is going very well for her.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.  Her dream is to have a place where she is able to sell her animals.

She is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Beronica

texts.es:
Beronica se dedica a la venta de comida en su domicilio, su esposo trabaja como chef profesional. Vive en casa propia junto con sus cuatro hijos en la ciudad El Alto.
 
El crédito es para comprar de una maquina freidora para pollo broaster Así podrá  aumentar su capital  y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida

El sueño de Juana Berónica, es de tener pensión amplio de comidas

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Beronica sells food at her house.  Her husband works as a professional chef.  She lives in her own house with her four children in the city of El Alto.

The loan is to buy a frying machine to make broasted chicken.  This way she will be able to increase her capital and thus improve her quality of life.

Beronica’s dream is to have a meal service business with plenty of food.

This is the first time she has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a frying machine to cook chicken.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with eight children and two of her children go to school. She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cooking oil, boxes of soap, rice and bread. She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, rice and bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials like silk thread and needles, among others.

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
Bintiali is a married woman with two children, both of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Bintiali has operated a clothes-selling business, in which she sells at the market to her town-dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting, Bintiali wants to purchase three bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 49 years old and married, with three children.

Daisy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more goods to sell in her general store, like candies, biscuits, noodles, coffee, laundry soap, and other groceries.

Daisy has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Daisy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store, like candies, biscuits, noodles, coffee, laundry soap, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 33-year-old married woman. She lives in a small village near Jinen with her husband and four children; two sons and two daughters. All of them are under 10 years old. Sonia's husband is a worker with a very low wage which is not enough to cover all the family needs so Sonia works as an employee to help her husband with part of the family expenses. Her work is far from where she lives. It is not easy for her to go everyday but she must work to help her husband. 

Sonia took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy some necessary furniture especially living room chairs. This will improve the family's home conditions. Sonia would like to take another loan in the future to buy all the necessary furniture and home appliances needed.

Sonia appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy some necessary furniture especially for the living room

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Bernardita works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Personal Collection and Avon products. Bernardita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her business selling used clothing.

Bernardita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a María, quien con su credikiva pudo comprar bolsos, collares, y relojes que le solicitaron sus clientes. Con esta inversión pudo invertir en más productos, con los cuales aumentó sus ingresos y utilidades, permitiéndole mejorar el surtido y atención a sus clientes, e igualmente esto se reflejó en su bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de bolsos, ya que este es el producto que más vende en su negocio. María dice a sus financiadores: “Gracias por la ayuda brindada, y que siempre lo sigan haciendo”.
texts.en: Thanks to the support from her Kiva loan, she could buy bags, necklaces and watches which her customers requested. With this investment, she could invest in more products which increase her revenue and profits. This allows her to improve her selection and the attention given to her customers. It’s also reflected in her well-being. She is currently applying for a new loan to continue investing in the purchase of bags since this is the product that sells the most in her business. María says to her lenders: “Thank you for the help and may you always continue to do this”.

loans.use: continue to invest in the purchase of purses.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 29 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cecil is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Cecil has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has one child in school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past two years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Yanal

texts.en:
Yanal is a 22-year-old single man from Jenin city. Yanal's father works as a chef in a local restaurant in the city and gets a good income, but not enough to cover all the family’s needs. Yanal is still studying in the university and is in his last year, specializing in marketing. 

Yanal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Yanal will be able to complete his studies in the university and find a job to help his family. 

Yanal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 61-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 19 and 20. She and her husband are engaged in fishing to support their family. 

She is asking for a loan to buy marine plywood, adhesive and paint for her boat. With this, she can be assured of continued business in fishing. Her income provides food and school fees for her family. 

In the future, Virginia hopes to be able to afford to send her children through college.

loans.use: to buy marine plywood, adhesive and paint for her boat.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has one child. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a fish-selling business at the market for the past two years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors, but she faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 52 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Norma has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is a 35-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children; two of them are school-going. 

She has been running a business of animal sales with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They buy animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, bring them up, and then sell them at higher prices near the occasion of Eid-ul Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

Shameem has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase two more goats. 

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 30 years old and married; she has three children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been fattening pigs for six years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Analyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 29-year-old married lady. She has been actively involved in the business of cloth sales for four years. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

So, she is requesting a 45,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths of lawn and chiffon in different colors and designs. This will attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. 

Tahira expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths of lawn and chiffon in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 59 years old and married.

Clara works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like soap, detergent, canned goods, milk, soft drinks and other groceries.

Clara has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Clara aspires to save enough money to expand her business and support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like soap, detergent, canned goods, milk, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is married. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a clothes selling business for the past three years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passers-by and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en: Farah, 36, is a married vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches stylish clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to complete the orders of her customers on time. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Al Malak Group

texts.en:
Faten is the featured borrower of Al Malak group. She got together with her other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. She is the one wearing grey at left.

Faten is a 46-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working by preparing and selling handmade souvenirs since four years ago. Faten is very talented in her domain and well-known in her region. She is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary handmade-souvenir needs such as threads, beads and many other new-release items. She will also use part of the loan to change her living room curtains to keep in a good situation since she expects most of her customers at home.

Faten is a hard worker; she also owns a small convenience store, which is necessary to have and manage well since it provides her family with a daily income.

As for the other borrowers, Ola is the one standing at the left wearing purple and Oussama is the one standing in the middle.

loans.use: to buy necessary handmade-souvenir needs such as threads, beads and many other new-release items.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a spices and vegetables business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional spices and vegetables to sell for her business.

Elena has been in this business for 10 years. Elena earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
At the age of 51, Nusrat is successfully running a business of popcorn sales. She deliciously makes popcorn at home, and after packaging, she supplies the popcorn in the local market.  She has been doing this for many years and makes a good amount of income through her business.

To increase her supply, she needs to purchase another machine for popcorn making, with some packages of salt and unpopped corn. So she took her fourth loan, in the amount of Rs. 45,000, from Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to spend the income on providing a better standard of living to her four children.

loans.use: to purchase another machine for popcorn making, with some packages of salt and unpopped corn

loans.name: Imtyaz

texts.en: Imtyaz is a 48-year-old married woman and is running a milk sales business with her husband. She has two buffalos and she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffalos and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They have been doing it happily together to support their family. To help her continue operations of her business, Imtyaz requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo. It will help her to inflate her sales, which ultimately helps in bringing more cash to her. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. Imtyaz dreams of providing better standards of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for her milk sales business

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 47 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Enriquita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Enriquita has been farming coconuts for 20 years and also earns additional income through food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
This is Juan, 41, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Virginia, a meat vendor, and is the father to their one and only child. He and his wife are managing their household while operating the business. As the head of the family, he works hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

Juan maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He works early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives in the late evening until the wee hours in order to have bigger profits. His regular customers are his neighbours and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,200 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting an amount of PHP 20,000 for his loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his four tricycle units. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Juan dreams of having an additional source of income and hopes his child will finish his studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 50 years old and married with four children. Nilda works very hard to provide for her family.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as shampoo, coffee, canned goods, and snack foods. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Nilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 33 years old and has four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past 10 years, selling to his town dwellers and neighbors. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fish, especially during times of cold currents in the deep sea. 

Here he comes to you again, requesting a loan to purchase 12 bundles of fish, 10 liters of cooking oil and firewood. He decided to join Yehu to access loans at a lower cost to improve his business, and he appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase 12 bundles of fish, 10 liters of cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. She is married and has a natural medicine retail business in the Philippines.

Marites requested a PHP 14000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy food supplements and medicine to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food supplements and medicine to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: Carlos Enrique es un hombre de 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar como obrero en obras de construcción y, aunque el empleo en ese sector es incierto, hasta el momento ha podido obtener ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. El crédito que solicita en la Corporación es para invertirlo en una asesoría especializada para montar su propio negocio, con unas bases sólidas, con las condiciones adecuadas y para que pueda ser competitivo en el mercado. Su principal sueño es poder montar su propio negocio, que le permita mejorar su independencia económica y poder ofrecer una estabilidad y mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia.
texts.en: Carlos Enrique is a 41 year old married man with three children. Currently, he is a construction worker. However, work in this sector is uncertain. So far he has been able to earn enough money for the basic needs of his family. The loan he is requesting will be invested in specialized  business advice in order to start his own business with a solid foundation, the right conditions and a competitive edge in the market. His big dream is to have his own business which allows him to improve his economic independence and to offer stability and a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: pay for specialized  business advice for starting his own business.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 42-year-old married lady. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for the past nine years to meet the family expenses. Her husband is the only bread earner, and Kousar applied for a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Kousar is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen, age 49, is a married vigorous lady. She has three children; two of them are school-going. For the past many years, she has stitched clothes to support her entire family. She is well familiar with the techniques of stitching clothes according to fashion. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes enough of an amount of money to spend a decent life through her business. 

In order to expand her business, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy more reels of threads, with some packs of laces, buttons, ribbons and zippers in various colors. She is in her second loan cycle. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and is thankful to Kashf Foundation for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more reels of threads with some packs of laces, buttons, ribbons and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Esmilcina Yesenia

texts.es:
La socia Esmilcina Yesenia tiene 41 años,es casada y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de perfumeria,la socia socia vende perfumes para varones y mujeres,ella tiene una tienda en un centro comercial,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de perfumes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar perfumes para varones y mujeres.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de sus cuota.
texts.en: Esmilcina Yesenia is forty-one, is married, and has two children.  She makes a living through her business selling fragrances.  She sells fragrances for men and women.  She has a store in a mall and works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.  She has had this business for six years and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy fragrances.  She is happy about the loan and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fragrances for men and women.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Juan Carlos pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE COYLLORYTY DE QOLLANA,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
El socio tiene 33 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, él socio altera sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la mecanica, el socio lleva años dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Juan Carlos belongs to the communal bank, "Señor de Coylloryty de Qollana," which is located in the province of Cusco.  He is thirty-three, is married by common law, and has two children.  He makes a living as a mechanic and has done this work for years.  It is going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his business every day.  He hopes to be able to keep working so he can support his family.  He is requesting the loan to buy tools for his business.  He is thankful for the loan offered to him, and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tools for his business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
This is Richard. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of his tricycle (motorcycle with a sidecar) unit. His earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit and also to buy some equipment for his repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Richard dreams of have more motorcycles and hopes to have his own house and lot. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycles.

loans.name: Briseyda Alexandra

texts.es:
