Briseyda,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo  porque requiere de más mercadería para continuar en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar diversidad de ropa tales como: blusas, pantalones, ropa interior femenina.
El efecto del crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar sus utilidades y fortaleció el negocio, las ganancias las utiliza para cubrir los gastos básicos del hogar; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y el grupo familiar se mantiene igual.
texts.en:
Briseyda finds herself in need of a new loan, as she requires more merchandise in order to continue her business. The loan would allow her to buy a variety of clothing such as blouses, pants, and women's underwear.

Briseyda's previous loan helped her to increase her earnings and to strengthen the business. She uses the earnings to cover her basic living costs. Her financial situation has improved, and her family unit remains the same.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, and women's underwear.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business. Marivic has been in this business for 15 years. Marivic earns additional income from buying and sellling vegetables.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a single parent of children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

In the Philippines, she has a buy and sell nipa business, woven palm mats used for house repair and construction businesses.  She also earns additional income from selling herbal medicines.  Lourdes is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her buy and sell nipa business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities with her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She is motivated to provide all of the necessities of life for her family. That is why she is working with her husband, who is also shown in the photo with her. 

They have been running a small shop successfully for many years where they sell various items such as calling cards, mobile accessories, chargers, etc. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she has applied for her second loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile batteries. 

With the help of this loan, they can meet the increasing demands of their clients and generate more revenue. Shazia wishes to utilize part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile batteries.

loans.name: Madelin

texts.en:
Madelin is 38 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. Madelin is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Madelin has been farming coconut for 18 years; she also earns additional income from a general store and from buying and selling coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo

texts.es:
Jose, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de mas capital de trabajo; este le servirá para comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros.
El efecto del crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar la productividad  de los granos básicos y sus ganancias las invierte en los gastos del hogar;  las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en: Jose has the need to take out a new loan because he requires more working capital.  He will use this loan to buy needed farming supplies like:  manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, etc.  His previous loan helped him increase his production of basic grains, and he will invest the profits in paying for his home's expenses.  His economic situation has improved and his family circumstances are the same.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Higinio

texts.es:
Higinio, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque los créditos anteriores les ha proporcionado buenos resultados en cuanto a la producción del cultivo; este le servirá para comprar 6 quintales de abono,  insecticidas para limpiar las malezas de la milpa que ya tiene sembrado.
El crédito anterior le fue de mucha ayuda, ya que logro una cosecha muy abundante y libre de plagas para comercializar o para el consumo; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en: Higinio needs to take out another loan because the previous loans have brought good results for his crop production. This one will serve him to buy 6 quintales of fertilizer as well as insecticide to clear the corn he has planted. The previous loan really helped him, since he obtained an abundant crop free of pests to sell or consume. His family's financial conditions and circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy 6 quintales of fertilizer as well as insecticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay fees for her education.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia Maruja pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE COYLLORYTY DE QOLLANA,la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, la socia tiene su restaurante donde prepara desayunos, almuerzo y cenas ,la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite, carnes entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the Señor de Coyllorty de Qollana communal bank. She still makes a living by selling food; she has a restaurant where she prepares breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. Maruja has run this business for years now, and it is going well thanks to her hard work every day. She would like to continue working in order to continue supporting her family. 

Maruja is requesting a loan in order to purchase supplies such as rice, oil, and meats, among other things.

Maruja is grateful for the previous loan, and is committed to making her established repayments.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as rice, oil, and meat, among other things.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 53-year-old married woman. She is a hardworking mother of four children who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors, packs of zippers, buttons, and ribbons to meet the increasing demand. She is in her third loan cycle, and has a good loan history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, packs of zippers, buttons, and ribbons.

loans.name: Alas

texts.en: Alas is a married, 48-year-old woman. She has devoted herself to providing a better standard of living for her family members by running a business of fabric sales. She purchases cloths in different colors and designs from the main city, and then sells them to the people of her community at reasonable prices. She wants to expand her business, and needs to buy wide variety of fancy lawn and chiffon cloths in different colors and designs. But, due to low capital, she is unable to fulfill the demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested for a loan of Rs. 20,000 through Kashf foundation. In this way, she will be able to offer a wider variety of cloths to her customers for the upcoming event of Eid-ul-Fitar (a religious holiday in Muslim countries). She expects boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of fancy cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: María Ventura

texts.es:
María tiene 64 años de edad, esta acompañada y ha procreado dos hijos. La señora se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde hace muchos años; ya que su familia siempre se ha dedicado a esas actividades y aprendió el trabajo ayudando a sus padres, nunca se ha dedicado a otras actividades.

La señora sale de su casa y camina unos 3 minutos a pie para llegar a la avenida donde aborda el autobús, que tarda unos 20 minutos para llegar al pueblo donde compra los productos para sus actividades.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para dar mantenimiento a sus potreros donde pasta el ganado, reparar cercos y sembrar pasto para alimentar al ganado en el verano, comprara semilla, abono, pesticidas y pagara jornales para cultivar el pasto. Al adquirir el crédito podrá mantener limpios sus pastizales, los cercos en buen estado y podrá cultivar suficiente pasto para la época seca. Para alimentar  a sus vacas, tiene la posibilidad de obtener mejores rendimientos en la producción de leche y carne y obtendrá de igual forma mejores ingresos para su familia  

Sus planes a futuro es construir un patrimonio para heredar a sus hijos para que tengan un principio para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old. She is married and has two children. She has been a farmer and a rancher for many years. Her family has always worked in these activities and she learned to work helping her parents. She has never done anything else. 

She leaves her house and walks 3 minutes to reach the avenue where she catches the bus which takes 20 minutes to arrive at the town where she buys the products for her activities.

The loan she is asking Fundación Campo for is to do maintenance on her pastures where she grazes her cattle, as well as to repair fences and plant grass to feed her cattle in the summer and buy seed, fertilizer, pesticide and pay the laborers to plant the grass. By getting the loan, she will be able to keep her  pastures clean, the fences in good repair and grow enough grass for the dry season. By feeding her cows, she has the possibility of getting better results with milk production and obtain better income for her family.  

Her plans for the future are to build an inheritance for her children so they can have a good start and continue working.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her pastures where she grazes her cattle, repair fences and plant grass to feed her cattle in the summer, as well as buy seed, fertilizer,  pesticide, and pay the laborers to plant the grass.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
El socio Modesto pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE COYLLORYTY DE QOLLANA,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco. 
El socio Modesto tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de restaurante, el socio prepara distintos platos que le solicitan sus cientes, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite entre otros para su negocio. 
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member is named Modesto and he belongs to the SEÑOR DE COYLLORYTY DE QOLLANA communal bank located in the province of Cuzco.
 
Modesto is 42 years old, in a common law marriage and has 2 children. He alternates his daily activities with his restaurant. He prepares different dishes that his customers order. He has had this business for some time and it is going well for him thanks to the hard work he puts into his business everyday.  He wants to be able to keep working this way to keep supporting his family. 

He is asking for the loan to buy ingredients such as rice and more for his business. He is grateful for the loan and committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, oil and more for his business.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca De Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Andrea ella es casada y tiene 57 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los alimentos.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de muebles, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SEÑOR DE HUANCA DE CUSCO” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cuzco, in the province and department of Cuzco.                                                                                                                                                                                              

The member's name is Andrea. She is 57, married and has 5 children. She works at her business raising animals, guinea pigs and chickens. She fattens them up and then sells them at different markets. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. and has had this business for 7 years. It is going well for her. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the animals. She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens and fed for the animals. The other members have businesses selling furniture, selling food, a convenience store and a restaurant. 

she is grateful to those who have been a part of her dream in the way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 54 years old and married with three children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 18,000  PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Virginia has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years, and also earns an income from fish vending.

Virginia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Farah Group

texts.en:
Farah is a group composed of three Lebanese women living in a village in Mount Lebanon.  They decided to join hands and form the group in order to acquire a loan, from Al Majmoua, and in order to support each other financially.  Nouhad is the leader and featured member of the group.  She is a 41 year-old married mother of three children, sitting on the far left of the picture.  She is employed in a company which sells and trades beauty products.  However, she also owns her small business and sells beauty products, such as purses, bags, and other items.  Her husband also owns his personal business.  However, their combined revenue is not sufficient to provide a healthy life and environment for their household.  Furthermore, Nohad's children are enrolled in a private school, which adds tuition fees on top of the other family expenses.  She decided to establish the group in order to purchase beauty products and bags to enhance and expand her personal business.

As for the other group members, Diyaa is sitting in the center and Mona is sitting on the far right of the picture.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and bags to sell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 24-year-old single man living in a small village in the South of Lebanon.  He owns a small business in the field of construction since six years ago, specialized in painting houses.  Enhancing his business at this stage is very crucial because it would allow him to gain a reputation in the future and increase his customers, thus his revenue.  Therefore, he contacted Al Majmoua to acquire a youth loan.  He will use this loan in order to purchase a new car from the ‘rapid’ category, which would help him transport his work kit from one construction field to the next.  As for the future, Hussein wishes to develop and expand his business in order to take charge of larger projects.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of one child. She and her husband (shown in the photo) have been farmers for many years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. Her husband assists her by watering the plants so as to get a good quality product.

In order to buy different types of seed, insecticides and pesticides, Shehnaz is applying for a loan of 20,000 PKR through Kashf. This will help her to grow more crops which ultimately will mean an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy different types of seed, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina es una mujer de 33 años, vive en la ciudad de de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que ella es padre y madre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Yanina no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Pedagogía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chicharrón de Chancho para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yanina trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de campo como sembrado, riego, cosecha y otros, Yanina trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Yanina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, ya que actualmente ella prepara sus alimentos en una cocina a leña, la cual es peligrosa para su uso, de esta manera Yanina podrá preparar adecuadamente sus alimentos y tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio negocio comercial.
texts.en: Yanina is a 33-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona, with her young son, whom she loves and who is her principal reason for living.  She is a friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who devotes all her efforts to raising her son, as she is both father and mother to him.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and because she needed to start working at a young age, Yanina was unable to study to become a teacher as she would have liked.  In her free time she likes to watch movies, and sometimes cooks a delicious pork dish called "Chicharron de Chancho" to share with her family.  On her own initiative, and with great effort and dedication, Yanina works as an agricultural laborer on a farm in her city.  Her work includes sowing, irrigating, harvesting and other farming tasks. Yanina works every day, starting early in the morning, and for appoximately 10 hours.  She likes her work and believes that she is doing well at it because of her good job performance and because of the friendly way in which she treats others.  Yanina is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to  buy a stove.  She currently prepares food on a wood-burning stove, which is dangerous for her to use.  Yanina will therefore be able to adequately prepare food and have greater security and well-being, so that she can continue working and trying to achieve her great dream of having her own business.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Perlita works hard to support her family.  She has a business selling herbal medicines in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from direct selling ready-to-wear.  Perlita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase stocks of herbal products to sell to customers.

Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to secure a future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 47 years old and from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in the seaweed-farming business for a long time now. The income that she generates helps in meeting the costs of food and household bills like electricity and water. Bebiana is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope. 

She hopes to continue doing business and be sustainable. She also dreamed of having other business someday.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 38 years old and married with five children. For the past year she has been fattening up pigs to sell. She also is a food vendor to earn extra money.

Marivic is applying for a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more feed for her pigs. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Jhenuz Group

texts.en:
Jhenuz is a group composed of three Filipino women working as housekeepers for Lebanese families. They decided to establish the group and acquire a loan from Al Majmoua because each of them is in dire need of financial support. Jennifer is the leader and featured member of the group. She is a 31-year-old single mother of two children, sitting on the far right of the picture. Her children live back in the Philippines, and she is their only financial provider. In fact, she decided to form the group and acquire a loan in order to pay the tuition fees of her children who are both enrolled in private schools. Her low-income job could not allow her to provide for her own self and for her children as well.

As for the other group members, Jocelyn is sitting in the center of the picture, while Airies is sitting on the far left of the picture.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees of her children who are both enrolled in private schools.

loans.name: Sarah Betty

texts.en:
Sarah Betty is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past seven years, Betty has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells stationery. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more files, pens, reams of paper to sell. It will also help Betty to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees and their basic needs. Betty hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale stationery shop. 

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more files, pens, reams of paper to sell.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en: Monalisa is a  26-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety store) business. She sells items like sugar, coffee, biscuits, shampoos, and other basic commodities. Monalisa requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy various goods like beverages, toiletries, and biscuits to avoid stock shortage and to provide a variety of goods to choose from. In the future, Monalisa  would like to expand her sari-sari (variety) store to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy various goods like beverages, toiletries, and biscuits.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Youssef is a 26-year-old married man living in a small village in the South of Lebanon. He owns a small business where he is in charge of car maintenance, and he specializes in body work. His wife is currently unemployed; therefore he is the only financial provider of the household. Thus, maximizing his revenue would allow him to truly establish a family and to provide care for potential children. He decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a YOUTH loan in order to purchase specialized machines for pulling and compressing car bodies to fix them after accidents. In the future, he would like to purchase an oven for the painting of cars.

loans.use: to purchase specialized machines for pulling and compressing car bodies.

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is married and has four children, all in school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past ten years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Sreynhanh's Group

texts.en:
Aged 40 years, Sreynhanh lives in a rural area located in the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province. She is a widowed mother of five children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living by selling snacks in her village. She makes about 25,000 KHR a day which she uses to meet the family’s needs.

This is the seventh loan for Sreynhanh with VisionFund. She is leading her group of seven members in applying for a 1,225,000 KHR loan. She is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a latrine, which will include a toilet bowl, drainage tiles, etc. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a latrine

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es: Diana Marcela es una mujer de 27 años, es soltera y aún no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a terminar sus estudios de psicología, actividad que alterna con la atención de su distribuidora de arepas, producto que ofrece tienda a tienda en el área urbana del municipio, con gran esfuerzo ha obtenido ingresos para costear sus estudios y aportar al sostenimiento de su hogar. Diana es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada y con el préstamo que solicita desea pagar una asesoría especializada en la Corporación, sobre creación de empresas ya que desea montar una IPS donde pueda ejercer su carrera. Su principal sueño es poder realizarse profesionalmente, posicionarse y generar mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar el bienestar y la calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Diana Marcela, 27, is single and doesn't have any children yet. Right now she is dedicated to finishing her degree in psychology, while also selling arepas store to store in her town. With hard work she has made enough money to cover her education costs and contribute to her household expenses. She is dedicated and tenacious and with the requested loan she wants to pay a corporate advisor in business creation because she would like to start a business with her new career. Her biggest dream is to be able to practice her profession, and put herself in a position to generate more income that will allow her to improve her wellbeing and the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy a corporate advisor to help with business creation.

loans.name: Sinoern's Group

texts.en:
Sinoern is 55 years old and widowed. She lives in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Ponhea Leur district earning a living through selling snacks and rice in her villages. Having been in this business for 20 years, she can earn about 40,000 KHR per day from the current business.

Sinoern has been with VisionFund for six cycles and fully paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 175,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sinoern will use her portion to buy materials to construct a latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her and her family to have a decent latrine.

loans.use: To buy materials to construct a latrine

loans.name: Tezzy

texts.es:
Tezzy es una mujer de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una  persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar  a sus padres, Tezzy no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar unos riquísimos Juanes para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Tezzy trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de tortas y bocaditos en general, ella se levanta muy temprano todos los días para preparar alfajores, rosquitas, tequeños, pasteles y demás bocaditos que sus clientes le solicitan, Tezzy puede trabajar por un aproximado de 12 horas, atendiendo a un promedio de 20 clientes y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Tezzy se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de insumos, como sacos de harina, azúcar, dulces, pasas, materiales de pastelería y otros, de esta manera Tezzy podrá seguir realizando sus trabajos de manera adecuada, así pues ella seguirá esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en: Tezzy is a thirty-two-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa with her husband and 2 children, whom she loves and who are her principal reason for living.  She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person.  She and her husband devote all of their efforts to raising their family.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and because she had to start working at a young age to help her parents, Tezzy was not able to study business administration as she would have liked.  In her free time she likes to cook delicious Peruvian rice dishes called "juanes" to share with her family.  On her own initiative, and with great effort and dedication, Tezzy works in her own small business selling cakes and a variety of snacks.  She gets up very early every day to make cookies, appetizers, cakes and other snacks that her customers request.  Tezzy works approximately 12 hours per day, serving about 20 customers. She believes that her business is doing well because of her tasty products and because of the friendly way that she treats others.  Tezzy is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help she will be able to buy a larger quantity and variety of ingredients, such as bags of flour, sugar, sweets, raisins, cake-making materials and other things.  With this, Tezzy can continue working in order to achieve her great dream, which is to see her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials for a cake shop.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
This is Ramona, 44, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nicanor, a worker abroad, and she is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income continually for their everyday expenses.

Ramona has a dishwashing liquid business. She buys the ingredients and mixes them to make a dishwashing liquid. She puts the liquid into bottles, and then sells and distributes them to some variety stores. She also sells them to her neighbors and in the local community. She earns a minimum of 6,000 PHP in sales weekly.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy bottles and ingredients for making dishwashing liquid.

Ramona dreams of expanding her business, and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients needed for making dishwashing liquid for her business.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 32 years old from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children ages 7-14. Annabelle raises her children through her income growing corn. She also makes charcoal for additional income. A motorbike is used to transport their produce. 

She works hard so she can provide for her family's needs. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees, motor repair, and registration.

Education is important to her, and she will spend her income on her children's schooling. In the future, she hopes to see her children be successful in their studies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees, motor repair, and registration.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. 
Iman is a 24-year-old married woman from Beit Hanoun near Jabalia. She lives in a humble house with her husband and three young children; two boys and one daughter. Iman's husband works as an employee in the public sector and gets a low income. This income barely covers the family needs and necessary expenses. Iman's husband works also on a taxi in the evening so he will have another source of income. 
Iman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Iman's husband to do the yearly maintenance for his taxi. This will help him with part of the urgent expenses he has. This will allow him to work extra hours especially in the area where he lives which is very crowded.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a hardworking man who does his best to meet the target needs of his family. He has operated a laundry business, and his potential customers are neighbors and passersby. He dreams of purchasing a washing machine for greater efficiency and of expanding the business.

Once again, he comes to you asking for a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a washing machine for the business. He decided to join Yehu because of its favorable lending procedures, and he appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for the business.

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en:
Sarim is a villager from a rural area located in the Kandal province’s Ponhea Leur district. She is 46 years old and is married with three children. She earns a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for several years, Sarim can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the first loan for Sarim’s group of four members. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sarim wants to use her portion to build a proper latrine. She hopes to have a latrine for her family's use to increase their quality of life.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine.

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en:
Sambo, 43, is widowed. She lives in a rural area of Kandal province's Ponhea Leur district, Cambodia. Rice- and snack-selling have been her main sources of income for 10 years. The current business earns her approximately 25,000  KHR per day to meet her family's needs.
 
Sambo's group, for which she is the leader, consists of six members who live in the same village. She is a first time borrower with VisionFund. Now she and her group members are applying for a loan of 175,000 KHR each. She is going to use her portion to buy materials for building a decent latrine such as latrine bowl, tile draining etc. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a healthy latrine so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a decent latrine.

loans.name: Friends Group

texts.en:
Friends is a group composed of three Filipino ladies who have been friends since they arrived to Beirut. They decided to join hands and support each other financially for business purposes. 

Lorna is the leader and featured member of the group. She is a 32-year-old married mother of two children, standing on the far left of the picture. She owns a small business where she sells and trades purses on the network of "Whatsapp." Her husband is Lebanese and is currently unemployed. She needs the loan in order to purchase merchandise (bags, shoes, etc.) to enhance her business. She is planning to open her own shop in the future, but at this time, she can’t afford such financial expenses. 

As for the other group members, Gretchen is standing at the center of the picture, while Arlene is standing on the far right of the picture.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (bags, shoes, etc.) to enhance her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing items.

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is a widowed woman with three children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past eight years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling foodstuffs like maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Agricultores De Chuisajcab 1 Group

texts.es:
Francisco es el representante del Grupo de Agricultores Chuisajcab 1  (de camisa verde el primero del  lado izquierdo de la fotografía) es un  hombre  soltero de 54 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el Caserío Chuicascab, Aldea Tzucubal  Nahualá. 
El  es un hombre trabajador y amable, comenta que el se dedica a la siembra de maíz  a unos metro de su vivienda, eligió este tipo de actividad porque sus padres le enseñaron esta labor.
Ahora gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo puede alimentar a su familia y lo puede comercializar en el mercado local. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias buenas que lo ayudan a contribuir  con la economía familiar.
Los demás integrantes del grupo utilizaran una parte de este crédito para la siembra  de maíz, con el  propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de abono orgánico para el cultivo de maíz.
Su sueño es generar más ganancias para poder construir su vivienda y así darle  una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is the representative for the “Grupo do Agricultores Chuisajcab 1” (wearing a green shirt, the first from the left in the photograph). He is single, 54 years old, and lives with his daughter in the small town of Chuicascab, in the Tzucubal Nahualá aldea. 

He is a hardworking and friendly person. He explains that he plants corn a few meters from his house. He chose this type of business because his parents taught it to him.

Now, thanks to his hard work, he can feed his family and he also sells in the local market. Through his work he earns good income and earnings, which helps him to contribute to the family budget.

The other members of the group will use a portion of this loan to plant corn, with the goal of improving living conditions for their families. The loan will be used to buy organic manure for cultivating corn. 

His dream is to generate more income so he can build his house and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for cultivating corn.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Chanthy is a 23-year-old mother of one son. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming on 5 hectares of farmland, which she has been doing for one year. With her current business, she can earn about 51,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to spend for daily expenses.
 
This is the third loan for Chanthy with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She successfully paid back the loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Sandra Del Rosario

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 23 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar para apoyar a su familia, Sandra  no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Sandra trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa tanto para damas y caballeros, adicionalmente también brinda servicios de comida, ella vende almuerzos a diversos clientes, Sandra trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Sandra se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindad podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas de vestir, de esta manera tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y atenderá a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio puesto de ventas en un centro comercial de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 23-year-old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings. She is a very cheerful, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a strong desire to overcome. 

Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the fact that she needs to work to support her family, Sandra has not been able to study for the professional career in Nursing that she hoped for. In her free time, she likes to entertain herself by listening to music; sometimes, she cooks a delicious Ceviche to share with her family.

Through her own initiative, and with a lot of effort and dedication, Sandra works in her own small business selling clothes for women and men. In addition, she offers food services; she sells snacks to various customers. 

Sandra works every day for approximately 10 hours, and she believes that it’s going well for her because of her good prices and the kind manner that she has toward others. 

Sandra is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have offered, she will be able to keep her store better stocked and serve more customers. Therefore, she will continue working and making an effort to achieve her greatest dream of having her own sales stand in the city’s commercial center.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen emigrated to the U.S. from Peru with her two sons 15 years ago. Her sons studied medicine in Peru, but were unable to continue in the U.S. Thereafter, Carmen's family worked in several different industries to make ends meet, but created only insufficient income to get by.

To get back on their feet, Carmen and both of her sons started a landscaping business. Over the past seven years, they have built a steady clientele and have used punctuality and superior service to separate themselves from their competition. When Hurricane Sandy hit, Carmen's house and landscaping equipment were destroyed. In order to continue business during the landscaping season this year, Carmen used her assets to buy one new mower and rent another. With a loan of $5,350, Carmen can buy an additional mower and revive her business. Carmen anticipates her new capital will allow her to expand her clientele and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a new mower for her landscaping business and recover from Hurricane Sandy.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa emigrated to the U.S. from Honduras in 1998.  Before starting her own business, Rosa worked as an employee in another restaurant for many years. Rosa decided two years ago that she no longer wanted to be an employee and opened “Mi Rosita Restaurant.”

“Mi Rosita Restaurant” serves specifically Honduran food in a predominantly Hispanic area, which separates it from other local restaurants. 

With the help of a $3,150 loan, Rosa can buy new chairs and tables to improve the look of her restaurant and attract more customers. She can also buy an icemaker that would save her the time and capital she spends on buying ice daily.

Rosa hopes to grow her restaurant business and eventually open a new restaurant in order to better support her four sons.

loans.use: To buy new tables, chairs, and an icemaker for her restaurant.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.en:
Gladis is a Mexican immigrant who arrived in the U.S.16 years ago. She worked several jobs in her first few years here, but found a long-term career in hairdressing.

Gladis’ husband owns a restaurant called Las Cazuelas. Gladis divides her time between the restaurant and working at the William Anthony hair salon. As Gladis has the spirit of a hairdresser, she prefers to work at William Anthony full time. Her entrepreneurial drive, which she also cultivated at an Intersect Fund Class in 2009, has led her to consider buying the salon herself. With a loan of $5,335, Gladis can buy the salon and run her own business.

Gladis aspires to grow her business eventually into a complete spa that provides facials, nail care, and many other services.

loans.use: To buy a hair salon and start working toward her own goals.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ron doesn’t run your ordinary collections agency. Instead of harassing clients about their collections, he builds relationships with them – and then helps them build their credit.

Ron looks at collections as a way to give back to the community and the refuel the local economy. Ron regularly helps disadvantaged groups to build their credit. In fact, Cash-Flow Credit Counseling did community service at a local women’s shelter helping the women understand and build their credit scores.

Ron visits his customers personally and sends them thank-you notes when payments are made. He strongly believes in this model of credit building because it helps people get mortgages and loans, which spurs spending. He aspires to replicate this model around the country to change the way collections are done everywhere. 

The loan of $4,285 will help Ron pay for a phone, equipment, and marketing, which will bring in more customers, increase revenue, and eventually help him give more back to the community.

Check out Cash-Flow Credit Counseling & Collections below.
http://cf.mandocentrik.info/

video.title: Kiva Borrower Ronald from United States

loans.use: To develop his communications infrastructure and give more back to the community.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad came to the U.S. from Peru in 2006. For his first 10 months here, Natividad fixed electronics and machines. That work did not produce enough money to support himself and his family, so he decided to start a business in signs and glassmaking, an area he already had experience in from Peru.

Natividad provides superior quality and uniqueness in his work. He is flexible and provides impeccable customer service. 

The loan of $3,250 will help Natividad buy tools and marketing materials that will expand his customer base and help him do more jobs. Eventually, Natividad aspires to become the regional leader in his industry.

loans.use: To buy equipment for his business and reach out to new clients

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny emigrated to the U.S. from Peru in 2003. She has worked for Avon for many years, initially helping someone else who was selling Avon products. Seven months ago, Jenny started selling her own products in her whole new boutique!

Jenny is very excited to be selling accessories, gifts, and Avon products in her own storefront! Jenny has dedicated much effort to opening her own boutique. She hopes to expand, rent more space, and sell more inventory soon.

The loan will help Jenny buy more holiday inventory, improve her presentation and develop her clientele. She hopes that this expansion in her business will allow her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy new holiday inventory for her boutique.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna emigrated to the U.S. from Peru nearly 15 years ago. With two daughters and a son to support, Myrna had to work full time and cater from her house on the weekends to make ends meet. When her son unfortunately fell ill, Myrna had to leave the country for his treatment. During that time period, she lost her house and her job.

Myrna has made a remarkable recovery since then and opened her own restaurant. The seasoned caterer is now proving her expertise at her storefront. Myrna hopes that her restaurant will be successful and sustain her family. She aspires to one day expand to having more restaurants.

Myrna needs a loan to recover from the damage Hurricane Sandy had on her restaurant. The loan of $1,320 will help her buy new equipment and restore the restaurant itself. She hopes that with the renewal, her restaurant will thrive and she will finally be able to support her family comfortably.

loans.use: To recover from the toll Hurricane Sandy took on her restaurant.

loans.name: Ankadignongne Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe ANKADIGNONGNE, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, préfecture de Ségou ; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de savon, d’articles divers et de céréales.                                                 .                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe sont à leurs onze prêts solidaires.                                                                         
La cliente FANTA qui est assise en deuxième position a partir de la gauche, compte acheter 800 kilos d’arachide avec les grossistes du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place au Barouéli au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The Ankadignongne group of women are all married, and average 41 years of age with two children. All live in traditional extended families in the city of Barouéli, municipality of Segou, in the Segou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They became acquainted through kinship and neighborhood ties, and friendship. They sell vegetable tubers, soap, sundries and grain cereals. The women in the group are on their eleventh group loan.

Fanta is the member sitting second from the left. She plans to buy 800 pounds of groundnuts from wholesalers in the village and the surrounding area. She conducts her daily sales in Barouéli for cash and credit to a clientele composed of men and women.

She plans to make average monthly profits of 25,000 FCFA that will be used to contribute towards social ceremonies. The rest will be reinvested in her trading business.

loans.use: buy groundnuts

loans.name: Jose De La

texts.en:
Jose moved to the U.S. from Santo Domingo less than a year and a half ago. In Santo Domingo, Jose conducted a remodeling business. Jose has continued with the same line of work since moving to the U.S. Recreating that business in the U.S. was difficult because Jose had to redevelop his client base. For some time, Jose only reached out to family and friends. His great quality work then sent many referrals his way. 

Currently, Jose works the night shift at another job and works at his business part time. Ideally, Jose would like to grow his business enough to do remodeling full time and maybe even bring on other full-time employees. 

The loan of $2,150 will help Jose buy materials for his work and will help him get more jobs and provide better quality service to his clients. Eventually, he hopes this business will grow enough for him to work on it full time and leave his night job. Overall, he thinks success in this business could give his family a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy materials for his remodeling business and serve more clients.

loans.name: Damon

texts.en:
Damon is no stranger to the difficulties of homeownership, especially after the economic downturn of 2008. After having to deal with credit challenges and foreclosures the hard way, Damon decided to become a beacon of hope for other prospective homeowners in the community.

As a real estate consultant, Damon helps clients establish a rental background, find lending and eventually find the property right for them. The loan of $3,775 will help Damon increase his marketing and infrastructure, which will help him reach more clients. His future plans include making consulting education available through online classes.

loans.use: To market his business and help more people become homeowners.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean has always been a caretaker by nature. By being a teacher and daycare employee for many years, Jean has become a mother, in her own right, to every child she cares for and educates. She is well respected in her community for this very reason. Jean knows her community is in need of a daycare with extended hours for hard-working parents. 

Once this need was identified, Jean knew she wanted to be the one to create the solution. The only thing stopping her from opening her own childcare center was the lack of access to capital. It is for exactly this reason that Jean requested a loan. With this loan, Jean can buy furniture for her daycare. With the presence of her daycare, more children will have caretakers when their parents are working, and will be educated by a sharp woman at the same time. In the future, she hopes to expand and employ more caretakers just as passionate as she is.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her daycare center.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a hard working woman. She has spent years working full time at a laundromat, and has even done catering from home on the weekends just to be able to pay the mortgage. Even though things have been tough for her, Juliana has always believed she could start a venture of her own and become her own boss.

And Juliana is doing just that. Recently, she saw an opportunity in a Mexican restaurant that was being shut down. She took advantage of the moment and bought the place, which she has transformed into a restaurant for Peruvian cuisine. Juliana is set up for a grand opening very soon. She is confident in her venture because she already has a loyal client base from her home catering business.

Juliana needs basic working capital as she prepares for the opening. The money from this loan will be used for food, inventory, and other start-up costs that she needs to cover for her enterprise to be successful.

loans.use: to buy the inventory and food needed for her upcoming restaurant opening.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector comes from Honduras. Back in his own country, Hector used to work in the car business. After moving to the U.S. eight years ago, he started working in construction. He then had an accident, which left him unable to continue construction work. It was then that Hector reverted back to his passion, and started a business in which he sells, rents, and repairs cars.

This loan will allow Hector to buy the spare parts he needs to repair 7 of 30 cars in his shop so that he can sell and rent them out to the community. The repairing of these cars will allow him to generate more business and lead him to more success. Hector has great entrepreneurial drive and is very thankful for this opportunity to do what he loves!

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair seven cars

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas emigrated to the U.S. in 1999. For three years, he worked for a distributor that was importing and exporting Mexican food products. He learned the business model and decided to start his own business. He has now had own his food distribution business for over 12 years. As the price of organic food has gone slightly down, and demand for organic food has gone up, Nicolas felt the need to increase the number of his organic products. He wants to do this to be both socially responsible and responsive to his customers’ needs.  

This loan will allow Nicolas to expand his new organic food product line and be one of leading organic distributors in New Jersey.

loans.use: to buy more organic products to sell

loans.name: Ulda

texts.en:
Ulda and her family have been in the bakery business a long time. When her dad first came to the U.S., he was a driver for several bread distributors. He then became an independent driver and opened his own bread distribution business 20 years ago. When Ulda and her mom came to the U.S. from Ecuador, they joined in and made it a family business.

Ulda and her family are now looking to expand their enterprise and become bread manufacturers themselves. They already have the customer base from years of work in the industry and they plan to distribute to supermarkets, delis, and restaurants with whom they already have relationships. Her family is very hard working and successful. Their origins in Ecuador were humble: Ulda’s father had to move from city to city to keep food on the table. Still, Ulda believes her family can and will be well off. In order to become manufacturers, the family will need to buy equipment and a cold room. This loan will allow Ulda’s family to do just that and keep their business thriving.

loans.use: to buy equipment needed to become a bread manufacturer.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon has been in the car business for a long time. He has been the go-to mechanic in his community for years. Since he moved to the U.S. from the Dominican Republic, he has run a successful auto repair shop.

Recently, Ramon has decided to branch out to the trucking and transportation businesses. He picks up containers from ports and vice versa. In order to complete this expansion, Ramon needs a loan to buy a new truck. Because he is very well known and has faithful clients, he is sure that this expansion will happen successfully.

loans.use: To purchase a truck to expand his transportation business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a Peruvian immigrant who has been in the U.S. for about 10 years. Elizabeth was working as a medical representative when she was first introduced to Avon. Being the fashion-savvy woman she is, Elizabeth was attracted to the business model and started selling Avon part time.

Before she knew it, Elizabeth’s clientele grew exponentially! Capitalizing on her entrepreneurial drive, Elizabeth recently opened her own boutique where she sells Avon, jewelry, and cell phone services. Elizabeth is with her husband, Samuel, in the photo of their boutique above. Elizabeth has learned the ins-and-outs of Avon and has become an expert in selling beauty products.

Now Elizabeth wants to take advantage of the opportunity to be her own boss and a successful entrepreneur. This loan will allow Elizabeth to market her business in more magazines and at more events, and realize her potential as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to advertise her boutique.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio was born and raised in El Salvador. He used to work in the operations department of a bank. Unfortunately, the banking system became unstable, and he decided to leave his country and come to the United States with his daughter. He first worked at a minimum wage job, but was unable to provide his family with the basic necessities. He was then introduced to Herbalife, where he developed his salesmanship skills. Three years ago, he decided to open up his own Herbalife Club, which has fortunately been very successful. Since then, demand for his products has been growing. 

Julio’s goals are to expand his product line to new countries and to open Herbalife Clubs in more cities. The loan of $6,925 will allow Julio to renovate his store, purchase more inventory, and do more marketing.

loans.use: to renovate his store, purchase more inventory, and do more marketing.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo was born in Ecuador. At the age of 18, he started a business selling products to people in his town and nearby cities. Thirteen years ago, he decided to explore the United States and learn about new technology. When he arrived in the U.S., he worked a low-wage job for about four months. He then started his own business with the savings he had accumulated over many years. Leonardo distributes cosmetic products all over the U.S.  

Leonardo's goals are to expand his product line to new and previous customers. This loan will help Leonardo purchase a vehicle, advertise his business, and visit more stores in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase a new vehicle, pay for advertising and pay for travel to new accounts

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph repairs shoes the traditional way: he sews them by hand. He is widely recognized for being one of the last cobblers in his area. Some even say he’s the best shoemaker in town! Anyone who has been to Joseph’s store knows that he works six days a week and eleven hours a day, without ever taking a day off. 

Joseph, originally from Africa, received his training in shoe repair in Germany. After moving to the U.S., he opened his own shoe store, which he has now had for over 20 years. Joseph has kept alive what many would call a lost art. In order to sustain his business, Joseph has requested a loan. This loan will allow him to buy more inventory and increase his marketing. Joseph knows his hard work and commitment to his craft will continue to pay off!

loans.use: To increase marketing and inventory for his shoe business.

loans.name: Diego

texts.en:
Diego is an Ecuadorian immigrant who moved to the U.S. in 2010. Not being able to find a job pushed him to start his own business, in which he exports products from the U.S. to Ecuador. He identified that there was a large Ecuadorian population on the East coast and therefore, there was a demand for the exportation of products that people wanted to send back home. 

Diego’s goals are to expand his business into other states where the Ecuadorian population is growing. The loan of $2,150 will allow Diego to purchase a van and have working capital for his business. With both of these, he hopes to offer new product lines in Ecuador and the U.S.

loans.use: to purchase a van and transport more exports.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
When Jimmy was only 16 years old, his mom gave him $800 worth of savings. Jimmy put it into installing his first sound and light system in his own basement. When people started noticing, they called him to set up their parties too. It was in this way that Jimmy's business started. Now, 20 years later, Jimmy is a professional DJ and sound/light installer. Jimmy sets up any stage, from basements to banquet halls. He has contracts with several important venues in the area. 

Jimmy is proud of what he does. Being a DJ and installing sound and light systems have been his passion for over half his life. With this loan of $5,250, he can purchase brand new lighting equipment, land his next big contract, and truly turn his basement business into a success.

loans.use: To purchase the lighting equipment that will allow him to land his next big contract.

loans.name: Kuku

texts.en:
Kuku’s business, Kristal Cargo, offers international cargo shipment services for consumers, primarily to Nigeria. Kuku collects boxes from customers at his home and aggregates them together into 3-5 shipments per month that are sent via air to Lagos, Nigeria. Kuku’s customers are primarily Nigerian immigrants from all over New Jersey who are sending packages to their home country. So far, Kuku has been operating his business from his living room. He has even removed his dining table in order to support it.

Kuku needs this loan of $10,000 to buy a plot of land on which he can build a warehouse to sustain his business. This will increase Kuku’s capacity and allow him to take even larger shipments in the future. Right now, Kuku has his tractor parked outside of his home in a residential area. In order to respect zoning laws and not be shut down, Kuku needs to find another place for it soon. A plot of land will provide him a space within which to park it. Kuku hopes to grow his business enough within the next three years to quit his installation work. He is happy that his business helps Nigerian immigrants send shipments back home and maintain ties with their home country.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land on which he can build a warehouse

loans.name: Yenifer

texts.en:
Yenifer is passionate about working with children. For six years, Yenifer volunteered to babysit kids. Through her experiences, she saw the great need for daycares in her community.

Now, Yenifer is starting her own “Mami’s Daycare.” She says, “I am still in the start-up phase of my business, but the loan has helped me to pay for state license, permits, and construction that are required for my daycare business.”

With the help of this loan, Yenifer will be able to finish the construction of “Mami’s Daycare” and meet the needs of mothers and fathers in the community that work late nights or are attending school. She loves her community and aspires to give back with flexible hours and late hours of operation for these parents.  The above photo features Yenifer with her baby, a relationship in her life that inspires her to work with children.

loans.use: To proceed with the construction of her daycare and acquire the state licenses that are required to provide daycare services to the community.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria was born and raised in the Dominican Republic where she opened her first beauty salon. In 2002, Maria emigrated to the U.S. Here in America, Maria worked in other salons for over 10 years. She opened her own parlor four months ago. From the parlor, she also sends money internationally for customers. Maria has high aspirations for her business. She hopes to expand and eventually open more salons. 

This loan will allow Maria to create a web presence, buy more inventory, and most importantly, build her credit so she will have access to more capital in the future. Maria is confident that her personal relationship with her customer base and her unbeatable prices will lead her new venture to thrive!

loans.use: To buy inventory and advertise her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en:
Mesaid has a business operating a fruit and vegetable stall. She sells from home to her neighbors and she dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase four sacks of fruit and three sacks of vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support and she is thankful and grateful for the support.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of fruit and three sacks of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en: Concordia is a 42-year-old married woman who operates a sari-sari (variety) store in the town of Talibon, Bohol.  She has five children. She sells goods including sugar, noodles, biscuits and soft drinks. She started her business 10 years ago. Concordia requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy stock such as seasoning, condiments and soft drinks. She hopes to have enough savings so she can live comfortably. In the future, Concordia plans to make her store bigger so she can continue in a bigger way with a better profit.

loans.use: to buy stock such as seasoning, condiments and soft drinks

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Mon is 39 years of age and married. He and his wife have three children, two of whom are still in school. Mon and his wife earn a living through farming rice and planting cassava and they have been in this business for almost twenty years. With his current business, he is able to earn approximately 45,000 KHR per day to support his family. 
This is the first loan for Mon with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He is requesting a loan with VisionFund of 1,500,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland. He hopes to improve his crop yields and to sell the rice for a good price so as to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Sat

texts.en: Sat, 24, lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province and she is married with two children. The family’s main sources of income are from planting cassava and farming rice in the local village. She has been in this business for several years. She can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Sat has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has completely repaid the loans, which has helped to relieve the family's burden and to improve their livelihood. To support her business, she is requesting a loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, of 2,600,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will also use a portion of it to spend on labor and land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mendbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Mendbaatar, age 42, lives with his wife and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a salesman at a private business entity, which requires him to use his own automobile to drive around the city to sell the products. His wife has been selling clothes at a trade center by renting a stall since 2010. His elder son works at a television station as a spokesman. 

Mendbaatar is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase various types of clothes in order to support his wife's business. In this way, they can run the business without worrying about inventory shortage and they can satisfy the needs of customers. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase various types of clothes in order to sell.

loans.name: Azar

texts.en:
Azar  is 47 years old, married and the father of two children. He has his own business selling food products.  Azar’s son is also helping him in this business, because it is only finance income to their family.  

Azar sells food products like macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop. He has 15 years of experience in this field, and this allows him to consider himself as a knowledgeable and skilled person. His true profession is accounting, which helps him to run this business effectively by knowing every little expense.

The food products he sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 100 AZN. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location, in the central bazaar of his home city.

Azar has applied for 2000 AZN, which he will use to purchase and diversify additional food stuff.

Azar would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying more food products.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.ru: Хамида образованная женщина, проживающая в районе Рудаки. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем и у нее трое детей. Хамида имеет высшее образование. Она работает учительницей в средней школе. Так как ее зарплата очень маленькая и не хватает на нужды семьи, Хамида решила заняться собственным бизнесом. Жаркое лето это сезон торговли арбуза и дыни. Поэтому Хамида проанализировав решила заняться торговлей в этой сфере. Она уже приобрела торговую точку на рынке района. К тому же у нее имеется стартовый капитал в размере 4000 сомони, высланные мужем, который находится на заработках в России. Хамида запрашивает кредит. Она на сумму кредита и сбережения хочет закупить арбузы и дыни, и начать торговлю. Занявшись этим прибыльным бизнесом, Хамида сможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Hamida is an educated woman who lives in Rudaki. She is 39 years old, married and has three children. Hamida has a college degree and works as a teacher at the local school. Since her salary is too small toprovide for her family, Hamida has decided to start her own business. The hot summer is the season for selling watermelons and cantaloupes. Hamida analyzed the market and decided to sell these fruits. She has already purchased a market stall and she has a starting capital of 4000 somoni, which were sent by her husband, a migrant worker in Russia. Hamida will use this loan along with her savings to purchase watermelons and cantaloupes and start selling them. This lucrative business will help Hamida improve the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon and cantaloupes and start her own business

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a 57-year-old widowed woman with 3 children. She sells different kind of goods as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candies. She has 10 years of experience and has a deep knowledge of the market and demand of clients.

Food product she sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 120 AZN. Her son helps to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income in her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of the good location, in the central bazaar of her home city.

Now she needs 1900 AZN, an amount to expand her business in the future. She has a good credit history. This is a her 3rd loan.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for her store

loans.name: Xirda

texts.en:
Xirda is 50 years old and not married. She lives with her parents in her own city. She is selling food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages. Her brother is helping her in this business. This is only source of income to their family, and from this business her monthly profit is  about 150 AZN. She has 8 years of experience in this field. 

People in her town are regular customers who purchase food products and other available items at the store. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of her good location in the bazaar of her home city.

Xirda wants to expand her business and to buy more products. For this purpose she applied for 2,000 AZN. She has a good client history and this will be her 2nd loan.

loans.use: to buy more products.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 41 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children, all of whom currently attend school. For the past seven years, Stephen has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells glass. 

To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more glass to sell, and will help Stephen to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Stephen hopes that in the future he will be able to provide better quality building glass in town. 

Stephen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stephen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more building glass to sell

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 45 years old and lives with his wife and a son in Kobuleti, littoral town of Georgia. His wife, Maya, stays home taking care of her child. His son, Luka, is ten years old and studies at a local primary school. 

Tamaz has purchased a mini-bus and now has small-scale trading business. He buys different kinds of products, such as dishes and clothing, at wholesale prices and sells them in the villages near Kobuleti with a price mark up. Tamaz uses his mini-bus for product transportation and is the only income provider in the family. His profit is not enough to cover everyday expenses.
