In order to improve his family’s finances, Tamaz is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase spare parts and to cover repair fees of his mini-bus to start his transportation service business and connect the passengers to neighboring towns. He will also install seats in his mini-bus to offer comfortable journey to his clients. 

Tamaz’s loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

In the future Tamaz would like to purchase new household items and furniture for improving the lifestyle of the family.

loans.use: to cover repair fees of his mini-bus for starting a transportation service business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a divorced woman who has been blessed with two children. She lives in a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and rental bills.

She operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest challenge is the high cost of transportation. With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding into a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad began working as a car repairman when he was 17 years old. He repairs and paints completely damaged cars. His work is his only source of income. He is a very capable young man, his dream is to expand and have a better opportunity to help his parents and sisters. Today Murad's aim is to buy a cheap battered car, restore and re-sell it at a higher price. Money from the sale will be used to invest in the expansion of his auto shop and the purchase of new equipment for its operation.

loans.use: to buy on the cheap the crumpled car, build it again, restore and re-sell it.

loans.name: Mandzaanos Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of six members and all are females. They live in the same neighborhood and are into the trading of footwear, cooking utensils, underwear, cutlery sets and fish.

Comfort, who sells products such as footwear and sachet water (water bagged in small plastic bags), is very excited to receive her sixth loan from ID-Ghana, after having repaid her previous loans and thus taken a step towards expanding her business. With this loan, she is planning to use GHS 1200 to purchase a bag of footwear and forty bags of sachet water.

Comfort says that her most important challenge and goal is to set up a store where she can sell all of her items instead of going outside and walking in her communities and others nearby. She enjoys being at home with her long-term husband and three children. She is planning to reinvest her profits in her business and save for her future plans and challenges.

The group needs a total amount of GHS 6700 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a bag of footwear and forty bags of sachet water and sell to customers.

loans.name: Soule

texts.fr:
Monsieur Soule est né en 1984, célibataire et sans enfants il vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec ses parents à Konobougou, cercle de Barouéli, Région de Ségou République du Mali. 
Il est installé à son compte il y’à  peu près deux ans, et il décide d’entrer en collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso pour mieux organiser son activité. Il est à son  premier prêt, qu’il compte utiliser pour achète  4 chèvres et 3 moutons et les revend aux bouchers et  commerçants de bétails. Il espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA. 
Monsieur Soule  ambitionne d’agrandir son activité grâce à la collaboration que Soro.
texts.en:
Mr. Soule was born in 1984. He is single and does not have any children and lives in a traditional family with his parents in Konobougou, which is in the Barouéli circle in the Segou region of the Republic of Mali.
He started his business about two years ago and decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to organise his business better. This is his first loan and he plans to use it to buy four goats and three sheep for resale to butchers and livestock dealers. He hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40.000 FCFA.
Mr. Soule hopes to enlarge his business thanks to his collaboration with Soro.

loans.use: To buy small ruminants.

loans.name: Tonia

texts.en:
Please meet 40-year-old Tonia from St. Paul, Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish, due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free port. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

She completed 12 grades and is single. She has four children between the ages of 25 and 19. They are in school and living on their own. Tonia owned a shop where she has been selling charcoal for the past 5 years in her community.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more charcoal for her business.
  
On average, she works 8hours at her business.  She started her business with money from her mother. She transports her merchandise by pickup.  She cites her small income as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is making a profit.  In the future, she would like to build a house.  
She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi, sont de femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 48 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Klakouma, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de vanne.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente Fatoumata,  1 ère debout à droite fait le commerce de haricot préparé  pendant la nuit et le matin et celui de vannes et de la petite restauration la nuit.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de haricots, 1 bidon d’huile alimentaire, 1 colis de condiments et 50 vannes, sur place
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 18 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are married women who are on average 48 years old with five children. They all live in extended traditional families in Klakouma, in Massigui commune, Dioïla prefecture that is in the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali)
They came to know each other through friends and through living in the same neighbourhood. They sell basketwork.
This is the sixteenth solidarity loan for the women of the group.
Fatoumata who is the first standing on the right, sells beans prepared during the night and the morning and sells basketwork and snacks at night.
She plans to use her loan to buy locally two sacks of beans, one can of comestible oil, one bag of condiments and 50 canes.
She expects to make an average monthly profit of 18 000FCFA which she will use for her family's needs and part of it will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy various articles.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is single and has two children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a firewood selling business for the past three years. She sells from home to her neighbors; she faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of incorporating charcoal into her existing business in the near future.

With the loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Sidlawende Ii Group

texts.fr:
Mme LAMOUSSA est la responsable du groupe SIDLAWENDE II. Marié, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 02 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les provinces environnantes. Ses clients sont les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter une rangée de bois et un sac de charbon de bois.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices pour son activité. Elle ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Lamoussa is the leader of the Sidlawende II group. She is married with four children. The oldest is 14 and the youngest is four. Two of them go to school.
Mrs Lamoussa has been selling firewood and charcoal for six years. She buys her stock in neighbouring regions. Her customers are women.
She wants to buy a rack of wood and a sack of charcoal.
Mrs Lamoussa   wants to save the profits for her business. Her ambition is to enlarge her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a rack of wood and a bag of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and to clear weeds from the fields.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, y vive en su casa propia junta su hijo. Luisa se dedica al servicio de cosmetología. Atiende a diversos clientes que requieren de algún arreglo estético como corte de cabello, tintes, y otros. Además, vende productos de belleza femeninos como tintes, labiales, perfumes y otros. Se inició en esta actividad hace más de 03 años y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja gracias a su fiel clientela. Ahora se siente una empresaria próspera e independiente. Espera continuar su negocio y poco a poco implementar un espacio en su casa para que pueda atender con mayor comodidad. Este es el tercer préstamo con Kiva. Está contenta y agradecida con las personas que hacen posible su crédito que le servirá para continuar con sus planes. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará artículos que usa en su trabajo de cosmetóloga como tintes capilares, cremas, peines y otros.
texts.en:
Luisa, 31, is a single mother and lives with her son in her own home.  She has a beauty businesas and attends to customers who require some kind of beauty treatment such as hair cuts, color and other services.  She also sells women's products such as hair color, lipstick, perfumes and other items.  She started her business over three years ago and so far works alone.  In her opinion, the business is fairly profitable because of her high earnings thanks to her loyal customers.  Now she feels like a prosperous, independent entrepreneur.

She hopes to continue her business and little by little set up a space at home where she can attend to customers more comfortably.  This is her third Kiva loan and she is grateful to the lenders for helping her continue with her plans.  That is why she is committed to paying back the loan on time as with her previous loans.  She will use the 1,500 PEN to buy articles for her beauty business such as hair color, conditioners, combs and other items.

loans.use: To buy hair color and conditioners for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Lleni

texts.es:
Lleni tiene 28 años, está casada y vive en su casa propia junta su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Lleni se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, su negocio está ubicado el interior de su propia casa. Se inició en esta actividad hace 5 años. Con mucho esfuerzo pudo establecer su propia tienda en su casa y está más tranquila por el momento. Al principio fue difícil obtener clientes porque ay muchas otras tiendas en el barrio, pero ahora tiene muchos clientes fieles. Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite poder ver a sus niños en su casa, además le está yendo muy bien ya que genera muchos ingresos para su hogar, tiene muchos planes para su negocio como agrandarlo y así poder vender en mayor cantidad. Es el séptimo préstamo con Kiva, y está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que está recibiendo y por la confianza que tienen en ella para seguir adelante.
Con el monto de 1800 soles, comprará 3 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, cajas de leche grande, entre otros productos por su tienda.
texts.en:
Lleni, 28, is married and lives with her husband and four children in her own house.  She runs a grocery store which she opened at home five years ago.  With a lot of effort she was able to establish her business and things are running smoothly.  At first it was difficult to attract customers because of the many stores in the neighborhood but now she has a loyal following.

She very much enjoys her work because it gives her time to spend with her children.  It is also a good business that generates a high income for her household.  Lleni has plans to expand her store so she can sell more merchandise.  This is her seventh Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving and the confidence shown in her.

With the 1,800 PEN she will buy three sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, cases of milk and other groceries.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, sugar and mlik to sell at her store.

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiseme, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  de Guégnaka dans la ville de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de condiment d’habillements et d’articles divers.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe sont à leur douzième prêt.                                                                                                                                                                                  
La cliente Maïmouna, première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter de l’oignon des poissons et de la patate à Niono chez les grossistes pour ensuite venir vendre à Fana Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de 25000 FCFA par cycle.
texts.en:
The Djiguiseme group is exclusively made up of married women who on average are 40 years old with five children. They all live in extended traditional families in the Guégnaka quarter of Fana, Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali)
They met through friends and living in the same neighbourhood. They sell condiments, clothes and various articles.
This is their 12th loan.
Maïmouna who is the first on the right sitting down, plans to buy onions, fish and potatoes from Niono the wholesaler to sell in Fana. She hopes to make a profit of 25000 FCFA for each rotation.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, como colonias, perfumes, ropa y otros. Todo su trabajo lo realiza en su casa o por las calles de la ciudad y inició en este trabajo hace 06 años, con el tiempo fue aprendiendo y capacitándose en técnicas de ventas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede tener tiempo para poder hacer todas las actividades que desee, además de brindarle también atención a su hija, le está yendo muy bien ya que tiene ingresos que le permiten proyectarse algunos planes a futuro, pero lo que desea por ahora es seguir creciendo y aumentar la variedad de productos a ofrecer para que sus ganancias se multipliquen. Este es el segundo préstamo con Kiva y está muy contenta de saber que le brindan un apoyo financiero ya que eso le genera seguridad para avanzar con su trabajo, además se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.
Con el monto de 800 soles, comprará productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas corporales, cremas de manos, talcos, cosméticos y otros accesorios para tener en stock para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marisol sells beauty products such as colognes, perfumes, clothing and other items.  She does all her work either from home or in the as a street vendor.  She has been in business for six years after learning sales techniques and receiving training.  What she enjoys about her job is the fact that she has time to do all the things she likes while also taking care of her daughter.  Business is doing well and Marisol has enough income to think about future plans.  But what she wants to do for now is to continue expanding and increasing her range of products so she can multiply her profits.

This is her second Kiva loan and and she is happy knowing she will receive financial support because it will generate more security for her to advance in her work.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.

She will use the 800 PEN loan to buy beauty products such as perfumes, body creams, hand creams, talcum powders, cosmetics and other accessories to have on hand for her customers.

loans.use: To buy beauty products such as creams and cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hellen Isabel

texts.es: Hellen, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está soltera,  vive con su hijo, hermanos y padres, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de madera y materiales para realizar el acondicionamiento de un cuarto de habitación y pagar mano de obra en los trabajos a realizar, y así poderle ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y a su familia. Con esta compra pretende hacer una mejora de buena calidad a su casa y que su familia mejoré su calidad de vida y aprovechar precios bajos en algunos materiales y que son de buena calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Hellen, 22, is single and lives with her son, siblings and parents, who are her main priority.  She plans to use the loan to buy wood and materials and hire workers to renovate her home.  She wants to give her son and family a better quality of life and hopes to be able to take advantage of bargain prices on some of the better quality materials.

This is her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has never had a state bank loan but FUDECOSUR is giving her better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Phoern's Group

texts.en: Coming from a rural village in the Tbaung Khum district of Cambodia, Phoern is aged 35 years and married with four children. She and her husband are hard-working farmers who earn a living through farming rice and cassava. They have been in this business for several years. Phoern’s group is just with VisionFund this cycle. Phoern, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and spend on labor. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business to make more income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Timani Group

texts.en:
Temani is a group composed of three Lebanese women. They decided to form the group in order to support each other financially. Iman is the leader and featured member of the group. She is a 47-year-old married mother of two children, and she is standing in the center of the picture. She owns a small bakery where she prepares manakish, the traditional Lebanese breakfast served with several different delicious toppings (cheese, thyme etc…). Her husband also owns a small business where he is charge of car painting. Her children are enrolled in a public school because they cannot afford anything more expensive.  She decided to establish this group in order to purchase raw materials such as flour, oil, thyme and cheese to strengthen her business . In addition to that, she might buy furniture to enhance the environment of her household.

As for the other group members, Zeina is the woman wearing red, while Abir is standing on the far right of the picture.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as flour, oil, thyme and cheese  to strengthen her business

loans.name: Savoern

texts.en:
Savoern, a rural villager from the Kandal Stoeng district, is 44 years old. She has two dependent children, both of whom are still in school. Savoern has earned a living through farming rice. Having engaged in this business for 15 years, Savoern is able to save up to $3 per day from her current business after deducting expenses. 

This is the third-cycle loan for Savoern with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. The past loan, which she successfully paid back, has helped her to sustain her living conditions as well as her business in a gradual manner. 

For this cycle, she is applying for an education loan to cover the school fees for her daughter, a 19-year-old freshman at a local university specializing in management. Savoern hopes that this loan will enable her to send her daughter to a university and also help her daughter to end up with a good job after graduating in order to help support her family.

loans.use: To cover the school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Ngem's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Pursat Reap province’s Kror Kor district, Ngem, 43, is married with eight children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. For the last 12 years, she has been farming rice to support her family. 

Ngem has been with VisionFund for six cycles, and she has completely paid back her loans, which have enabled her to better her family’s living conditions. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, Sokhom wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her paddy field business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dème, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 48 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Klakouma, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, tel que le riz, le mil etc.                                                                
Les femmes du groupe sont à leur seizième prêt. 
La cliente Fatoumata, la personne assise à gauche fait le commerce de riz et compte acheter 200 kilos de production locale auprès des producteurs. L vente se fait au comptant et en détail, à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Dème group is made up of married women, who average 48 years of age, with an average of five children each, and who all live in large traditional families in the village of Klakouma, in the municipality of Massigui, in the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region).

They got to know each other through relatives, neighbors and friends and all trade in cereals, such as rice, millet etc. The women in the group are on their 16th loan.

The customer, Fatoumata, who is sitting on the left of the photo, trades in rice and is planning to buy 200 kilos of local produce from farmers. She sells for cash and on a retail basis to a customer base made up essentially of women.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, which will be used for the family's needs; part will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy hulled rice.

loans.name: Hawanatu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Hawanatu. She is married and has three children, ages 3, 12 and 17 years. In 1990, Hawanatu established her slippers and clothing business. She inherited this business from her aunt, who brought her up because she never went to school. This business is her only means of livelihood, says Hawanatu. 

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, Hawanatu earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. Hawanatu requires a loan in order to buy different kinds of clothing and slippers for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 500,000. Hawanatu is fully supporting her husband for the children’s education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers and clothing for her business.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is 24 years old and single. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a cafeteria where he sells sandwiches and juices. He likes this business because he thinks it offers good services for his clients. He sold some of his jewelery and land in order to establish his business. 

Recently, Khalil doesn’t have enough money to buy products for his business. Therefore, he has asked for a youth loan in the amount of YER 200,000 to buy products such as sandwiches and juices for his business. He hopes that this will enable him to attract more clients and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy products such as sandwiches and juices for his business.

loans.name: Sebeke Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe SEBEKE, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, préfecture de Ségou, Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de tubercules, de savon, d’articles divers et de céréales.                                                                                                                                    
Les femmes du groupe SEBEKE, sont à leur vingtième prêt.                                                                         
La cliente BINTOU assise en première position à partir de la droite, compte acheter de l’habillement chez les grossistes à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à Barouéli au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of Sebeke Group average 36 years of age and three children. They are all married and live in extended traditional families in Barouéli, a town in Ségou Prefecture, Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community, and friendship. They sell tubers, soaps, cereals, and various items. The women of Sebeke Group are seeking their twentieth loan.

Bintou (the woman sitting on the right in the photograph) intends to buy clothing from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells daily in Barouéli, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 75'000 (ca US$ 150) to be used in part to cover her contribution to social ceremonies. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Fousseyni

texts.fr:
Monsieur Fouseyni est  né vers 1973, il est père de trois enfants et vit dans une famille nucléaire à Konobougou, cercle de Barouéli, Région de Ségou République du Mali. 
Monsieur Fouseyni, exerce le commerce de la pneumatique et accessoires il y’a plus de dix ans. Il s’approvisionne en pneu, chambre à air et les jantes  à Bamako qu’il vend à Konobougou en détail.  Il détient un magasin aux abords du goudron dans la ville de Konobougou. Il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour mieux organiser son activité. Il est à son troisième prêt et les deux précédents furent correctement remboursés. Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son activité et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
Mr. Fouseyni was born circa 1973. He's the father of three children and lives in a nuclear family in Konobougou, Barouéli Cercle, Ségou Region, Republic of Mali.
 
Mr. Fouseyni has been selling tires and accessories for more than ten years. He gets his supplies of tires, inner tubes, and wheel rims in Bamako, and retails them in Konobougou. He owns a shop on the roadside in Konobougou. 

He works with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better organize his business. He is seeking his third loan, and the previous two were repaid without problems.

He foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200), to be used to expand his business and cover his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy tires, inner tubes, and wheel rims

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary, de 41 años, está casada con Emilio y tiene 04 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.
Mary se dedica a cuidar los niños de las madres solteras de su distrito, se dedica alimentarlos, protegerlos y darles mucho amor, por eso sus amigas y vecinas dejen en plena confianza a su pequeños hijos, a los que recogen después de sus distintas labores. Lleva 5 años en este negocio y aunque su trabajo a veces suele ser un poco pesado, ella sabe que debe dar todo de si para que los niños esten bien cuidados. Este es su tercer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1300 soles, comprará juguetes para los niños que atiende y cuida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old. She is married to Emilio and has 4 children, whom she lives with in her own home. 

Mary takes care of children of single mothers in her district. She feeds them, protects them and gives them a lot of love. That is why her friends and neighbors totally trust her to leave their small children with, and pick them up after their different jobs. She has had this business for 5 years and although her job is little hard sometimes, she knows that she has to give anything so that the children are well cared for. This is her third loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the support she has received to get ahead. She is also committed to making her payments on time. With the amount of 1300 soles, she will buy toys for the children she serves and cares for in her home.

loans.use: to buy toys for children younger than 5.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 46-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. She has been engaged in the food-vending business. She makes and sells snack foods like banana cue (covered with caramelized brown sugar), camote (sweet potato) and ice candy to earn for a living. Her business started five years ago. Her husband work as a security guard. Erlinda requested a loan 0f 5,000 PHP to buy more ingredients like medium ripe banana, sweet potato and sugar. 

In the future, Erlinda would like to expand her food-vending business to provide her family with good food and quality education.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasonings and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to re-plant his farm with organic coffee.

loans.name: Natik

texts.en:
Natik, 36, is married, living in the village of Kabali with his wife, two children and retired parents. Natik’s children go to the public school. He’s a very hardworking, enthusiastic man who focuses all his efforts into getting ahead.

Natik works very hard on his own greenhouses where he grows cucumbers, tomatoes and various of vegetables during the whole year. His products are very good quality, and he sells his harvests among vegetable retailers. With the received loan, Natik will purchase a cargo van to start a vegetable-selling business. He will transport his harvest to the capital city open market and sell them for a higher price. 

The credit will significantly increase his family's income. It is obvious that the family's financial needs are significant, but Natik will work hard to solve them and give their children a better life.

He wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cargo van for trading.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with six school-going children. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling food stuff made from maize flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil for sale

loans.name: Ett

texts.en:
Ett is aged 34 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province and she has three children. To make a living, she has been growing beans and cucumbers for 13 years. She earns about 20,000KHR per day and she can manage to save about 8,000KHR each day after her daily expenses.
 
Ett has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she successfully paid back the first loan which has helped her better support her family. Now she is requesting for a loan of 3,500,000KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Heremakono, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 48 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Klakouma, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de vanne et la vente de haricot préparé.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Heremakono sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente Alimata, debout au milieu fait le commerce de haricot pendant la nuit. Elle compte acheter 1 sac de haricot et des condiments pour la préparation vente  du haricot la nuit, à une clientèle diverse et variée, au comptant et en détail.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Heremakono Group is made up of married women who average 48 years of age and five children. They all live in extended traditional families in Klakouma, a village in Massigui Commune, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community, and friendship. They sell basketry and prepared beans, and are seeking their sixteenth solidarity loan (group loan).

Alimata (the woman standing in the middle) is selling beans during the night. She intends to use one sack of beans and condiments required to prepare beans that she sells at night, retail and for cash, to a very diverse clientele.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 10'000 (ca US$ 20) to used in part to provide for herself and her family. The other part will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy beans and condiments

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, de 23 años de edad, está casada con Juan y tiene 02 hijos de 05 y 02 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Mónica se dedica a la venta de plátanos. Todos los días instala una mesa al costado de la tienda de su madre, de esa manera oferta sus productos a los clientes de la bodega donde no se vende este producto. En algunas ocasiones diversifica sus ventas con algunas verduras regionales como pepino, ajíes, limones u otros. Tiene más de 03 años realizando éste negocio y hasta el momento se dedica sola a atender a sus clientes de manera amable y cordial. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico y le permite tener una ocupación y sentirse una persona productiva. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable ya que logra vender todos sus productos, además tiene planes de comprarse un mototaxi y alquilarlo para así generarse más ingresos económicos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles comprará plátanos y algunas verduras al por mayor.
texts.en: Mónica is 23 years old, married to Juan and has two children who are 5 and 2 years old. She lives with her family in her own home. Mónica sells plantains. Everyday she is busy at a table that she sets up to one side of her mother's store and from here she offers her produce to customers. Sometimes, she likes to diversify her product by offering regional vegetables such as cucumber, chili peppers, lemons and others. She has been selling vegetables for 3 years and she always attends to her customers in a cordial and friendly way. She likes her business because she is able to earn some money but also because she is able to have her own profession and feel productive. She considers her business to be very profitable because she typically sells all her produce. She also has plans to buy a mototaxi and to rent it out to others in order to earn even more money. This is her fourth loan with Kiva and she is very thankful for the financial support she has received in order to continue forward in her business. She also promises to repay her loan on a timely basis. With the credit she will purchase more wholesale plantains and some other vegetables.

loans.use: purchase wholesale plantains and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertiliser and to clean her farm.

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es: Lastenia tiene 48 años, está casada y vive su propia casa junta su esposo y su hija. Lastenia se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, pan y otros. Para eso cuenta con una tienda que está instalada en su casa y es 5 años que viene trabajando en su tienda. Realiza esta actividad sola y en ocasiones con el apoyo de su  esposo cuando tiene ratos libres. Le  gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su hogar, así como los ingresos económicos que le genera para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar. Ahora tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Este es el duodécimo préstamo con Kiva, Por ello espera agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto de 2500 nuevos soles invertirá en la compra de más productos comestibles como pan, arroz, azúcar, y otros por su negocio.
texts.en: Lastenia is 48 years old, married, and lives in her own home alongside her husband and daughter. Lastenia sells food items like rice, sugar, bread and more. In order to do this, she relies on a part of her home to act as a business. She has been working from home in this way for 5 years. She works alone and sometimes she helps her husband in her free time. She likes her work because it allows her to stay at home and also to earn some money that she uses to help her husband out with household expenses. Now, she has plans to continue with her business and to see it grow. This is her 12th loan with Kiva and she hopes that it will be an opportunity for her to bring her plans to fruition. With the credit she will invest in purchasing more product like bread, rice, sugar and more.

loans.use: purchase food items such as bread, rice and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nissondia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nissondia, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Klakouma, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la confection et vente de vannes.                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Nissondia sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des vannes.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
La cliente Yama Yacouba, 1 ère de la gauche vers la droite, compte acheter une grande bande de feuille de bambou pour confectionner  une centaine de vanne. Ces vannes seront vendues  en détail à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Nissondia Group is made up of married women who average 47 years of age and five children. They all live in extended traditional families in Klakouma, a village in Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, community, and friendship. They make and sell basketry, and are seeking their sixteenth solidarity loan (group loan) in order to buy raw materials.

Yama Yacouba (first woman on the left in the photograph) intends to buy a big length of bamboo leaves to make about one hundred baskets. She will then retail them to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80) to be used to provide for her family and, in part, reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo leaves to wave baskets

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz is 49 years old, married, and has three children. 

For 10 years he has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. Eyvaz’s income is 100 AZN monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and he is doing it together with his wife.

He is keeping a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from him. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

He has taken a loan from Aqroinvest before and has a good loan history. This is going to be his sixth loan. This time he requires 1,900 AZN in order to purchase 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in summer. He is optimistic about this loan, because in summer more people consume meat, due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to buy 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in summer.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a divorced woman blessed with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Esha cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites food leftovers as her challenge. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is divorced and has six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For the past ten years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and beans . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and beans.

loans.name: Kujtim

texts.en:
Kujtim is an Egyptian Albanian who lives in a little town located in the southeastern part of the country. 

“I have four children who I have to feed and educate; all of them are going to schools respectively. Majority of my community members got married at a very young age; it was like that before but it’s changing now. I got married as soon as I turned 20 and a year later I had the first child. Very rare you see guys to get married in their early 20’s nowadays and I think is good,” Kujtim said in his interview with the loan officer.
 
Kujtim is requesting a loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek for the fourth time to buy used items such as clothes and shoes to resell. His previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Mammadaga

texts.en:
Mammadaga is a 55-year-old married man. There are five people at his home and Mammadaga is the only person who takes care of his family's financial needs. His wife stays at home always being a housewife. 

Years ago, Mammadaga decided to open his own business, selling the basic grocery items needed in his neighborhood. Today, he is a person who enjoys his neighbors' and family's respect.

He has been in this business for 10 years. He sells food products in his shop, such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages. His wife helps him in this business. His monthly profit is 150 AZN. As this is the main source of income, his profit is used for family needs. The profit he earns is not enough to reinvest in his business in order to meet the customers' demands, so he is suffering in his business from lack of funds. 

Mammadaga would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital in the business. For this purpose, he applied for a 1,900 AZN loan. He will diversify  the food stock at his store. This will be his second loan, and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to expand his business by buying additional diverse food products.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and fees for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a paraffin selling business. In addition, she also sells dumplings to earn a living. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase 20 litres of paraffin for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 litres of paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Ekomefeemo 2 Group

texts.en:
“Ekomefeemo 2” is a trading group from Teshie-Accra. This is its fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and second with kiva. They are selling second-hand clothing, provisions, plates, cups, cooking utensils, rice, beans, groundnuts, fish, Kenkey, and plastic items. They need a total amount of GHS 10700 to be able to serve customers better.  

One of the members is Setina, who sells plates, cups, and plastic products. She has been able to make improvements in her life. All of this has been possible because she always offers good products and her customers like her. She also works to help cover her family expenses. She is married to Eric, and they have one child.

Setina is requesting a loan amount of GHS 500 so that she can invest in the purchase of plates, cups, and plastic product and sell them to her customers. This will help her to always provide them with a good variety.

loans.use: to purchase plates, cups, and plastic products.

loans.name: Durdana

texts.en:
Durdana is 53 years old, married and has three daughters. Durdana is a very caring mother. Her first goal is to give her children a good life. For that Durdana is working everyday without rest. 

She sells home-use products such as tape, calculators, bulbs, etc. Her profit in this business is 100 AZN monthly, but that is not enough to take care of her children and to buy goods for her store. She is also very worried about giving her daughters a good education, which will be a great contribution to the society.

Now Durdana needs a loan 2,000 AZN.  With this money she plans to bring more products to the store and increase her sales. She has already taken three loans from Aqroinvest in the past. Durdana is very optimistic about this business and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to bring more products to the store and increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase coffee trees for replanting the borrower's coffee plantation.

loans.name: Nafal

texts.en:
Nafal was born in 1976. She is married and lives in Zarqaa’, Jordan. She is a mother of three children and her husband works in PC repairing. 

Nafal has been working in trading clothes and housewares for five years. She is planning to trade other products in the future, such as mobile credit cards. As Eid is coming, Nafal is seeking to buy new clothes and to change her merchandise, so she is requesting a loan to be able to buy them.

loans.use: to buy new clothes in order to re-sell them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase industrial and household goods wholesale.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is 50 years old and a married man.  For the past 10 years, he has been raising cattle and sells their milk. Milk is a very popular drink among local people; they prepare different products from it, such as yogurt and cheese. They are in high demand because of their health benefits.

Islam is a retired person with an income of 120 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) from this business. His wife is helping him in running the business. Regardless of difficulties in raising cattle, Islam is a very positive man and is doing this business by heart. 

He has applied for a loan of 1,900 AZN from Aqroinvest in order to buy more calves. He has plans of expanding the business to meet the high potential for milk in the market. This is his sixth credit. He has a good loan history. Islam appreciates your support and interest in contributing to the poor peoples’ lives.

loans.use: to buy more calves.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina tiene 27 años, es madre soltera y viven su casa propia junta sus 2 hijos. Dina se dedica a vender productos comestibles como cereales, arroz, pan, entre otros. Tiene su tienda instalada en su casa, trabaja en esta actividad desde hace 4 años y desde que empezó siempre ha trabajado sola.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da independencia para hacer otras actividades. Espera hacer crecer aun más su negocio ya que se siente joven y espera poder seguir trabajando como lo hizo hasta ahora. Este es el tercer préstamo con Kiva, agradece a las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de contar con un capital de negocio, y promete ser responsable con sus pagos.
Con el préstamo de 1200 soles, ella comprará productos comestibles para tener en su tienda como verduras, huevos, leche y otros.
texts.en:
Dina is 27 years old, a single mother, and lives in her own home with her two children. She operates a grocery store in her home, from which she sells groceries such as cereal, rice, bread and others. She has had her grocery store for four years now – during which time she has always worked it by herself.

Dina likes her work because it gives her the independence to do other things. She hopes to grow her business even more, because she says she is young and she hopes to continue working like she has until now.

This is Dina’s third loan with Kiva. She says she is grateful to those who have provided her the opportunity to have working capital for her business, and she promises to be responsible with her payments. With this loan of 1200 PEN, she will buy groceries for her store, such as vegetables, eggs, milk and others.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as vegetables, eggs and milk to sell.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 56-year-old married man. He has been working as a carpenter for 20 years, as he started his business in Lebanon after he returned from Africa in 1992. 

Abbass applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy wood for a new project he's working on.

He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for seven loan cycles. His previous loans helped a lot in improving his business as well as his family's socio-economic situation.

He is a borrower in good standing with a good reputation among his customers. He works hard to provide his children with the best living standards they deserve to have. He hopes to keep on improving, expanding and updating his business with the machines and tools required to meet customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: to buy wood for a new carpentry project he's working on.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: José vive en casa propia con su esposa, tiene una discomóvil desde hace 20 años ameniza fiestas rosas, bodas, cumpleaños y todo tipo de eventos, tiene buena clientela por su buen trabajo y su responsabilidad con los clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, José esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar unos bafles grandes y un amplificador para seguir con su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jose lives in his own home with his wife. For the past 20 years they have operated a mobile music service.  They provide music at quinceañeras (a common birthday celebration in Latin America that celebrates a girl becoming a woman), weddings, birthdays, and all types of events. Due to their hard work and the responsible way in which they work, they have loyal customers. The income from the business is used to pay the household expenses. 

Jose is seeking a loan so that he can buy large speakers and an amplifier so that he can continue running his business, as it is his only source of income, and therefore he will have more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy large speakers and an amplifier.

loans.name: Anwbene  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe  ANWBENE I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kokougrou un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,   ROKIA  la première personne à gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice  de 100 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the ANWBENE I group are married women who are, on average, 39 years old with four children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kokougrou, one of the villages of the commune of Guégnaka, in the Cercle of Dioïla, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their farming activities at the beginning of the rainy season.  They grow groundnut, millet and beans and are on their seventh collaboration with the institution. 

Rokia (seated first from the left in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy farm inputs and small tools, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate about one hectare (2.47 acres) of land on which she grows groundnut and millet.

After the harvest, she sells her crops to both men and women, in the town of Fana.

She is hoping to make a profit of about 100,000 CFA francs per growing season.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, herbicide and small tools.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is 33 years old. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan, and is a father of three children. His project started two years ago; it is his only source of income and depends on the customers’ requests. 

Yousef would like to buy supplies for Ramadan like dates and desserts and a freezer, but he doesn’t have enough money to buy them. As a result, he is asking for a loan to be able to purchase them and expand his project. Yousef is also planning to buy a meat chopper in the future.

loans.use: To buy different supplies like dates and desserts and a new freezer.

loans.name: Anwbene V Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe ANWBENE V sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kokougrou un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Adiara  la première personne à gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice  de 90 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the ANWBENE V group are married women who are, on average, 39 years old with four children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in Kokougrou, one of the villages of the commune of Guégnaka, in the Cercle of Dioïla, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their farming activities at the beginning of the rainy season. They grow groundnut, millet and beans and are on their seventh collaboration with the institution.

Adiara (first from the left in the front row) plans to use her loan to buy farm inputs and small tools, and to cover the cost of plowing to maintain about one hectare (2.47 acres) of land on which she grows groundnut and millet.

After the harvest, she sells her crops in the town of Fana to a customer base which consists of both men and women.

She is hoping to make a profit of about 90,000 CFA francs per growing season.

loans.use: to cover the cost of plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, herbicide and small tools.

loans.name: Anwbene  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe  ANWBENE III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Kokougrou un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Sali la personne à droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice  de 90 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called ANWBENE III are married women with an average age of 39 and on average four children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Kokougrou, one of the villages of the township of Guégnaka,  prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities early in the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are peanuts, millet and beans. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. 

With this loan, Sali, the person on the right in the standing row, intends to buy farm inputs, small equipment, and pay costs for plowing etc. to maintain about one hectare of millet and peanuts. The produce is sold in the town of Fana, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of about 90,000 F CFA each growing season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro is a 35-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. A father of six young children, Isidro is engaged in fishing. He catches and sells fish for a living. 

In order to continue his fishing activities, Isidro has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, fuel, and a pump and to pay for boat maintenance. In the future, Isidro would like to expand his fishing business to pay for school fees and the rest of his profits will be used to do some home repairs.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, fuel, and a pump and to pay for boat maintenance

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur is a 37-year-old married man. He has been raising cattle the past five years. He says this is a very difficult job. Taking care of animals is a continuous effort, but his wife is helping him to raise the cattle, fatten them, and sell them in the market.

Seymur usually buys cattle, takes care of them by fattening them, and finally sells them in the market. His monthly income is 150 AZN. This financial income is the only source for family. He plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into family. Selling meat is a very profitable business in Azerbaijan due its common use in everyday meals.

Seymur is applying for a loan of 900 AZN in order to buy more calves. This is going to be his first loan in Aqroinvest. He believes this loan will have a positive impact in the expansion of his business.

loans.use: to buy more calves.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose operates a clothes selling business. She sells at the market to her town's residents and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge as the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons. 

With this loan, Rose wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she is grateful for the support.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mursal

texts.en:
Mursal is a 39-year-old married man. His wife stays at home and takes care of their kids. A few years ago, Mursal decided to open his own business selling the basic grocery items needed in his neighborhood. Today, he is a person who enjoys his neighbors' and his family's respect. He has been in this business for eight years. He sells food products in his shop, such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages. His wife helps him in this business. His monthly profit is 120 AZN. As this is the main source of income, his profit is used for family needs. 

The profit Mursal earns is not enough to reinvest in his business in order to meet his customers' demand, so he experiences lack of profits in the business, not realizing his full potential.  He would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital in the business. For this purpose, Mursal applied for a 2,000 AZN loan. He will buy and diversify foodstuffs to sell at his store. This will be his second loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Claudia Yanira

texts.es: Claudia de 30 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace 10 años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Claudia solícita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia, who is 30 years of age, lives in a rented house with her 2 children. She has sold tortillas in her home for some 10 years, working Monday to Sunday. She has a large customer base since she is a very hard-working and amiable person. With the money she earns, she manages to cover her household expenses.

Claudia is requesting a loan to buy corn by the hundredweight and, also, lime, so that she can continue making tortillas and obtain better earnings and offer her family more economic stability.

loans.use: buy corn by the hundredweight and, also, lime.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel, de 42 años de edad , esta casada con Miguel y junto a él tiene un pequeño hijo de 02 años, juntos viven en una parte del terreno de su hermano, donde a construido su casa. Raquel se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche, aceite, condimentos, frijoles, harina entre otros. Tiene un pequeño puesto que alquila en el mercado principal del distrito más concurrido de la ciudad. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 05 años Y desde que empezó ha trabajado siempre sola y ha aprendido a salir adelante.
Le gusta atender al público y lo hace con mucho esmero sobre todo porque sabe que del fruto de su trabajo colabora con los gastos de su hogar y de esta forma apoya a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Se siente muy tranquila por las ganancias que obtiene y espera más adelante tener un local más grande e implementar su negocio con mayor cantidad de productos. Este será su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, pan, harina, fideos, productos enlatados y otros.
texts.en:
Raquel is 42 years old and married to Miguel.  Together they have a two year old son.  They live on a part of her brother's land, where they have built their house.  

Raquel works selling food products such as rice, sugar, eggs, milk, oil, condiments, beans, flour, and other items.  She has a small stand that she rents in the main market in the busiest district in the city.  She has done this work for five years and since she started, she has worked alone and learned to get ahead.  She likes to serve the public and does so with great care because more than anything she knows that the fruit of her labor helps with the household expenses and thus helps her husband with the household expenses.  She feels very good about the income she earns and hopes later to have a larger store where she can sell a larger quantity of products.

This is her third loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she receives to continue forward.  She promises to make her repayments on time.  With the 1500 soles requested she will purchase food products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, bread, flour, pasta, canned goods, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as rice, sugar, milk, and others.

loans.name: Anwbene Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe ANWBENE IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kokougrou un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Kadiatou Brehima la deuxième personne à droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice  de 95 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called ANWBENE IV are married women with an average age of 39 and on average five children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Kokougrou, one of the villages of the township of Guégnaka,  prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro, second administrative region of Mali. 

They work together with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of better organizing their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are peanuts, millet, and beans. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. 

With this loan, Kadiatou Brehima, the second person on the right in the standing row, intends to buy farm inputs and small equipment and to pay for plowing, etc. to maintain about one hectare of millet and peanuts. 

The produce is sold in the town of Fana, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. Kadiatou Brehima hopes to make a profit of 95,000 F CFA more or less each season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en: Sameera was born in 1969. She is married and has three children. Her husband sells used furniture. Sameera used to work in trading furniture for one year and is planning to open her own clothing store. Now she is requesting a loan to be able to purchase new clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Konul

texts.en:
Konul is a 35-year-old widowed woman and she has a two kids. Konul’s mother is also living with her and her mother takes care of her grandchildren. Konul says that whatever she does is for a better future for her children and her first wish is to give a good education to her kids. For that she works the whole day. She rents a store near her home. Konul sells food products such as sweets, sugar, tea, gum, etc. From this business her profit is 120 AZN for a month. 

Now Konul needs a loan of 1,800 AZN to buy more products for her store. She has a good loan history and this is her third loan. She believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en:
Maleyka is a 55-year-old married woman but she doesn’t have kids. She sells home-use products such as tape, calculators, bulbs, etc. Her profit is 80 AZN from this business per month. As you can see from the photo, there are very few products in her store because she does not have enough funds to buy goods. Even though it’s a small business, she has a lot of customers. Considering the customers’ demand, Maleyka wants to expand her business. 

Maleyka has already borrowed five loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, she has applied for third loan of 2,000 AZN. With this money, she wants to invest in her business and buys more goods. She believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to invest in her business and buys more goods

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 38-year-old married father of three children. He has been working as a barber for twenty years. In 2012, Kassem took a big step forward and opened his present barber shop. This step increased his family's income and attracted new customers. Kassem works hard to provide his family with the necessities. 

Today, Kassem is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to make his house a healthy place to live by performing necessary maintenance, in addition to putting in tiles. He hopes to develop his shop more and open a facial section to please his customers.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to his house

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad is a 35-year-old married young man. For the past 10 years, he has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. Elshad’s income is 140 AZN monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and he is doing it together with his wife. Elshad keeps a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from him. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

Elshad is applying for a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer. He is optimistic about this loan, because in the summer more people consume meat due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to buy 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en:
Ismayil is 40 years old, married, and a father of two kids.  He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. Ismayil has been breeding cattle for the last 10 years. After several attempts to find a job, he gave up and decided to start his business. With the help of his wife, they purchased their first cattle.

Ismayil usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then sells them for a profit in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 140 AZN and this business is only one source of income for his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Ismayil also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.

Ismayil has already borrowed four loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for his fifth loan of 2,000 AZN to purchase two cattle and one milking cow. With this money, he wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy two cattle and one milking cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jenaro

texts.es:
Jenaro es un hombre de 50 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Es una persona muy emprendedora y alegre, se dedica al trabajo de la ganadería y agricultura ese ha sido su trabajo de siempre; aprendió el trabajo desde muy temprana edad ayudando a sus padres a trabajar,  nunca ha desempeñado otra actividad laboral. Camina aproximadamente 20 minutos de su casa hasta el lugar donde aborda el autobús, que se tarda 15 minutos en llegar a la ciudad donde compra los productos para sus actividades de la ganadería 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar productos (sal, harinas, desparasitantes , vitaminas  etc. ) para alimentar y mantener en buen estado su  ganado  y  para reparar y dar mantenimiento a los potreros  y otras actividades que san necesarias para el buen cuido de su ganado. 
Al adquirir el crédito, podrá darle el cuido y mantenimiento adecuado a sus potreros y a su ganado. 

El buen cuido de los terrenos y del ganado harán de que tenga mas producción de leche y mantener en buen estado su ganado y poder venderlo en mejores precios y obtener mayores ganancias

Sus planes para el futuro es que sus hijos tengan las posibilidades de poder trabajar en lo propio y con lo que les herede continúen trabajando y que trabajen  con mas ganado ya que sus terrenos son grandes para poder invertir y trabajar mucho mas .
texts.en: Jenaro, who is 50, has a partner and two children.  He is a very enterprising and cheerful man who works in cattle breeding and farming - the only work he has ever known.  He learned his trade from a very young age, by helping his parents, and has never done any other kind of work. He has a 20-minute walk from his home to the place where he catches the bus and after 15 minutes he gets to the city where he buys products for his cattle-breeding business.  The loan which he is seeking from Fundación Campo will be used to buy goods (such as salt, flour, anti-parasitic treatments, vitamins etc.) to feed his cattle and keep them in good condition, to repair and maintain his paddocks, and to carry out any other jobs related to the care of his cattle.  Once he has his loan, he will be able to attend to and maintain his paddocks and cattle properly.  If he takes care of his land and cattle well, he will be able to improve his milk production, keep his cattle in good condition and, by selling his animals at better prices, make higher profits.  His plans for the future are to enable his children to run their own business and to continue working with what he leaves to them.  Additionally, he would like them to increase the number of cattle because his land is extensive and ripe for investment and further work.

loans.use: to buy goods (such as salt, flour, anti-parasitic treatments, vitamins etc.) to feed his cattle and keep them in good condition, to repair and maintain the paddocks, and other activities needed for the care of his cattle.

loans.name: Ekow

texts.en:
Ekow is divorced and has three children. After successfully graduating junior high school, Ekow is now an established businessman. He sells computer accessories in Nkontrodo (near Cape Coast). He has been actively involved in this business for about five years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekow uses his income to provide for the entire family. 

Ekow will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of computer accessories, thus aiding him in improving his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, Ekow plans to diversify the type of products that he sells, hence adapting to changing customers' preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of computer accessories, thus aiding him in improving his overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs (cereals)  to sell retail.

loans.name: Emprendamos El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EMPRENDAMOS EL FUTURO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra.
