Andrea ella es viuda tiene 49 años y tiene 8 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende en su tienda productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia. 

La socia solicita él crédito para la compra de arroz y azúcar para su negocio.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, internet y negocio de restaurant.

La socia que sale en la  foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The Emprendamos El Futuro community bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.  

Andrea is a member of the group.  She is 49 years old, widowed, and has eight children.  She balances her daily activities with a grocery store business.  She has had the store for a long time and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in every day.  She sells staple products at her store such as rice, sugar, milk, and others.  She wants to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase rice and sugar for her business.

The other members of the group have businesses selling crafts, groceries, an internet cafe, and a restaurant.  The group member in the separate attached photo requested permission to come late since she was working.  

The group is grateful to everyone who is a part of making this dream come true and promises to make their payments according to the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children who are still under her care. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Saumu has operated a clothes-selling business, in which she sells at the market to her town-dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan of KES 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her purchase more kitchen products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of yam and cassava

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Angel de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 12 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, cuando sus cultivos ya están listos los almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Don Angel solicita un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y así el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Angel, who is 42, lives in his own home with his family group.  He has been growing corn for 12 years and this has given him the experience needed to tend his crops.  When his crops are ripe, he stores them in the barns shown in the photo until he goes to sell them at various nearby markets.  The profits he makes from his sales enable him to cover the household expenses.  Angel is applying for a loan to buy the supplies he needs (fertiliser, weed killer and manure, among other things) which will enable him to have good harvests and make higher profits so that he can provide better financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, weed killer, manure etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married, with four children. She has received some schooling, reaching the end of junior high school. 

Currently, Sarah sells groceries in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about four years now. Her husband is a carpenter. Sarah’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Sarah will use the loan to increase her existing grocery capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Sarah plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing grocery capacity.

loans.name: Seth

texts.en: Seth sells grinding stones in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). He has been educated through middle school.  He is married and has four children. His wife is currently employed as a farmer. Seth has been working in this enterprise for 20 years now. As the major provider in the family, he is responsible for paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. His loan will be used to increase his current stock levels for his grinding stone business. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to grow his masonry enterprise and increase his capital base. In the long run he wants to expand his business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase his current grinding stone stock

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana sells maize, gari, and yams in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). She was educated until the end of middle school.  She is married and has five children. Her husband is a tailor and farmer. Christiana has been working in this enterprise for a number of years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her foodstuff enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is a 22 year old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has three young children. She grows rice. Together with her husband, she works hard to toil the land to earn a living. Janeth applied for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, in order to improve her yield and obtain a better harvest. In the future, Janeth would like to expand her farming business, in order to support her growing children, and also to save to acquire a new motorcycle to earn additional income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente reside en la ciudad de Machala.  Por motivos del destino sufrió un accidente de tránsito que lo obligó a retirarse de su trabajo y en la cual perdió su brazo izquierdo.  Posteriormente, utilizó el dinero de su liquidación para invertir en el negocio que había decidido empezar (tienda).  El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en mercadería para su tienda (reses y productos de consumo masivo).  Es casado, su esposa lo ayuda en la economía con su negocio de venta de cosméticos y útiles escolares.  No tienen hijos.
texts.en:
The client lives in the city of Machala.  As destiny would have it, he suffered from a car accident.  This forced him to retire from his work.  In the accident he lost his left arm.  He later used the money from his settlement to invest in the business that he had decided to start (store).

He will use the requested loan to buy merchandise for his store (beef and products of mass consumption).

He is married, and his wife helps him with the finances with her business of selling cosmetics and school supplies.  They do not have children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en: Mourine is married and rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She cites food as her major challenge. She operates a fruit and vegetable business, selling at retail to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge because of the bulkiness of goods, and hence the high cost of transportation. With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to buy two bags of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy two bags of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Abeer was born in 1976. She is married and has four children. Her husband works at the airport in the maintenance department. Abeer has been working in make-up for 10 years. She took a course in makeup art at Al-Hbool Foundation and a hairdressing course at Tayseer Sulaiman Company, for make-up. She also attended the Amman Summer showroom for makeup five years ago. Abeer is planning to expand her project by buying new furniture in the future. Now she is applying for a loan to be able to buy new cosmetics and to change the decor of the salon.

loans.use: to buy new cosmetics and change the decor of her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of cooking utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Bachir

texts.en: Bachir is a 48-year-old married father of one child. He has been working in the aluminum business for twelve years. At the beginning, he had financial problems, since he couldn't buy anything he needed for his business immediately. Today, his business is going just fine, but he needs extra external financial support to expand it. That's why he entered a second cycle loan with Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a large quantity of glass at good prices to improve his business. This loan will surely decrease part of his indirect business expenses, because he won't limit his work to specialized glass work, and the earnings for his services will increase. In this way, he will have merchandise available to work with. He hopes to expand his work and to move to a larger place soon.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of glass at very good prices to improve his business.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena is a small-scale maize porridge seller in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). She has had some formal education as a junior high school graduate. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a tailor. Mena has been working as a maize porridge vendor for close to four years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase more maize, allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, fish, and plantain

loans.name: Kwesi

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Kwesi is an entrepreneur. He specializes as a taxi driver in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 13 years. 

He is married and has 5 children. His wife works as a petty trader. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. 

Kwesi wants to use his loan to purchase spare parts, tools and gas. In the long term, Kwesi plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, tools and gas.

loans.name: Manuel Jesús

texts.es: El cliente vive en la ciudadela Rayito de Luz, de Machala.  Realiza su actividad en las ferias de la ciudad donde vende especias y productos de consumo.  Labora solo, todos los días.  Necesita utilizar el crédito para la compra de mercadería de su negocio.  Es soltero pero tiene un hijo que asiste a una escuela fiscal.
texts.en:
The client lives in the Rayito de Luz neighborhood in Machala.  He works at the fairs in the city where he sells spices and products for consumption.  He works alone every day.

He needs to use the loan to buy merchandise for his business.  He is single.  However, he has one child who goes to a public school.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is a 29-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is the mother of three children, ages 11, 10 and 7. She engages in raising hogs as a business. She has been raising pigs for almost six years. Aside from hog raising, She also grows rice, to obtain additional income. Juana applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy pig feed and the materials needed to build a pig pen. In the future, Juana would like to expand her both business to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and materials to build a pig pen.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 37-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has four children ranging in age from 6 to 12. She engages in a fish-vending business to earn a living. Judith requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy a weighing scale and an ice box. In the future, Judith would like to invest in other business venture to provide her family with good food and quality education.

loans.use: to buy a weighing scale and an ice box

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija operates a food stall, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to buy rice, sugar, wheat flour and cooking oil for food preparation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, wheat flour and cooking oil for food preparation.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en: Haifa is 40 years old. She lives in Amman with her husband and four children. Her husband works selling glass. Haifa started selling clothes and children’s blankets three years ago. As she has her neighbors as competitors, she is thinking of adding new products, such as housewares, in the future. Now she is asking for a loan to buy new clothes and blankets to trade.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and blankets for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her livestock in order to raise her profit.

loans.name: Sahliyali

texts.en:
Sahliyali is 48 years old, married, and the father of five children. His wife is retired. He has been raising cattle for the past 16 years. Taking care of animals requires continuous effort, but his wife helps him to raise the cattle, and he also sells cheese, yogurt, butter and milk at the market. This is the only source of income for the family. He plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into the family. 

Sahliyali’s children want to live in a house which is in good condition, but his income from agriculture is not enough to keep it in good repair. He must repair the roof of his house. He is asking for a loan of 900 AZN to buy slate for the roof to prevent dampness in the house during rainy weather. In this way, he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy slate for the roof to prevent dampness in the house during rainy weather.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is 21 years old. She lives in Irbid with her family which consists of 8 members. She is studying in her 4th year of college for a bachelor degree in listening and speech. Her aim is to work after graduation in something related to her study field. Anwar is facing a financial crisis which is causing her to request a loan to be able to pay her study fees.

loans.use: to pay her study fees.

loans.name: Anwbene  Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe ANWBENE VI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kokougrou un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Mamine la première personne à gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 45 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the Anwbene VI group are married women who average 39 years of age and have on average four children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Kokougrou, one of the villages in the Guégnaka municipality, which lies in the prefecture of Dioïla in the Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region).

The are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of being able to organize their businesses better at the beginning of the winter season. They grow groundnut, millet and beans and are on their seventh loan from the institution.

With this loan, Mamine, who is standing on the far left of the photo, is planning to buy fertilizers and small materials as well as to pay labor costs to maintain around one hectare of millet and groundnut.

Once harvested, the produce is sold in the town of Fana to a customer base made up of men and women. Mamine is expecting to make a profit of around 45,000FCFA per season.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizers, weed-killer, hoeing and small materials.

loans.name: Rawad

texts.en:
Rawad is a 32-year-old married man employed in a vehicle-repairing garage that specializes in body work. He has been doing this work for 12 years. His wife doesn't work and she is expecting their first baby soon. That is an additional expense he has to face and make to sure that he has the ability to provide his small family with the best possible healthy living conditions. 
His low salary isn't enough for him to save money for emergency needs. That's why he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to pay his wife's hospital costs and the expected baby needs.
He hopes one day he can afford to open his own vehicle-repairing garage and improve his socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's hospital expenses

loans.name: Nana Yaa

texts.en:
After graduating from junior high school, Nana Yaa decided to set up her own banku-selling business (banku is a traditional Ghanaian dish, made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish, consistent paste). She prepares her banku on her own and proceeds to sell it in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). 

With over four years' worth of experience, Nana Yaa is currently looking to further expand her enterprise. Unfortunately, she is limited, due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more maize and cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty banku. 

She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband, who is a farmer, with the upkeep of their house, while ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and cassava.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en: Leonisa, a 48-year-old  married mother of six from Getafe, Bohol, runs a sari-sari store that sells goods including sugar, noodles, shampoo, canned goods and food supplements. Leonisa has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more such items to sell. In the future, she would like to expand in order to promote her food supplement business and to gain more profit to provide her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy  more items to sell such as food supplements, sugar, beverages and soft drinks

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is married to a farmer and has nine children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day.

As a middle school graduate, Mina currently sells maize and gari in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). With over 2 years of experience in this trade, Mina sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus, her loan will be used to buy more maize and gari, indirectly helping her to boost her overall sales.

Mina wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her foodstuff enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more maize and gari.

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en:
After graduating junior high school, Kwadwo decided to set up his own coconut business in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). With over 10 years of experience, he is currently looking to expand his enterprise further. Unfortunately, he is limited due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help him purchase more coconuts for resale. He aims at using the profits from his business to help support his wife (who is a petty trader) with the upkeep of their house, while also ensuring that their 8 children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help him purchase more coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa’ is a conservative woman, so she let her husband take her place in the picture. She is 24 years old. She lives in Amman with her husband and two children. Her husband began working as a blacksmith five years ago. Then he bought the needed tools to have his own workshop at his house. Alaa’s husband is planning to open his own separate workshop in the future. As he is experiencing a lack of raw materials, Alaa is asking for a youth loan to buy new materials for his business.

loans.use: to buy new raw materials for her husband's business.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai is 22 years old. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan, with his family which consists of 6 members. He is currently studying for a bachelor degree in social sciences. He is in his 2nd year and doesn’t work. He is planning to enhance his study level and get a masters degree.  

Because he is facing financial problems now, he is asking for a loan to be able to cover his study fees.

loans.use: to cover his study fees.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is single and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a rental house business and a baby care business for her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase cement for renovating her rental houses. She joined Yehu to acquire loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement for renovating her houses.

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Even though Mena grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Mena is an entrepreneur. She sells clothing in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 3 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 6 children. 

Mena has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more clothing to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mena wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Umarali

texts.ru: Умарали женатый молодой человек в возрасте 27 лет. У него жена и двое маленьких детей, вместе с которыми он проживает в городе Куляб. Умарали не имеет высшего образования. После окончания школы, в возрасте 19 лет он начал работать водителем. Сейчас он предоставляет услуги такси по маршрутной линии городов Куляб-Душанбе. В среднем за день он делает один рейс и получает хорошую прибыль. Недавно Умарали взял машину марки Opel и заплатил только одну часть денег. В данный момент ему необходимо заплатить за машину еще 3000 долларов США. С этим намерением Умарали обратился за кредитом. Он обещает выплачивать кредит в срок за счет прибыли с деятельности. Умарали очень нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Umarali is a young, married, 27 year-old man.  He has a wife and two small children, together with whom he lives in the city of Kulob.  Umarali does not have a higher education.  He started working as a driver right after finishing school, at the age of 19 years old.  Currently, he provides a taxi service along the Kulob-Dushanbe route.  On average, he makes one route per day and earns a good profit.  Recently, Umarali got an Opel car and paid only a partial amount for it.  Now, he needs to pay an additional 3000 US dollars for the car.  Umarali requested this loan for this purpose.  He promises to repay the loan with the profit from his business.  Umarali really needs your support.

loans.use: to repay the remainder of the purchase price for his car that he uses for his business

loans.name: Teresa Del Rosario

texts.es: Teresa se dedica a la agricultura principalmente a  la siembra de maíz, se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante 3 años y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy conocida en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla por las diferentes agencias de granos básicos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar vive en casa de un familiar con sus dos hijos. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse, Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que ella consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa works as a farmer, mainly planting corn.  She has done this work for three years and it is how she earns her daily bread.  She is a hardworking and responsible woman who is well known in her area for her huge heart and kindness to others.  When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the granaries shown in the photograph.  Later, she takes it for sale at different basic grains agencies.  With the income she earns, she meets some of her household expenses.  She lives in a relative's home with her two children.

Since it is planting season, she has decided to start to prepare herself.  This is why she is requesting a new loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide.  She hopes that her harvest is abundant and better than the previous ones, since this is the way she supports her family.  She trusts God that with his help, her dedication, and her effort in her work, she will achieve her dream of improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: Bukari

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Bukari is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling maize in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years. Bukari is married and has 3 children. His wife works as a seamstress. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. 

Bukari will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus helping him to improve his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to further diversify the type of products that he sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize.

loans.name: Natig

texts.en:
Natig is 45 years old. 11 years ago, he decided to open a business so that he could support his family, which is comprised of his wife and three children, ages 3, 9 & 11. He works together with his two assistants in a small cafeteria, which he built through hard work and sacrifice. His business is well known due to its strategic location and good service.

Natig's biggest dream is to expand his business so that he can service more customers. Therefore, he has applied for a loan to remodel and buy inventory. He hopes to send his children to college.

loans.use: To remodel and buy new inventory for his cafe.

loans.name: Katty Del Rocío

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Machala, empezó su negocio años atrás con la ayuda de sus familiares.  Ellos tenían un local en el centro de la ciudad, en donde ella laboraba y luego de esto, empezó también a comercializar sus productos en el barrio donde vivía.  Básicamente compra ropa en Guayaquil y Huaquillas para venderla a sus clientes.  El motivo de su préstamo es para invertirlo en mercadería para su local (ropa,útiles de oficina y otros).  Es casada y tiene 2 hijos que actualmente estudian en una escuela fiscal.
texts.en: The client lives in the city of Machala.  She started her business years ago with help from some relatives.  They have a place in the center of the city where she used to work.  Later, she also started to sell products in the neighborhood where she lived.  Basically, she buys clothes in Guayaquil and Huaquillas to sell to her customers.  This loan is to invest in merchandise for her place (clothes, office supplies, and others).  She is married and has two children who currently attend a public school.

loans.use: to buy clothes and variety type items.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 21 years old. He lives in Mafraq, Jordan, with his family which consists of 8 members. He is currently studying in his 1st year to get a diploma in space engineering. As he is facing a financial crisis, Mohammad needs a loan to cover his study fees.

loans.use: to cover his study fees.

loans.name: Patience's Group

texts.en:
The "Patience" group is in its fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana; all members put forth their best efforts to grow their respective businesses. They also do activities together to continue growing and helping their families. They sell children's wear, second-hand clothing, bags, bed sheets and electrical parts.

Patience sells second-hand clothing; she says that her day starts very early, given that she has to deliver her product to her customers due to competition. Married with two children, her dream is to own a second-hand clothing depot. She is requesting a loan of GHS 400 to purchase a bale of second-hand clothing to improve her stock and so continue supplying her customers.

The group's total loan request is GHS 2800 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Maame Efua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Maame Efua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur.

Currently, Maame Efua sells maize, gari and tomatoes in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 20 years. As a widow with 5 children, Maame Efua uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. Maame Efua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, gari and tomatoes, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Maame Efua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, gari and tomatoes.

loans.name: Delaa

texts.en: Delaa was born in 1976. She is married and has 6 children. Delaa has been trading livestock for 3 years. During this period, she has found the increase in the livestock food prices to be a problem. Now Delaa is requesting a loan to raise her number of livestock and to buy them food in order to raise her income.

loans.use: to raise her number of livestock and to buy them food.

loans.name: Nana Ekua

texts.en:
Nana Ekua is a widow and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Nana Ekua is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She normally sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Nkontrodo (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 40 years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Nana Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. Nana  Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize

loans.name: Deeb

texts.en:
Deeb is a 48-year-old, married father of two. For 30 years, he has been working as a car mechanic. He is well-known in his region, with a good reputation and a special talent in his domain. Deeb's wife doesn't work and his two children are enrolled in a public school because he can't afford to register them in a private school, due to his low-income business.

Deeb is applying for his second loan cycle from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to increase his business merchandise with new and used spare parts, that will increase his income and develop his business.

He hopes to move to a wider garage in the future and to start selling spare parts, too.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with new and used spare parts.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima was born in 1976. She is married and is the mother of 3 daughters. Her husband is a government employee. Fatima has been working by sewing at home for 7 years. She attended a bazaar through schools and associations. She also took sewing courses at a women's union association. She is planning to raise her profits in the future. Now she is asking for a loan to buy new sewing tools and machines.

loans.use: to buy new sewing tools and machines.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has one child who attends school and is under her care. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For over 20 years, she has operated a clothing sales business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Mwanamisi wants to purchase 2 bales of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Rubenia

texts.es: Rubenia de 50 años de edad, habita con su esposo,  sus dos  hijos y su nieto en casa propia. Rubenia  es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en su hogar de residencia. El negocio consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para ella lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad, razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y a demás porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. Ella  sueña con dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y sabe que la única fuente de ingresos es su pequeño negocio, por tanto no puede descuidarse de el, por lo que cada día trabaja duramente para por mantenerlo activo. Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de más productos atractivos para los clientes. Confía que de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño  de darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rubenia, 50 years old, lives with her husband, her two children, and her grandchild in her own home. Rubenia is an entrepreneurial and determined woman. 

Some years ago, she decided to open a small business in her residence. The business consists of a small store that, with great effort and dedication, she has managed to maintain throughout many years. She can count on many customers because to her, the customer is the most important. She always attends to them with a smile and a lot of friendliness, which is the reason that she has gained the confidence of many from that zone, and furthermore because she always has what her customers are looking for.

She dreams of giving her family a better quality of life, and knows that the only source of income is her small business. Therefore, she cannot neglect it, which is why every day she works hard to keep it open. It is for this reason that she motivated herself to request this loan from INTEGRAL to be able to invest in her small store and stock it with all types of products, such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candy, oil, paper, detergent, and other products that are attractive to her customers. She is confident that in this way she will manage to achieve her dram of giving a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candy, oil, paper, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman was born in 1965. She is divorced and lives in Amman-Jordan. Eman has been working in sewing for 15 years. The small space she had was a problem for her while doing her work. She is planning to improve her project by buying a new embroidery machine in the future. Now she is asking for a loan to buy special fabrics and design them for summer.

loans.use: to buy special fabrics and design them for summer.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy was born in 1985. She is single and lives with her 2 siblings in Amman-Jordan.

Nancy has been working in sales of clothing, perfumes, accessories and blankets for 9 months which has been profitable work for her. She is planning to open her own store in the future. She is requesting a youth loan to buy new merchandise like clothes, perfumes and accessories in order to sell them and raise her income.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise like clothes, perfumes and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su madre, ella se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de arreglos con flores artificiales para todo tipo de ocasión, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esa actividad que le ha generado buenas ganancias también se dedica  a la agricultura siembra maíz, tiene buena clientela porque vende a buen precio sus productos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Adelina esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales para seguir elaborando los arreglos como: alambre, pegamento, listones de colores, flores artificiales por mayor, etc. para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adelina lives in her own home with her three children and her mother. She makes a living creating and selling artificial flower arrangements for all types of occasions. For many years, she has dedicated herself to this activity, which has generated a good profit. She also makes a living sowing corn. She has good customers because she sells her products at a good price. With the profits that she obtains manages to pay some of her home expenses. 

Adelina is requesting a loan to buy materials to continue producing the arrangements, such as: wire, adhesive, ribbons in different colors, artificial flowers wholesale, etc., to make a better profit and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wire, adhesive, ribbons in different colors, artificial flowers wholesale, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 33-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children: the oldest is seven while the youngest is three months old.

She engages in buying and selling dried fish. She buys at the same time as she sells dried fish. She has been in this business for almost one year. Josephine requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more fresh fish and one sack of salt.

In the future, Josephine would like to expand business to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish and 1 sack of salt.

loans.name: Philister

texts.en: Philister works hard to meet the needs of her family. She runs a food stall selling  food to neighbours and passersby. She is requesting a loan of Kes 35,000 to buy wheat flour, rice, and cooking fat for sale.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, rice, and cooking fat for sale.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu operates a food vending business, selling in the market to market-dwellers and passersby. She cites seasonality and high rate of perishability as her major challenges. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase cooking oil, rice, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 26-year-old Syrian married father of one child, living and working in Lebanon.

He has worked as a driver for seven years. Omar's family's needs are increasing and he has to make sure that he can support them and cover everything they request. That's why he is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to open a clothes-selling shop instead of his small mobile clothes selling one.

Through this business, Omar believes that he can develop his family's socioeconomic situation in a well managed way. He hopes to expand this business and branch out all over the region.

loans.use: To open his  own clothes-selling shop

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Luis tiene 42 años,  el se dedica al comercio de variedad de carne en su carnicería que se encuentran en la zona de 9 de Abril,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Luis va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un frizer grande para conservar sus productos en buen estado su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que requiere la congeladora para la venta de carne, el Sr. Luis  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay varias carnicerías en la zona, pero él tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad con la que trata a su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de otra congeladora grande, su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is 42 years old. He makes a living through the sale of a variety of meat in his butcher shop, which is in the 9 de Abril zone. This loan is his first sequence with the institution. Luis is going to use this loan to buy a large freezer to preserve his products in a good state. 

His reason for requesting this loan is that he requires the freezer for meat sales. Luis is facing challenges in his business, such as competition, since there are various butcher shops in the zone, but he has many customers because of the kindness with which he treats his customers. 

He is going to use the profits to buy another large freezer. His wish for his business is to have a stable and profitable business, and in this way increase his economic income and therefore be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a freezer to maintain meat.

loans.name: Obidjon

texts.ru: Обидджон трудолюбивый человек. Ему 27 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Обидджон имеет высшее образование и работает преподавателем в сельской школе. Он преподает математику и информатику. Обидджон умный и интеллигентный человек и поэтому коллектив школы, где он преподаёт, очень уважают его. Обидджон получает маленькую зарплату и едва справляется с семейными расходами. Обидджон является основным кормильцем семьи, так как его жена домохозяйка, а ее мать серьёзна больна. Его мать должна лечиться, но Обидджон не имеет денег для ее лечения. Обидджон запрашивает займ на сумму 3600 сомони для лечения матери. Этот займ даст надежду для дальнейшей здоровой жизни. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Obidjon is a hardworking person.  He is 27 years old, married and raising one child.  Obidjon has a higher education and works as a teacher at a village school.  He teaches mathematics and informatics.  Obidjon is a smart and intelligent person, and this is why his colleagues at the school, where he teaches, respect him very much.  Obidjon receives a small salary and can barely handle the family expenses.  Obidjon is the primary provider for his family because his wife is a homemaker, and his mother is seriously ill.  His mother has to get treatment, but Obidjon does not have money for it.  Obidjon is requesting a loan in the amount of 3600 somoni to treat his mother.  This loan will provide hope for a future, healthy life.  He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for the treatment of his ill mother

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Sitting on the sidewalk and waiting for costumers to buy her products is not easy. Maribel is doing all that she can to reach her dreams. Her greatest dream is to provide a comfortable way of living for her family. She wants her children to reach the college level of education, finish it and became professionals someday.

Maribel is engaged in cooking glutinous cake that she covers in banana leaves and sells in the market. Maribel is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy glutinous rice and some ingredients to make more glutinous cake to sell. She hopes to expand her business soon to be able to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy glutinous rice and some ingredients to make more glutinous cake to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more doughnuts and fruit to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a small-scale fish seller in Nkontrodo (near Cape Coast). She has had some formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Sarah has been working as a fish seller for close to 14 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of fish, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a fish stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fish

loans.name: Zahria

texts.en:
Zahria is 39 years old, married, and a mother of four children. She operates a cafe in Malindi town. She has been in business for the past three years. She earns a monthly profit of 7,250 KES.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and now she is applying for her fourth loan, this time for 40,000 KES. Zahria intends to use the loan to add foodstuffs like flour, cooking oil, and cereals, and re-usable items like eating plates, tea cups and spoons, for use at her business. She will save the anticipated profit, to pay school fees for her children and to continue expanding the cafe. In the future, Zahria hopes to grow her cafe, with a view toward owning a well-set-up hotel in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional foodstuffs and eating utensils for use at her cafe

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a 51-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells items like coffee, shampoo, sugar and canned goods. Aside from operating a sari-sari store business, he also engages in carpentry.

Eduardo requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise to sell and tools, like a hammer. In the future, Eduardo would like to expand his business to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell and tools, like a hammer.

loans.name: Muinde

texts.en:
Muinde is 49 years old and the father of 4 children, of whom all are currently studying in school. For the past 30 years, Muinde has earned a living by selling goods and services from his general store in Malindi, where he earns a monthly profit of 28,960 KES.

Muinde was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and he is applying for his second loan of 60,000 KES to purchase additional stock needed for his business. He will use the profits from the business to pay for school fees, purchase food for the family and expand the current business. Muinde hopes to own his own supermarket in the future so as to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for his business.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is married and has five school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent, and school fees.

For the past 12 years, Mwanalima has operated a food-vending business, selling at the market to market-dwellers and passersby. She cites seasonality and the high rate of perishability to be her major challenges. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the KES 45,000 loan, Mwanalima wants to purchase cooking oil, rice, beans, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, rice, beans, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es: Don Federico  es originario de Estelí, tiene  49 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura hace mucho tiempo, tiene a cargo a su esposa quien le ha brindado apoyo para  iniciar un negocio de pulpería con fondos propios, tiene como ingreso principal la actividad agrícola y la pulpería. Solicita este crédito para comprar productos tales como: granos básicos, arroz, azúcar, frijol, aceite, golosinas, pasta dental etc. Con el fin de  brindar mayor variedad a sus clientes, esto le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos lo cual será de mucho beneficio para su negocio. Su meta es  hacer crecer su negocio, ofreciéndole una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Según las referencias de la comunidad es un hombre ejemplar.
texts.en: Don Federico is from Estelí and is 49 years old. He has worked in agriculture for a very long time. He is responsible for his wife, who has given him support to start a grocery business with their own funds. For principal income, he has agriculture and the grocery store. He is asking for this loan to buy products like basic grains, rice, sugar, beans, oil, sweets, toothpaste, etc. With the goal of providing greater variety to his customers, this will allow him to get a better income, which will be very beneficial to his business. His goal is to make his business grow, giving his family a better quality of life. According to references from the community, he is an exemplary man.

loans.use: to buy products like basic grains, rice, sugar, beans, oil, sweets, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Rajaa’

texts.en: Rajaa’ was born in 1965. She is married and lives in Wehdat, Jordan. Her husband works as a furniture painter. Rajaa’ has been working at selling clothes, accessories and shoes for three years. Her aim in this project is to raise her income. Now she is asking for a loan to buy clothes from Aqaba and sell them in Amman during Ramadan and Eid.

loans.use: to buy clothes from Aqaba and sell them in Amman during Ramadan and Eid.

loans.name: Mwanabibi

texts.en:
Mwanabibi is 43 years old, married and a mother of five children. She operates a butchery in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last seventeen years. She earns a monthly profit of 9,100 KES. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of 30,000 KES. 

Mwanabibi intends to use the loan to add stock for her business. She will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for her children as well as continue expanding her business. In future, Mwanabibi hopes to grow her butchery with an aim of improving her financial stability.

loans.use: To add stock of meat to her butcher shop

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a food vending business for the past one year, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and she dreams of expanding to a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cooking  oil, wheat flour, maize flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking  oil, wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 25 years old. For the past four years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of KES 7,150. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his first loan in the amount of KES 15,000. 

Martin is going to use a portion of the loan to service and repair his motorbike and use the remaining amount to put up a fruit and vegetable kiosk for his sister to run. He will use the profits to invest back into his business. His goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses, so that he can improve his financial stability.

loans.use: To repair and service his motorcycle

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees. 

She has operated a food vending business for the past two years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and she dreams of expanding to a cafe in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, maize flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, cooking oil, wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Tolobek

texts.ru: Толобеку 49 лет. Женат, имеет 3 взрослых детей (2 дочери и 1 сын). Толобек вместе со своей семьей ведут собственное хозяйство с 1993 года. Первоначально была куплена 1 корова. А на сегодняшний день у него имеется в хозяйстве 2 дойные коровы и 1 лошадь. Супруга Толобека активно помогает вести хозяйство. Благодаря упорному труду и терпению Толобека, ежемесячная прибыль его семьи составляет 10 000 сом (KGS).Старшая дочь работает и материально помогает своей семье. Младшие дети также помогают по хозяйству. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства Толобек обратился в Микрофинансовый банк "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в сумме 75 000 сом (KGS). За кредитом обратились вместе с группой, состоящей из 3 человек (1 мужчина и 2 женщины). Группа называется "Ленин". Доходы от кредита Толобек планирует и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота в своем хозяйстве. В будущем Толобек хочет улучшить благосостояние своей семьи.
texts.en: Tolobek is 49 years old, married and has three grown children (two daughters and one son).  Tolobek and his family have been running their own business since 1993.  A cow was purchased first.  Today, he has two dairy cows and one horse on his farm.  Tolobek's wife acitvely helps to run the business.  Thanks to Tolobek's hard work and patience, his family's monthly profit amounts to 10,000 som (KGS).  His oldest daughter works and helps the family financially.  The younger children help with the household.  In order to further develop his business, Tolobek requested a loan in the amount of 75,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners."  He requested this loan together with a group, consisting of three people (one man and two women).  The group is called "Lenin."  Tolobek plans to use the earnings from the loan to further increase livestock headcount on his farm.  In the future, he wants to improve his family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Félix Antonio

texts.es:
Félix cuenta con 43 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos, de 22, 19 y 17 años respectivamente. Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de plátano ya tiene tres años de estar sembrando esa planta. Antes de cultivar plátano cultivaba solo maíz y maicillo algo que últimamente no dejaba ninguna ganancia. Estas actividades las aprendió de sus padres.  Don Félix compra los productos en la ciudad a unos 12 kilómetros de la comunidad lo cual le toca buscar un vehículo privado para que le realice el viaje a comprar sus productos ya que le queda lejos y en calles balatradas pero lo hace así porque no existen otras oportunidades de trabajo.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 15 sacos de abono para fertilizar sus 14,000 metros cuadrados de plátano; a demás pagara la preparación de la tierra hasta tenerla de punto de siembra.  Con el préstamo estará satisfaciendo la necesidad de comprar sus insumos y estar seguro que le dará el cuido necesario a su s cultivos su fertilización y por ende sacar más producto logrando así mejores ingresos y así poder comprar lo que a sus hijos les hace falta.
texts.en:
Félix is 43-years old.  He is married and has three children who are 22, 19 and 17-years old respectively.  Don Félix makes his living in agriculture.  He grows bananas and has been doing so for the last three years.  Before growing bananas, he grew corn and sorghum, which lately hadn't been providing him with any profit.  He learned these activities from his parents.  Don Félix purchases his supplies in a city about 2 kilometers from his community.  This means he has to hire a private vehicle to make his purchases.  The city is far and the roads are dirt, but he does it because there aren't any other work opportunities. 
The loan that don Félix is requesting from Fundación Campo is for the purchase of 15 sacks of compost to fertilize his 14,000 square meters of banana plants.  In addition, he will pay for getting his land prepared for planting.  With the loan, he will be able to purchase the supplies he needs and be sure he can give his plants the care they need, including the fertilizer.  Consequently he will get more produce from his plants, earn a better income and thereby be able to buy the things his children are lacking.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sacks of compost to fertilize his 14,000 square meters of banana plants; in addition, he will pay for getting his land prepared for planting.

loans.name: Adiya

texts.ru: Адия, 57 лет, замужем, имеет взрослых детей. Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Разведением скота начала заниматься более 10 лет назад. На сегодняшний день благодаря ее упорству и целеустремленности развела небольшое хозяйство, дополнительно занимается полеводством. Адия хочет и дальше приумножить поголовье скота и заниматься полеводством, в связи с этим обратилась в  Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 40000 сом (KGS)  на покупку коровы. Адия входит в состав группы "Ленин", в которой участвуют еще 2 человека кроме нее. На доходы от кредита Адия хочет улучшить благосостояние своей семьи, а также в будущем хочет дать хорошее образование младшему сыну.
texts.en: Adiya is 57 years old, married and has grown children.  Her husband and children help with the business.  She got involved in breeding livestock over 10 years ago.  Today, thanks to her persistence and drive, she developed a small farm and is additionally involved in farming.  Adiya wants to continue increasing livestock headcount and be involved in farming, and for this, requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a cow.  Adiya is part of the "Lenin" group, consisting of two more people besides her.  Adiya wants to use the earnings from the loan to to improve her family's welfare and provide a good education for her youngest son in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is married and has five children.  They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she sells firewood, by which she earns her other source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish, in the near future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase two sacks of dried fish and one tonne of firewood.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of dried fish and one tonne of firewood, to resell.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 50 years old, is married, and has seven children. She and her husband have been farming seaweed for 15 years now. They farm in the town of Talibon, Bohol. 

Felicidad is asking for a loan of 23,000 PHP to buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope. The income she will generate will provide her family with food and help pay the basic household bills. In the future, she hopes to be more successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings and plastic rope

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende, in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is single and has two children. For the past ten years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, milk, and bread. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items to sell in the store, such as milk, soup, and bread. This will help Agnes to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Agnes hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Agnes, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, such as milk, soup, and bread.

loans.name: Sabougnouma  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMA I sont constitués par des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Manakoro  un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont  l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Djeneba  la première personne à gauche dans le rang des débout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère  réaliser  un bénéfice de 100 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called  SABOUGNOUMA I are made up of married women with an average age of 41 and on average six children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Manakoro, one of the villages of the community called Guégnaka,  prefecture of Dioîla, region of Koulikoro, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of being better able to organize their activities at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown are peanuts, millet, and beans. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. 

With this loan, Djeneba, the first person on the left, standing,  intends to buy farm inputs, small equipment, and pay for plowing etc. to maintain about one hectare of millet and peanuts. 

Her produce is sold in the town of Fana, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She hopes to make a profit of 100,000 F CFA per growing season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, frijol y maicillo, se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante varios años es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su amabilidad para con los demás, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija.  Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The client makes his living in agriculture planting corn, beans, and sorghum. He has been doing this for several years. He is a man who is hardworking, responsible, and well known in the area because of his kindness to others. He lives in his own house with his life partner and their daughter. 
Since it is now planting season, he has decided to start preparing. So he has decided to request this new loan from INTEGRAL to buy seeds, insecticide, fertilizer, etc. What he wants most is for his harvest to be abundant and better than previous ones, since this is the way that he supports his family. He trusts in God that with your help, and his dedication and effort in his work, he will fulfill his dream of a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia Ernestina se sigue dedicando al negocio de agencia de viajes,ella vende boletos turisticos a diferentes personas del extranjero que quieren viajar a machupicchu,valle sagrado de los inkas y a diferentes lugares,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia esta feliz con su negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de agencia de viajes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar boletos turisticos.


La socia esta feliz con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Ernestina still has her travel agency and sells tour tickets to foreign visitors who wish to travel to Machu Picchu, the sacred valley of the Incas, and other destinations. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. She is pleased her business is prospering. Her dream is to grow her travel agency, and she will use this loan to buy tour tickets. She is happy to have funding and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy tour tickets.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza sells milk and calves, she has been doing this for the past seven years. Her clients include any persons living in the neighbourhood, nearby villages and towns. 

“I generate a decent income through my animals and in return I take great care of them, and building a good sized stable is one action of kindness on my end,” she said smiling. 

Liza is married and in her mid forties; she has three children, aged 23, 20 and 17; the youngest one attends school. They all live in the northern part of the country; yet she was born in a district where Albania’s national hero “Skanderbeg” came from and she was very proud to let the loan officer know about it. She is living elsewhere now.

loans.use: to build the stable for her animals shown in the picture.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is a 60-year-old woman who runs a sari-sari (or convenience store) at her place in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in this business for more than 30 years now. This is the primary source of her income. As of this time, Virgincita is in need of additional funds for the expansion of her business. 

Virgincita is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy additional items to sell in her store such as rice, soda, dry goods and other snack foods.  With this loan she will be able to cater to more customers, thus increasing her sales and income. Virgincita dreams of expanding her business and making it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store such as rice, soda, dry goods and other snack foods.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 32 years old, married and has one child.  He runs a hotel business in Tala town and has been in this business for three years.

This will be his second loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy more stocks of food items for use in the hotel. These include flour, rice, cooking oil, sugar and utensils for use in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more furniture for the hotel.

He hopes to expand his business and open more hotels and become successful in his business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of food items for his hotel.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 62-year-old woman from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She has six grown children, and they are mostly on their own. For 35 years now, Carmelita has been into selling home-cooked snacks and operating a sari-sari (variety store), where she sells basic household commodities like shampoo, cooking oil, soap, sugar and noodles. 

She is asking for a loan of 22,000 PHP. She will use it to buy more ingredients like bananas, sugar, cooking oil and flour. Carmelita believes in the value of hard work, and she is optimistic in all her efforts. She hopes to save more in the future, so she can have additional capital and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients, like bananas, sugar, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Maria Emma

texts.es: Doña María se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas,  entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus seis hijos, doña maría desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solícita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes cremas todo por mayor  ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solicitada ella podrá obtener mejores ganancias y así seguirá dándole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
María makes her living selling all kinds of personal products, such as lotions, deodorants, creams, and other products. Her business is located in her place of residence. With the earnings that she makes from her sales, and with her husband’s help, they are able to cover their household expenses. She lives in her own house with her husband and their six children.
María wants to grow her business; therefore she is requesting a loan that will make it possible for her to buy everything she needs, such as perfumes, nail polish, deodorants, and creams, all at wholesale; she has a lot of customers to whom she can sell the products at affordable prices. With the help she has requested, she will be able to make more profits and in this way continue giving her family everything it needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, nail polish, deodorants, and creams, all at wholesale.

loans.name: Mwanauba

texts.en:
Mwanauba is married and blessed with four children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gloria Azucena

texts.es:
Gloria es madre soltera tres hijas. Hace ocho años se dedica a los oficios domésticos y el negocio de ropa interior para femenino y masculino negocio que inicio hace unos cuatro meses. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de perfumes; pero debido a la competencia prefiere comerciar ropa y le va mejor 
Doña Gloria compra su mercadería en la capital entonces tiene que viajar 95 kilómetros para llegar todas la semanas; por lo que tiene que levantarse a las cuatro de la mañana y regresando a las dos de la tarde esto porque al viajar hasta la capital le dan mejor precio y que tiene un buen proveedor.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  ropa para comercialízala entre ellas ropa para niños ya que es la que sus clientes le solicitan. Gloria a sido una persona que sabe administrar porque ya cancelo el primer crédito.
Con el préstamo estará satisfaciendo la necesidad de comprar sus prendas de vestir y poder vestir muchos niños dando precios muy accesibles. Considera que tendrá una mejor calidad de vida ya que ha demostrado ser una buena administradora con el préstamo anterior asume que tendrá mas ingresos y le cumplirá a sus hijos lo que tanto necesitan.
Gloria, se encuentra muy entusiasmada por que considera que a empezado a construir el futuro de sus hijos con el apoyo que la fundación campo; lo que más quiere es dar les estudio a sus hijas el sueño más grande es ver a sus hijas que se defienden ellas solas con lo aprendido.
texts.en:
Gloria is the single mother of three daughters. For eight years, she has done household chores. Four months ago, she began selling men's and women's underwear. Previously, she sold perfumes, but competition was fierce. She prefers selling clothing, and business is good. Gloria has to travel 95 kilometers each week to purchase her merchandise in the capital. She must get up at 4 AM and returns at 2 PM. She can buy at better prices and has a good supplier in the capital. 
 
She has applied to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy children's clothing, which is what her customers want, to sell. Gloria is a good administrator and has paid her first loan. With this loan, she will satisfy her need to buy garments and clothe many children at affordable prices. She believes she will have a better standard of living, as she managed her previous loan well. She thinks she will earn more and be able to give her children what they need.

Gloria is enthusiastic about the prospect of building her children's future with support from Fundación Campo. Her great wish is to educate her daughters, and she dreams of seeing her daughters taking care of themselves with the knowledge they acquire.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing, which is what her customers want, to sell.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael, who is a Mexican artisan working under the artistic name J. Blas, specializes in iron wall sculptures. He would like to invest in the purchase of tools and machinery for increased production.

Ismael has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I have always loved handicrafts. When I was 17, I started my own ceramic workshop. But I changed directions and began to work in wrought iron and blown glass. I experimented with sheets of iron to give my works more movement. We cut the metal sheets, hammer them into shape and weld them before treating to retard rust. Every piece created at my workshop goes hand in hand with originality, design and quality. We are always developing new designs and products."

"Thank you, amigos, thank you for this microcredit. And I call you my friends, because only friends selflessly help others during difficult times."

Use the link below to view Ismael's iron wall art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3675

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of tools and machinery for increased production

loans.name: Irma Irene

texts.es:
La socia Irma pertenece al banco comunal” CHASKA ÑAHUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia Irma continua con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente bien con su trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicito el crédito para pagar la alimentacion de sus hijos y su educacion.
La socia Irma está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the communal bank "CHASKA ÑAHUI". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Irma still has her business selling beauty products. She enjoys her business and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She is happy with her work as it brings her satisfaction on a personal as well as an economic level, since this is how she is able to bring up her family.

Irma is asking for a loan to pay for food and education for her children. She is happy to receive the loan and is committed to paying her instalments.

loans.use: to pay for food and education for her children.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a widow woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling foodstuffs of maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned high costs and seasonality as her major challenges. and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.
