With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase foods to sell at her kiosk, including maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in alpaca shawls and scarves. He would like to invest in the purchase of alpaca yarn to increase production.

Felipe has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"Ever since I can remember, I've been interested in all things textile. I formally stepped into the world of natural fibers in 1998, first with cotton knits and then alpaca wool. And just like with every new beginning, mine was very tough. To create something new and interesting, I look to my beloved Peru for inspiration, our cultural diversity, colors, and customs.

"Please receive my thanks and a hug for contributing to this microcredit. Be assured you will always receive a high-quality accessory that is made with love for this art while thinking of the person who will wear it."

Use the link below to view Felipe's alpaca accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8653

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of alpaca yarn to increase production.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 57 años , vive sola en su casa propia ya que su hija es totalmente independiente. Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa para hombres y mujeres adultos, generalmente entrega este pedido de manera ocasional ya sea quincenal o mensualmente, tiene clientes que se lo solicitan y se encarga de conseguir las prendas de otra ciudad, sus ganancias por esta actividad son muy buenas ya que la ropa que ofrece son de marcas de calidad y confeccionados con buenos materiales. Lleva en esta actividad un promedio de 06 años y afirma que no ha recibido ninguna queja por parte de sus clientes. Actualmente tiene un problema en las piernas y esto le obliga a caminar con la ayuda de muletas, por lo que algunas veces necesita de ayuda pero por lo general trabaja sola. Este es su séptimo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.2500 soles, comprará mercadería conformada por polos, camisas, blusas, shorts y pantalones de hombres y mujeres para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 57, lives alone in her own house, now that her daughter is independent. Rosa sells men's and women's clothing, usually by order, though occasionally on biweekly or monthly terms.  She has customers who ask her to find garments in other cities. Her income is very good, as she offers quality brands and well-made clothing. She has run her business for about six years and says she has never had a customer complaint. She now uses crutches to walk and sometimes needs help, as she has problems with her legs; normally, she works alone.

This is her seventh loan cycle with Kiva, and she is grateful for the funding to keep her business operating. She promises to make her payments on time. She will use the loan of 2500 soles to buy merchandise such as polos, shirts, blouses, shorts, and men's and women's pants to keep her business going.

loans.use: to buy polos, shirts, blouses, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: Maria de 40 años de edad desde hace muchos años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y maicillo, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honrada y  responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos. Junto a su esposo trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, que es su principal fuente de ingresos, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente.  Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, fertilizantes, etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 and has been farmer for many years. She carefully tends to her corn and maicillo, which allows her to support her household. She is hardworking, honest, and responsible. She lives with her family, which includes her husband and their three children. She and her husband work very hard to provide for their family and provide better living conditions than the ones they grew up in. 

Her knowledge of farming, which is her main income source and the only way she knows to make an honorable living, lets her support her family. She very much wants to be successful and has approached the institution for a loan, as it is planting season and she needs to start as soon as possible. She needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies: seed, manure, insecticide, fertilizer, etc. She trusts in God and her work to achieve an abundant harvest that will afford her and her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, insecticide, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con su abuela en casa propia, él tiene un puesto de comida en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. En un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. Cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que está ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. El cliente desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su abuela.
texts.en:
The client lives with his grandmother in his own house. He has had a food stand in his home for the last 2 years and with the profits he makes from his sales he is able to cover his household expenses. He is very hard-working, honest and responsible. He has the satisfaction of having regular customers since he is situated in a very busy place. 

The client wishes to expand his food stand by buying tables and chairs as well as raw ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit and vegetables etc. so he can vary his menu and have a bit more income. However he doesn't have enough income to make this investment, which is why he approached INTEGRAL to ask for a loan to be able to buy these items and so obtain better profits. This way he and his grandmother can have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs as well as raw ingredients such as rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables etc.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moises vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, desde hace varios años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maíz y maicillo con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas herbicidas, etc. dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Moises lives in his own house with his wife and children. For several years he has made his living with agriculture, which is his main source of income. He plants corn and sorghum. With what he earns, he is able to cover some of his household expenses. 
He wants to buy the supplies needed for his crops, such as compost, fertilizer, seeds, herbicide, etc. Since he does not have the economic resources for such an investment, he has made the decision to request a loan, because this is the only way he will be able to continue his cultivation process. 
Like all people who live in rural areas, he places his trust in agriculture because he doesn’t have any other source of income, and he wants to get ahead by doing the best he can with his crops. He hopes to have an abundant harvest that allows him to continue bringing the daily bread to his home and to pay off this loan.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, seeds, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus seis hijos, ella se dedica a trabajar en su molino, procesando todo tipo de alimentos, como maíz, frijoles, harinas, salsas, entre otros. Tiene ya algún tiempo con el negocio y posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocida por las personas de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, por los precios accesibles y por el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, es una mujer  emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy decidida a luchar por sus sueños, está trabajando muy duro todos los días para no decepcionar a su familia, se siente satisfecha y muy cómoda con su negocio, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio,  pero su molino ya no le da abasto, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un molino nuevo de trabajo, cuchillas, discos, etc.  para seguir con su engocio. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará seguridad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, 39, lives in her own house with her husband and six children. She operates a mill and processes all types of food products: corn, beans, flour, sauces, and more. She has had the business for some time, and this experience has helped her earn a good living. She is well know in the neighborhood and has many customers because she offers quality products, affordable prices, and unequaled service. She is enterprising, hardworking, and committed to achieving her dreams. She strives every day so that her family is not disappointed. She is happy and comfortable with her business. 

Demand has increased in recent weeks, but her mill cannot keep up. She has applied to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy a new mill, knives, disks, and more to keep her business going. She has good credit references and is responsible. She promises to pay her loan, and, at the same time, she hopes to give her family greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a new mill, knives, disks, etc.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is from Tiribe. She is married and has two children. She has a grocery store. She sells these products in the area of Tiribe.

She is a very hardworking person and a fighter, who does everything in order to improve her financial situation and give her family what they need. 

She is applying for this loan to buy supplies for her grocery store, such as fruit, vegetables, meats, bulk products, flour, rice, noodles and other items, in order to continue providing her customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, meats, bulk products, flour, rice, noodles and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her education fee.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 66 years old, married, and has seven adult children.  She is from Talibon,Bohol. She engages in the hog raising business, which she has been doing for more than 20 years.

Romana is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds for the pigs to grow healthy. In the future, she would like to expand her hog raising business into a piggery to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a single mother of one child, who attends school and is still under her care. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family.

Joyce operates a business selling clothes, which she sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma operates a firewood-selling business, selling from home to her villagers. In addition, she sells fresh water which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge in her business of high costs of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to increase her monthly income.

With the loan, Mwanajuma wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба жительница района Хуросон. Ей 41 год. Она мать двоих сыновей и четверых дочерей. Ее муж работает дежурным в автозаправочном центре. Махбуба скромная и трудолюбивая женщина. Вот уже более 8 лет как она занимается куплей-продажей крупнорогатого скота. В ведении бизнеса ей помогают старшие дети и муж. Сейчас в ее хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы и 2 теленка. Махбуба имеет цель увеличить поголовье продаваемого скота. Она просит кредит для закупа трех телят. В дальнейшем она планирует расширить свой животноводческий бизнес и улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Mahbuba is a resident of the Khuroson region of Tajikistan.  She is 41 years old, and a mother to two sons and four daughters.  Her husband works as an attendant at a refueling station.  Mahbuba is a modest and hardworking woman.  For more than eight years, she has bought and sold livestock.  Her older children and her husband help her with this business.  Now, she has two cows and two calves.  Mahbuba has set of goal of increasing her herd.  She is asking for a loan to buy three calves.  In the future, she plans to expand her livestock business and improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy three calves to increase her herd

loans.name: Candida Ceferina

texts.es: Cándida de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 7 años gracias a esos años tiene el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, comercializa sus cosechas en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Cándida esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para su cosecha abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. para seguir con sus cultivos y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Cándida is forty-four years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their three children.  She has made a living in agriculture for seven years.  Thanks to those years, she has the necessary knowledge to take care of her crops.  She sells her harvest items at the different markets that are close to her place of residence.  With the profits that she makes, she is able to cover the home expenses.

Cándida is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy the necessary supplies for the harvest: manure, fertilizer, seeds, herbicide, pest control substances, etc.  This will allow her to continue with her crops, and to be able to give her family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds, herbicide, pest control substances, etc.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es: La cliente vive en la ciudad de Machala.  Empezó su negocio por medio de un familiar que vive en el extranjero, quien le realiza giros.  Con ese dinero, ella inició vendiéndole ropa a personas conocidas y amigos.  Posteriormente se capitalizó y logró ir incrementando su negocio.  Es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y trabaja sola, la mayor parte del tiempo por las tardes.  Utilizará el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ropa y zapatos para comercializarlos.
texts.en: This client lives in the city of Machala.  She started her business by means of a family member who lives abroad and wires her money.  With that money she started selling clothes to acquaintances and friends.  She then got capital and managed to continue expanding the business.  She’s a single mother of two children and she works alone, most of the time in the afternoons.  She will use the loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Almagul

texts.ru: Алмагул, 36 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Разведением скота начала заниматься более 10 лет назад. На сегодняшний день благодаря ее упорству и целеустремленности развела небольшое хозяйство, дополнительно занимается полеводством. Алмагул хочет и дальше приумножить поголовье скота и заниматься полеводством, в связи с этим обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 20000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Алмагул входит в состав группы "Ленин", в которой участвуют еще 2 человека кроме нее. На доходы от кредита Алмагул хочет увеличить поголовье скота в своем хозяйстве, а также, в будущем хочет дать хорошее образование своим детям.
texts.en: Almagul is 36 years old, married and has three children, school-aged or younger.  Her spouse helps her with her farm.  She began breeding cattle more than 10 years ago.  Today, thanks to her hard work and dedication, she has a small farm where she also grows crops.  Almagul wants to further increase her herd and agricultural work and to do so, she's turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Patners for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy a cow.  Amagul is part of the group "Lenin" that has two other members besides her.  She wants to use the income from the loan to expand her herd and farm and also, in the future, she wants to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Patricia Jacqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Guillermo Balda se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Patricia, tiene 32 años de edad, está separada pero de su relación pasada tiene dos hijos de 15 y de 12 años que estudian en colegio.

Doña Patricia para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos con el fruto del trabajo se dedica a realizar trabajos domésticos en una casa de la localidad, pero para obtener recursos a parte de lo que gana en su trabajo también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual aprovecha sus ratos libres y los fines de semana, ella deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Gracias a los créditos pudo empezar con este negocio que le permite ganar algo extra para salir adelante con sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y todo tipo de prendas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ella puede salir adelante sola con sus hijos. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank Guillermo Balda meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi.  This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its craftsmanship, which is renowned at both the national and international level.  This is the place of the famous Panama hats.  

Patricia lives here.  She is thirty-two years old.  She is separated, but has two children (ages 15 and 12) from this past relationship who are now studying in high school.

In order to move her children ahead, Patricia makes a living in doing domestic chores at another home in her town.  However, in order to obtain more income apart from this work, she also makes a living as a merchant, selling all types of clothing.  She sells door to door, and takes advantage of her free moments and weekends.  She sells her merchandise on credit, and collects payments every fifteen days.  Thanks to the loans, she was able to start this clothing business, which allows her to earn extra money for her children.

This loan is for the purchase of pants, blouses, and all other types of clothing items.  She has been a member of this communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because the loans allow her to continue moving ahead alone with her children.

Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, and every other type of clothing item.

loans.name: Mkasi

texts.en:
Mkasi is married and has three school going children. They live in their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a business selling Khangas (women's cloth wraps), selling from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas for resale.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es: La cliente vive en la ciudad de Machala.  Inició su negocio de venta de comida y CDs con la ayuda de sus hijos años atrás y se mantiene hasta la actualidad.  Trabaja todos los días , incluso los fines de semana con la ayuda de su hija.  Es soltera pero tiene 4 hijos, quienes trabajan junto con sus respectivas esposas.  Empleará el dinero para la compra de mesas, sillas y víveres para su negocio.
texts.en: The client lives in the city of Machala.  She started her business selling food and CDs with help from her children years ago and is still in business to date.  She works every day, even weekends with her daughter’s help.  She’s single but has four sons who work alongside their respective wives.  She will use the money to buy tables, chairs and foodstuffs for her business.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and food items.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a widowed woman. She has two children, both of whom are adults. Mwanaisha owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanaisha operates a coconut-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other coconut sellers in the area.
 
With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Yerlena Verónica

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Machala, empezó en esta actividad cuando fue abandonada por su esposo.  Recibió la ayuda de allegados, logró adquirir una máquina de coser, con la cual inició su negocio.  Posteriormente realizó costuras a familiares y amigos, para luego recorrer y comercializar sus productos elaborados.  Ella es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal.  Aplicará el dinero del crédito en la adquisición de telas para la producción de su negocio.
texts.en: The client lives in the city of Machala.  She started this activity when she was abandoned by her husband.  She got help from people who were close to her and managed to acquire a sewing machine she used to start her business.  She then started to sew for family members and friends and later on started to go around selling the clothes she made.  She’s a single mother of three children who attend a public school.  She’ll use the money from the loan to buy fabric for her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Punte Killman - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PUNTE KILLMAN – 32 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Verónica tiene 19 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, con el anterior crédito le fue bien ya que lo utilizo para mejorar su negocio,   la Sra. Verónica va a usar este préstamo para compra de insumos como abarrotes para la realización de sus comidas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es por falta de efectivo para la compra de estos insumos necesarios para la elaboración de su comida,  la Sra. Veronica se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
The Enterprising Bank, PUNTE KILLMAN-32, is made up of eight members; six women and two men. The president of the bank is Veronica who is 19 years. She sells food. 

This is her second loan with the institution; the previous loan went well as she used it to improve her business. Veronica will use this loan to purchase supplies such as groceries to make her food. Her reason for requesting this loan is the lack of money to purchase these necessary supplies to make her food. 

Veronica is happy and grateful to the institution for its support in providing her with this loan as it is the only activity that allows her to support her and her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as groceries.

loans.name: Martha Magdalena

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Machala, inició su negocio con la ayuda de su difunto esposo tiempo atrás.  Ambos lograron montar la tienda que hasta la actualidad, tanto ella como su hijo mantienen funcionando.  El estudia en la escuela fiscal del sector.  Necesita el dinero del préstamo para la compra de productos de consumo y de bazar.
texts.en: The client lives in the city of Machala.  She started the business with help from her late husband some time ago.  Together they were able to set up the store that’s still in operation today.  She and her son keep it going.  He attends the local public school.  She needs the money from the loan to buy food and household items.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: El cliente vive en la ciudad de Machala, en base a sus ahorros implementó la venta de bebidas hidratantes para luego incrementar su negocio por medio de la compra de computadoras.  Ahora mantiene un ciber con cabinas telefónicas el cual funciona de 9 am a 11 pm.  Ella es casada, su esposo posee un camión con el cual realiza recorrido de entrega de bebidas gaseosas.  Tienen un hijo el cual asiste a la escuela fiscal del sector.  Necesita invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de computadoras para su local.
texts.en: The client lives in the city of Machala.  She used her savings to start a business selling hydrating beverages and then added to the business with the purchase of computers.  Now she has an Internet café with phone booths that operates from 9am to 11pm.  She’s married and her husband owns a truck that he uses to deliver carbonated soft-drinks.  They have a son attending the local public school.  She needs to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of computers for her café.

loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Machala.  Su esposo la ayudó inicialmente para que pueda emprender en el negocio de venta de cosméticos, debido a que una amiga la incentivó y ayudó para que por medio de esto, tenga un ingreso económico.  Básicamente labora en las tardes, que es cuando sale a entregar el producto y también a cobrar a sus clientes.  Es casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja como oficial de planta y sus hijos de 18 y 12 años, estudian en la escuela fiscal.  Necesita el préstamo para invertir en mercadería para su actividad comercial.
texts.en: The client lives in the city of Machala.  Her husband helped her initially to start a business selling cosmetics because a girlfriend encouraged her and helped so that she could earn her own income this way.  She basically works afternoons which is when she goes out to deliver product and collect payment from her customers.  She’s married with two children.  Her husband works as a plant supervisor and her children who are 18 and 12 years of age attend public school.  She needs the loan to buy merchandise for her commercial activity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is from Tiribe. She operates a food store, which she has been doing for six years.  She describes herself as a very hardworking and enterprising woman who struggles to be able to cover her daily expenses. 

Mwanatumu is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a variety of products, such as baked goods, canned goods, noodles, dairy products, and other necessary supplies. One of her dreams is to expand her business and have a meat counter.

loans.use: to purchase baked goods, canned goods, noodles, dairy products, and other products.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is from the town of Tiribe and has three children, all of whom attend school. Fatuma has a stall in town, where she sells fruits and green vegetables.

Thanks to her work, she is able to help her children finish their studies and pay for all the household needs. She is a dedicated person who has demonstrated that she works hard to meet her obligations. 

She is asking for this loan to buy sacks of mangoes, watermelons, bananas and vegetables so that she can continue working to meet her goals.

loans.use: to buy sacks of mangoes, watermelons, bananas and vegetables

loans.name: Bosco Felipe

texts.es: El cliente vive en la ciudad de Machala, empezó trabajando como empleado.  Durante este tiempo logró ahorrar un cantidad de dinero que le permitió colocar un puesto de frutas y verduras en la feria de su barrio que se alzan los domingos.  Labora todos los días durante la mañana, de Lunes a Domingo.  Es separado y tiene una hija, quien estudia en una escuela fiscal y además le ayuda en su negocio especialmente los fines de semana.  Necesita el préstamo para la compra de abarrotes de su puesto.
texts.en: The client lives in the city of Machala.  He started working as an employee and during that time saved up a bit of money that made it possible for him to open a fruit and vegetable stand in his neighborhood's street market that takes place on Sundays.  He works mornings every day of the week from Monday to Sunday.  He’s separated and has a daughter who attends public school and also helps him in the business especially on weekends.  He needs the loan to buy groceries for his stand.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Aida

texts.en:
Ma. Aida is 54 years old from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has four grown children and they are living on their own. Ma. Aida cooks homemade snacks like binoylos (fried dough sprinkled with sugar) and bread. This has been her business for 10 years now. She is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy flour, baking powder and oil. 

Ma. Aida is greatly helped by loans in sustaining her daily needs. She hopes to have a bigger business someday to better support herself.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking powder and oil

loans.name: Ma. Celiet

texts.en:
Ma. Celiet is 30 years old and from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 9 and 10. Her husband worked as a fisherman, while she has operated a sari-sari store for ten years now. From her business, she earns an average profit of 5,000 PHP per month. 

She is asking for a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, and also school supplies for her children. 

Each day, it is her goal to continue improving, and she hopes that in the future she can continue to support her children in going to school.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, and also school supplies for her children

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 52 años,  se dedica al crianza de ganado y al comercio del mismo,  comercializa sus productos en la comunidad de Batallas,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Juan va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ganado su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que quiere  tener más ganado ya que esta época es de mucha demanda, El Sr. Juan enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el clima el tener que transportar el ganado a los distintos puntos de venta,  pero el tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad con la que trata a su clientela y  va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo para mejorar la alimentación de  su ganado,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Juan is 52 years old and works raising and selling cattle. He sells his cattle in the community of Batallas. This loan is his first cycle with the field partner. He is going to use the loan to buy cattle, because he says that at the moment there is a lot of demand for them.

Some of the challenges that Juan faces in his business are the climate and also the need to transport the cattle to the different points of sale. But Juan says he has many customers because he treats his customers well. He is going to use the profits he makes to buy fodder, which he needs to buy every so often to improve his cattle’s nutrition.

Juan’s wish is for his business to be stable and profitable so that his income would increase.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Benita Francisca

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Guillermo Balda se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Benita, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos  ya son mayores de edad y uno de 5 años que estudia en escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Doña Benita es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta para lo cual sale a recorrer la ciudad más que todo en las mañanas ya que a esa hora su hijo está en la escuela y puede salir sin ningún problema, ella deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada quince días, para comprar su mercadería viaja a Guayaquil o a Ambato ya que allá consigue más barato y mayor variedad lo cual le gusta a sus clientes, ella lleva más de 6 años en este negocio y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y todo tipo de prenda. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The “Guillermo Balda” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Benita, 53, lives here.  She’s married and has five children.  Four of them are already adults and one of them who is five-years-old attends school.  Her husband is a driver.

Benita is a very good mother and wife who in order to contribute to household expenses works in commerce selling all types of clothes door to door.  To do so she heads out into the city mostly in the morning which is when her son is in school and she can go out problem-free.  She sells her merchandise on credit and collects every fifteen days.  In order to buy her merchandise she travels to Guayaquil or to Ambato because she gets them less expensively and in greater variety there and that pleases her customers.  She’s been in this business more than six years and has done very well.

This loan is to buy pants, blouses and all types of clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for four cycles and she likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and all types of clothes.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Zaida es una mujer de 44 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Zaida no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Pedagogía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar deliciosos postres para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Zaida trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de sembrado, riego, cosecha, y otros, Zaida trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Zaida se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, ya que actualmente ella prepara sus alimentos en una cocina a leña, la cual es peligrosa para su uso, de esta manera Zaida podrá preparar adecuadamente sus alimentos y tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio negocio comercial.
texts.en:
Zaida is a 44-year-old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona. She is a very kind person and an enthusiastic and hard worker who dedicates all her efforts to come out ahead. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and the necessity that she had to work from very young helping her parents, Zaida could not study the professional degree of pedagogy that she wanted. In her free time she likes to prepare delicious desserts to share with her family.

By her own initiative, with much persistence and dedication, Zaida works as a field worker in agriculture in her city. She plants, waters, picks etc... Zaida works every day from very early in the morning and works for approximately 10 hours. She is happy with her work and believes it is going well because of her performance and her friendly treatment that she provides to everyone.

Zaida is very grateful to Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help offered she will be able to purchase a stove because now she prepares her food in a wood stove, which is dangerous. This way Zaida will be able to adequately prepare her food and have better security and health so she will continue working and making an effort to achieve her big dream of having her own business.

loans.use: to purchase a stove.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, Rehema has operated a coconut and brooms shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in her business of high costs of transportation. Rehema dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 15,000, Rehema wants to purchase sacks of coconuts and bundles of brooms, and to pay for transportation. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts and bundles of brooms, and to pay for transportation.

loans.name: Ngumbi

texts.en:
Ngumbi, a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school, lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past six years, Ngumbi has operated a food stall from home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality, and dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

Ngumbi is requesting a loan of Ksh 25,000 to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice.

loans.name: Sherlicia

texts.en:
Sherlicia  is 41 years old, married, and has seven children.  She is from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in the mat weaving business. Her husband works as a deliveryman.  

Sherlicia is requesting a loan for 3,000 PHP, which she will use to buy materials and dyes. In the future, she would like to expand her mat weaving business to support her family and her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as burri and dye

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two young children. She works hard and relies on selling home-cooked meals so she can provide for her family’s needs. Her business has been doing well for a year now. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients such as pork, chicken, fish, seasonings, coconut, cooking oil and vegetables. This would help her continue her business while trying her best to provide for her children. 

Maribel would like to venture into other business opportunities in the future to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken, fish, seasonings, coconut, cooking oil and vegetables.

loans.name: Narcita

texts.en:
Narcita is a 71-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three grown children and has been in the restaurant business for 13 years now. She sells viands, cooked rice, vegetables and seafood.  

Narcita is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan for additional capital in her business.  The loan will be used to buy meat, vegetables and seasonings for her menu.

In the future, Narcita hopes to expand her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and seasonings for her menu.

loans.name: Carmen Pilar

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Guillermo Balda se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 8 y 6 años y un  bebé de 6 meses, los dos mayores estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Carmen es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, compra su mercadería en Guayaquil y Huaquillas ya que allá consigue más barato y con esto le queda más ganancias, ella empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco el cual les permite salir adelante y más cuando su marido no tiene trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y todo tipo de prendas. Lleva 3 años en el Banco Comunal.

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Guillermo Balda” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Carmen, 25, lives here.  She’s married and has three children who are eight and six years old and a six-month-old baby; the two older ones attend school.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Carmen is a very good mother and wife who in order to help cover household expenses works in commerce.  She sells all types of clothes door to door on credit and collects every 8 days.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and in Huaquillas because she gets them for a lower price there so she earns higher profits.  She started her business with the first loan she got from the communal bank which helps her continue getting ahead especially when her husband is without work.

She’ll use this loan to buy pants, blouses and all types of clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for three years.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and all types of clothes.

loans.name: Sabougnouma  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA  II sont constitués par des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Manakoro  un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont  l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Malla   au milieu  dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice  de 100 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called SABOUGNOUMA II are made up of married women with an average age of 37 and on average five children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Manakoro, one of the villages of the community of Guégnaka, prefecture of Dioîla, region of Koulikoro, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of being better able to organize their activities at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown are peanuts, millet, and beans. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. 

With this loan, Malla, in the middle of the seated row, intends to buy farm inputs, small equipment, and pay for plowing etc. to maintain about one hectare of millet and peanuts. Her produce is sold in the town of Fana, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She hopes to make a profit of 100,000 F CFA per growing season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small equipment.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
From the town of Talibon, Bohol, Mary Ann is a 26-year-old married mother of three children, ages two, five and eight. Mary Ann has been selling coconut wine for three years now to support her family. Coconut wine is also fermented to be made into vinegar.

Mary Ann is in need of additional funds for the expansion of her business and so is requesting a loan to buy more coconut wine to resell in the community. This will enable her to cater to more customers, thus increasing her sales and income. Mary Ann dreams of expanding her business and making it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
48-year-old Martina is from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is married, with five dependent children to support. 

Martina works as a  fish vendor to provide her family what they need. She is asking for a PHP 22,000 loan to buy fresh fish, squid, and shrimp. 

Martina hopes that with her hard work, she will be able to educate her children. Any profit will be used for her family's daily consumption and school fees.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, squid, and shrimp.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
From the community of Talibon, Bohol, Norma is a 56-year-old widow with grown children. For 20 years she has been operating a sari-sari store that sells seasonings, biscuits, toiletries, noodles and canned goods; she is now requesting a loan to buy additional such items.

In the future, Norma plans to buy more products and items that she does not now carry to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell items such as canned goods, noodles, toiletries and seasonings

loans.name: Edith Marlene

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Guillermo Balda se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Edith, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, una de ellos aún vive con ella. Su esposo está enfermo y no trabaja.

Doña Edith además de ser una gran madre y esposa también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene unas vitrinas, trabaja a base de pedidos y es así que la mayoría de ropa que ella trae de sus viajes es para entregar. Trabaja tres  días a las semanas y todos los fines de semana, dejan a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene 5  años que se dedica a esta actividad desde que su esposo enfermo y es así que con sus ganancias que pueden salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.  Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le brindan los créditos. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y que su esposo mejore.
texts.en:
The Guillermo Balda communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisanal crafts nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous paja toquilla hats. 

This is where Edith lives. She is 56 years old, married and the mother of six grown children. One of them still lives with her. Her husband is ill and doesn't work. 

Edith, in addition to being a great mother and wife is also a merchant. She sells all types of clothing door to door. She also sells from her house where she has display cases. She works filling orders and that is why most of the clothes she brings from her trips is to deliver to customers. She works three days a week and every weekend, selling on credit and collecting every two weeks. She has been doing this activity for 5 years, since her husband became ill, nd that is how, with her earnings, they can get ahead.

She is going to use the loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing. She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help the loans always give her. 

Her dreams are to get ahead and for her husband to get better.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth operates a charcoal business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a farming business which earns her another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase four sacks of charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a stock of hair extensions, bridal pieces for hair styles, creams and hair style gels, supplies, and also PR and graphics.

loans.name: Ángela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ángela tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera. Es una mujer emprendedora que lleva 2 años de experiencia en el negocio de venta de ropa 

Las compras de la mercadería las realiza en cada fin de semana para surtir su puesto que está ubicado en la ciudad.

EL préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar de más ropa y más que todo ropa interior porque actualmente no ofrece ese producto. La necesidad a satisfacer será la de capital de trabajo que de momento no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio. 

A futuro dice que planea tener un negocio más grande, mas surtido de todo tipo de mercadería.
texts.en:
Ángela is 29 years old and single.  She is an enterprising woman who has two years of experience with a business selling clothing.  She purchases her merchandise each weekend to stock her stall, which is located in the city.

She is requesting this loan from Fundacion Camp to purchase more clothing, especially underwear, since she does not currently offer that product.  She needs the working capital since currently she does not have enough money to purchase more merchandise for her business.

In the future, she plans to have a larger business that is well stocked with all types of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Sabougnouma  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA  IV sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Manakoro  un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont  l’arachide, du mil et du haricot). Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,   N'DIE  la personne assise à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de 45 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the group called SABOUGNOUMA IV are married women with an average age of 40 and they have on average four children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Manakoro, one of the villages of the community of Guégnaka, prefecture of Dioîla, region of Koulikoro, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of being better able to organize their activities at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown are peanuts, millet, and beans. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. 

With this loan, N'Die, the person sitting on the left, intends to buy farm inputs, small equipment, and pay for plowing etc. to maintain about one hectare of millet and peanuts. Her produce is sold in the town of Fana, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She hopes to make a profit of 45,000 F CFA per growing season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small equipment.

loans.name: Sabougnouma   Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMA  III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Manakoro  un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioîla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur septième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Mamou  la première personne à droite  dans le rang des déboutes, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réalise un bénéfice de 45 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called SABOUGNOUMA III are married women with an average age of 41 and on average five children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Manakoro, one of the villages of the community of Guégnaka, prefecture of Dioîla, region of Koulikoro, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of being better able to organize their activities at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown are peanuts, millet, and beans. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. 

With this loan, Mamou, the first person standing on the right, intends to buy farm inputs, small equipment, and pay for plowing etc. to maintain about one hectare of millet and peanuts. Her produce is sold in the town of Fana, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 45,000 F CFA per growing season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small equipment.

loans.name: Sithabile

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 36-year-old Sithabile from Bulawayo. She is married and has two children, and both are attending school.  

Sithabile runs a retail business selling clothes, footwear and blankets. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges faced are stiff competition from larger retailers who offer credit facilities and high import duty. 

Sithabile has requested a loan of $500 to replenish stocks. She wants to buy kids’ tracksuits, jeans, jackets, woolen hats, and clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family. 

In the future, Sithabile plans to open a clothing boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Ricardo Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo es un hombre de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposa y su bebé recién nacido, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Ricardo pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ricardo trabaja en su pequeño de alquiler de cabinas de internet, el cuenta con buen numero de computadoras las cuales pone al servicio de un promedio de 20 clientes diarios, Ricardo trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Ricardo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar una cuna, el ajuar, biberones y otros artículos que necesita para poder brindarles mejores cuidado a su bebé, de esta manera Ricardo desea brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a 22 year old man. He lives in the city of Ica with his wife and newborn baby, whom he lives and who are his main reason for living. He is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who puts all of his efforts into getting his family ahead. Thanks to his efforts and his parents' help, Ricardo was able to study the major of Computer Programming like he wanted to. In his free time he likes to relax listening to music and at times he cooks some delicious Tallarines Rojos to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with mush hard work and dedication, Ricardo works in his little business renting internet booths. He has several computers which are in service for an average 20 customers a day. Ricardo works every day since the early morning hours and he can do it for approximately 12 hours a day. He is content doing his work and thinks it is going well for him because of the good prices and the friendly treatment he gives to others.

Ricardo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, he will be able to by a crib, clothing, bibs and other items that he needs to take better care of his baby a better quality of life. This way, Ricardo wants to offer more security and well being for his family. He will keep working and striving for his big dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: to buy items for his baby.

loans.name: María Mericia

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos. Es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora quien ha salido adelante criando a sus dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación campo, es para comprar quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, maíz, para elaborar las pupusas, mesas, sillas para ampliar su negocio y reparar la plancha donde cose las pupusas. 

A futuro,  planea que sus hijos sean unos profesionales que luchen por salir adelante y además poder tener un negocio más grande para dar un mejor servio y atender mejor a sus clientes
texts.en:
María is 40-years-old and a single mother of two children.  She’s an enterprising, hardworking woman who has gotten ahead raising her two children.  She works making and selling pupusas [filled, grilled corn cakes].

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy string cheese, pork, beans and corn to make the pupusas and tables and chairs to enlarge the business and also to repair the grill she uses to cook the pupusas. 

In future, she hope her children will become professional who will strive to get ahead and she also hopes to be able to have a bigger business to provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, tables and chairs and to repair the grill.

loans.name: Gabriela Josefina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Gabriela, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre actualmente, ella tiene dos hijos de 8 y 7 años de edad de su antiguo compromiso los mismos que estudian en escuela. Su marido es comerciante.

Doña Gabriela con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, ella aprovecha de salir todas las mañanas ya que a esa hora sus hijos están en la escuela y se le hace más fácil ya que en la tarde tiene que ayudarles en sus tareas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil una vez al mes o de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual lucha por salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  5 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 
 
Su sueño es que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The “El Pedregal” communal bank meets every fifteen days in El Pedregal in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place that’s known for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the joy of its people.

Gabriela, 26, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship at present and has two children who are 8 and 7 years of age from her previous relationship; they attend school.  Her husband’s a merchant.

In order to earn a bit on her own to get ahead, Gabriela works in commerce; she sells all types of clothes door to door and also at home where she has a small locale.  She takes advantage of mornings when her children are in school to go out selling; this is easier than in afternoons because she has to help them with their homework.  She sells on credit and collects every fifteen days.  She goes to Guayaquil once a month or as needed to buy her merchandise.  She’s been in this line of work for five years and she strives to move forward.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank for five years and likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her dream is that her children will lack nothing.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Naila Josefina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Naila, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 10 y 4 años de edad, los mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido es obrero.
 
Doña Naila es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día ya sea en la mañana o en la tarde ya que no tiene horario fijo para sus recorridos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual le ayuda a su marido con los gastos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “El Pedregal” communal bank meets every fifteen days in El Pedregal in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place that’s known for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the joy of its people.

Naila, 32, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three children who are 11, 10 and 4 years of age.  The older ones attend school and her husband is a laborer.


Naila is a housewife who in order to earn her own resources to help her husband with household expenses works selling Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week about two or three hours daily either in the morning or in the afternoon since she does not have a fixed schedule to do her routes.  She sells on credit and collects every 8 days.  She’s been in this line of work for three years and helps her husband with expenses this way.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  This is the fourth cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: María Lucila

texts.es:
María es una mujer emprendedora que tiene 43 años de edad, acompañada y con cuatro hijos de 19, 13, 10 y 7 años de edad. Es una persona que se dedica al comercio de carne de cerdos y de res actividad que realiza desde hace 12 años. A ella la probé de carne una vecina que destaza y ella gana por ir a vender, es una persona que se sacrifica por qué tiene que llevar el sustento diario a sus tres hijos menores y la última de ellas sufre de  una enfermedad y tiene que dedicarle mucho tiempo. Se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana y tiene que viajar hasta 12 kilómetros para vender; regresando des pues de ocho horas. Antes de ir a vender tiene que dejar la comida para dos hijos ya que uno le ayuda a vender y a cargar la carne para poder ganar un poco de dinero.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cerdos y destazarlos ella misma; por que últimamente quien le probé de carne la ha dejado sin trabajar y comprara cerdos y los venderá considerando que pueda ganar un poco de dinero. Con el préstamo estará satisfaciendo la necesidad de trabajar todos los días ya que para ella es necesario tener el trabajo permanente por la inversión de la hija. Además, de satisfacer a sus clientes que la esperan por su calidad de carne que les lleva  logrando así mejores ingresos y así poder comprar lo que a sus hijos les hace falta 
En el futuro se considera una persona independiente que con el trabajo de hoy, se podrá autofinanciar su propio negocio y Dios le haga un milagro que se le aliente su hija y que no sufra tanto  y siempre tener fuerzas para trabajar.
texts.en:
María is an entrepreneur. She is 43 years old, is in a relationship, and has four children ages 19, 13, 10 and 7. She works selling pork and beef, which she has been doing for 12 years now. A neighbor who butchers provides María with her meat, and María earns a living by going out and selling it. María makes a lot of sacrifices because she has to feed her three youngest children, the youngest of whom has an illness that requires a lot of María’s time. María gets up at 4 a.m. to travel 12 kilometers to sell her products, returning after eight hours. Before she leaves to sell her products, she has to leave food for two of her children. One of her children comes with her to help carry and sell the meat so that they can earn a little money.

María is requesting a loan from the field partner to buy pigs and butcher them herself. This is because recently the person who provides her with meat has left María without work. María will buy pigs and later sell the meat, as she believes in this way she’ll be able to earn a little money. With the loan María will be able to work everyday, as she needs permanent work so that she can look after her daughter. Moreover, with the loan she will be able to look after her customers, who look for the quality meat María brings them. She will then be able to improve her income and buy what her children need. In the future she would like to be independent, and she hopes that with the work she is doing today, she will be able to self-finance her business in the future. María hopes that God will provide a miracle so that her daughter gets better and does not suffer so much, and she also hopes that she herself will always have the strength to work.

loans.use: to buy pigs and butcher them herself.

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 14, 12 y  5 años de edad, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y el menor en  escuela. El marido es jardinero.
 
Doña María con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, perfumes y bisutería, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual sale tres días a la semana,  también vende en su casa lugar donde tiene  unas vitrinas para mostrar su mercadería, ella deja a crédito  y cobra cada 8 días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y en varias ocasiones a Huaquillas y Colombia. Tiene 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y tiene mucha clientela.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, perfumes y bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 3 años y le gusta porque con los créditos puede comprar más barato lo cual le deja mejores ganancias. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The El Pedregal community bank meets every two weeks at the site of Pedregal in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, which is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional celebrations of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the happiness of its inhabitants.

Maria is 30 years old, lives in a common law marriage, and has three children who are 5, 12, and 14 years old.  The two oldest are in high school and the youngest is in school.  Her husband is a gardener.  

Maria wanted to earn money on her own so that she could help her husband with the household expenses, so she started a business selling all types of clothing, perfumes, and jewelry.  She sells from door to door three days a week and also sells in her home, where she has cases to display her merchandise.  She gives credit and collects every eight days.  She goes to Guayaquil to purchase her merchandise, and sometimes goes to Huaquillas and Colombia.  She has done this work for eight years and has many customers.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, perfumes, and jewelry.  She has been in the community bank for three years and likes it because with the loans, it is possible to purchase things at lower prices, so she can earn more profit.

Her dream is to have a clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, perfumes, and jewelry.

loans.name: Ashurboy

texts.ru: Ашурбой уже третий цикл кредитуется в ИМОНе. Он честный и порядочный человек и поэтому имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Ашурбою 43 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ашурбой как заботливый отец, направляет все свои силы для обеспечения семьи. Он более 22 лет занимается скотоводством. Он покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и потом продает на местном рынке. Он имеет своих клиентов на местном рынке. Ашурбой уже несколько лет планирует построить новый дом, но не имеет денег. Его дом не отвечает стандартам жилья, и он должен срочно построить свой новый дом. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 15000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина, песок и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ashurboy is already on his third loan cycle with IMON.  He is an honest and decent man so he has a good credit history.  Ashurboy is 43 years old, married and has four children.  He's an attentive father and focuses his efforts on providing for his family.  For more than 22 years he has worked with livestock.  He buys cattle, fattens them up over a few months and sells them at a local market where he has his own clients.  Ashurboy has planned for a few years to build a new home but he doesn't have the money.  His house isn't up to housing codes and he must immediately build a new one.  He is asking for a loan of 15,000 KGS to buy building materials like cement, wood, sand, etc.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, soil to build a new house

loans.name: Esanaly

texts.ru: Эсанали четвертый цикл кредитуется в ИМОНе. Он добросовестный, честный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Эсанали работает более 5 лет в заводе по производству цемента. Его жена работает медсестрой. Он нуждается финансовой поддержке. Эсанали планирует использовать кредит для покупки строительных материалов для постройки жилого дома. Он хочет достроить новый дом до зимы. Он запрашивает займ для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, кирпич и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en: Esanaly is on his fourth loan cycle with IMON.  He is a conscientious, honest and dedicated man.  He is married and has two children.  Esanaly has worked in a cement factory for more than five years.  His wife works as a nurse.  He needs financial support.  Esanaly plans to use this loan to buy building materials to build a new home.  He wants to build it before winter.  He will use the funds to buy materials like cement, bricks, etc.  He awaits your kindness as this loan will help him improve his family's circumstances.

loans.use: To buy cement, bricks, etc., to build a house

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 57 years old and the father of one child, who is currently studying in school. 

For the last three years, Julius has earned a living by selling goods and services from his general store in Malindi where he earns a monthly profit of KES 30,000. Julius was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and he is applying for his first loan of KES 70,000/= to purchase additional stock needed for his business. 

He will use the profit from the business to pay for school fees, purchase food for the family, and expand the current business. Julius hopes to own his own supermarket in future, so as to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for his general store business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 28-year-old rice and corn farmer from the community of Talibon,  Bohol.  She is married with two children ages 2 and 7. Rowena’s husband works as a carpenter. They are struggling to keep their farm while meeting the needs of their children. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. 

Rowena knows that with proper care and good growth attributed to fertilizer she can be successful in her farming. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gema Dolores

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal El Pedregal se reúne cada quince días en el sitio el Pedregal  en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Gema, tiene 21 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene una hija de 3 años de edad, ella vive en casa de los padres. 

Doña Gema es una joven mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con su esfuerzo sacar adelante a su hija para lo cual se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catálogos, carteras  y ciertos perfumes y bisutería, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a recorrer por la ciudad donde tiene muchos sus clientes, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, ella tiene 1 año con este negocio el cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución y por lo cual está muy agradecida, así ella se gana el sustento de ella y el de su hija.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, carteras, perfumes, entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva más de un año en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.  

Su sueño es que a su hija no le falte nada.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Pedregal" meets every 15 days in El Pedregal, in Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a place that is known for its commercial activity, its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and the happiness of its people.

This is where Gema, 21, lives.  She is separated, but has a 3 year-old daughter from this relationship.  She lives in her parent's house.

Gema is a young woman who likes to be self-sufficient.  With her efforts, she is supporting her daughter.
